loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yoland R. F. is a mother of 4 children. She is the leader of a ProMujer women's group named "Futuro," and she has a long-established credit history. She is dedicated to the production of recycled doors that she sells in the market in the "16 de julio" neighborhood of El Alto.

7 years ago, Yolanda started borrowing with ProMujer with a loan of just $100. She used her first loan to but materials and launch her business in Pacajes, an neighboring area of the city. She has her own space in the market, and with help from her husband she runs her business and works hard to sustain her family.

Yolanda needs capital to invest in her business and meet the demand that exists for her product. With the help of ProMujer, she is also working to put aside enough savings to purchase a piece of land to build her own house and enter into new lines of work.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

Yolanda R. F., madre de 4 hijos, es jefa de grupo de la asociación comunal Futuro, perteneciente a Pro Mujer, socia antigua que se dedica a la fabricación de puertas con material reciclado (turriles) en la Feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto.

Hace ya 7 años Yolanda comenzó con un crédito de 100 $us, con el cual compro materiales para iniciar su negocio en la zona de Pacajes. En la actualidad tiene un puesto propio en la feria ya mencionada que con la ayuda de su concubino, administra y lleva adelante para el sustento de su familia.

Yolanda necesita de capital para invertir en su negocio y abastecer la demanda existente, de esta forma y con la ayuda de Pro Mujer, reunir un monto de ahorro que le permita comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa propia y la incursión en nuevos rubros de trabajo.

loans.use: Yolanda needs the capital to invest in her business and meet the demand for her services

loans.name: Krouch

texts.en: Mr. Krouch P., 41, is married with 2 children, who are both students. His wife earns $2 a day renting out a house, while he earns $8 a day as a taxi driver. However, recently his taxi has fallen into disrepair and he is requesting this $1000 to repair his car so he can continue running his business. In the future he would like to purchase another car to expand his business and generate more profits.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha D. is a 40-year-old mother of three living in Benjamín Aceval, Paraguay. She is currently separated from her husband, but receives some financial support from one of her children who works on a farm. The other two children are in school and help take care of the family-owned store. After her husband left, Martha took on full responsibility for supporting her children, and managed to successfully move forward with her life. 
 Martha runs a small convenience store that she opened in 1998 with what little money she inherited from her parents. She opened the store with the intention to continuously improve the business over time. In her neighborhood, Martha is well-known and liked as a particularly friendly shopkeeper. 
With the income from her store, Martha has been able to buy a pool table as well as a foosball table, both of which she lets the kids from the neighborhood use for a small fee. This money is yet another source of income for Martha and her family. 
Martha lives in a growing neighborhood, and her store is located next to a local school. Therefore, Martha has asked for a loan of US$425 to increase the number of products she offers to include toys and school supplies for the children.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, including toys, school supplies, candy, soda, and juice

loans.name: Tini

texts.en: Tini, 25 years old, is the mother of a child aged 9. After becoming a member of MBK, she began selling meatballs and snacks. She usually earns about US$ 9 per day and that is barely enough for her daily needs. Her husband, R., earns a small income each day. Tini is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to expand her business and she's willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand the offerings of her little meatball stand

loans.name: Jiyamkul

texts.ru:
Jiyamkul A. is 45 years old, he has a high school diploma with a specialization in machinery, he is an accountant, is married and has 7 children. Jiyamkul has been working in agriculture for the past 4 years. He plans to use his credit to purchase fertilizers and wheat seeds to sow land. With his bigger crop he plans to leave one part for his personal consumption and another part he plans to sell at a market to local people. This way, people will be able to purchase goods at affordable prices directly from the producer. Here, wheat is used to produce flour and bake bread. The flour is sold in stores for a greater price in comparison with the flour produced by Jiyamkul methods.

He plans to repay credit during 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Авлиякулов Жиямкул, возраст – 45 лет, образование среднее-техническое, по специальности – бухгалтер, женат, имеет 7-х детей. Жиямкул занимается земледелием уже в течение 4 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение удобрений, семян пшеницы для засева земли. Собранный урожай он планирует часть оставить себе на личные нужды, а часть продать на базареместному населению. Таким образом местные жители получат возможность приобрести зерно по более низким ценам, так как прямо из рук производителя. Пшеницу здесь используют для производстива муки и дальнейшей выпечки хлеба. Готовая мука реализуемая в магазинах стоит намного дороже, по сравнению с мукой произведенной по этому методу. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers and sow land

loans.name: Nangwe Madibira (V) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hellen B.. She is currently in the business of selling maize flour and is requesting a loan to purchase additional flour for the business. Hellen is 36 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 5 children ranging in age from 2 to 18, and all go to school. Each week, Hellen makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Hellen previously received a loan from BRAC Uganda in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Faima M., Sarah N. and Hindu B. . Faima M. has a business selling new clothes and wants to increase her stock. Sarah N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to expand the business. Hindu B. sells clothes and wants to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.use: TO purchase more maize flour for sale

loans.name: Leya Samuel's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Leya S.. She is currently selling fish and beans and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Leya is 38 years old and is married with a husband who is a police man. She has 2 children ages 5 and 8 and her children go to school. Each week, Leya makes approximately 75 Sudanese pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land for a house.

Leya is joined in her small group by Lucia A., Floura J., Margret J. and Victoria P.. Lucia A. has a business selling bread and wants to expand the business. Floura J. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand. Margret J. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand her business. Victoria P. is also in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas K. is a married woman with 2 children.  She is  36 years of age and hails from Lagos State,Nigeria. She sells frozen food such as chicken, turkey, and fish and also sells foodstuffs. She has been in her business since 2001 and needs the sum of $1200 to enable her buy more frozen food and foodstuffs for her business expansion and to maximize profit.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: El Hadji Saloum

texts.fr:
This young entrepreneur offers services: sales of credit cards and of newspapers in the south capital. By investing in this niche, instead of going the route of illegal immigration, this youngster demonstrates that people can really undertake a worthwhile business if they believe in it. With this loan, he wants to diversify his business by offering fruit (apples, oranges, etc.) to his loyal customers, who are composed of management personnel from the administration and from the private sector (NGO projects) who, as they buy the daily paper, would be able to pay for a little fruit for their families. He is also counting on bolstering his inventory of credit cards, which is going to add up to more profit for his commerce.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Ce jeune entrepreneur offre des services : vente de cartes de crédit et vente de journaux dans la capitale du sud.En investissant ce créneau, ce jeune au lieu de prendre les chemins de l'immigration clandestine, est un exemple qu'on peut bien entreprendre une activité rentable si l'on y croit. Il veut ,par ce prêt , diversifier ses activités en proposant des fruits (pommes, oranges etc) à sa fidéle clientéle constituée du personnel cadre de l'administration et du secteur privé (projets, ONGs) qui en achetant la presse du jour pourrait également payer un peu de fruits pour leurs familles. Aussi il compte renforcer son stock de cartes de crédit, ce qui va constituer davantage de bénéfices pour son commerce.

loans.use: Diversification of his business

loans.name: Namik

texts.en: Namik was born in 1975. He has been in the taxi business for 5 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and has settled in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has 2 children. Now he requests a loan of $975 to buy spare parts for his taxi.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Amavi Délali

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi Délali B. who is divorced is responsible for raising two children. She was born December 31, 1954 in Kotokpa and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé. She has been selling charcoal and cereals since last year. She buys corn and charcoal in the village where she was born for re-sale in Lomé. She has customers who are retailers and who sell in the Adidogomé open-air market. Her clientele has grown and she is not able to satisfy their needs alone.

Thus she is requesting this loan, her first, which will allow her to buy 60 sacks of charcoal so that she will be able to serve all her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Avec deux enfants à charge, madame B. Amavi Délali est une femme divorcée née le 31 décembre 1954 à Kotokpa et qui vit dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle exerce le commerce de charbon de bois et de céréales depuis l’année passée. Elle achète le maïs et le charbon de bois dans son village natal pour venir vendre à Lomé. Elle a des clients qui sont des détaillants et qui vendent dans le marché d’Adidogomé. Sa clientèle connaît un accroissement et seule elle n’arrive pas à leur donner satisfaction.

Alors ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 60 sacs de charbons de bois afin de pouvoir servir tous ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 60 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 60 sacs de charbon de bois

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla S. is 37 years old, is married and a father of 3 children. He lives in Avétonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Mr. S. has been running a general food store for many years. With this second credit, he would like to build the supplies of goods such as drinks, sandals, boxed and canned goods and various other products with the goal of increasing the capacity of his trade. The income from this activity will help him to better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Komla S. est âgée de 37 ans, marié et Père de 3 enfants. Il habite à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur S. tient une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis des années. Avec ce second crédit, il souhaite faire davantage d’approvisionnement de ses stocks de marchandises et autres comme les boissons, les sandalettes, les boites de conserves et les autres produits variés en vue d'augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les benefices de son activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Build stock of goods such as drinks, sandals, boxed and canned goods, and other products

loans.name: Hava

texts.en:
Hava is from Rainci, a small village near the town of Kalesija. She is a widow and this is her first loan, in the amount of 1200 KM ($US875).

Hava will use the loan to buy more chickens for fattening, because she already has soM.. Her wish is to expand this business during the winter, because she can earn more money by selling them at this tiM. than in spring or summer.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Mr. Hor L., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Kan, 36, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have one daughter who studies in a local school.

Mr. Hor has been in the business of running a motorbike repair service in front of his house since 2006. He learned to repair motorbikes in 1987. This is his second loan from Kiva. With his first loan, Hor was able to save some money to buy a sugar cane juice machine for his wife, who sells sugar cane juice. Currently, Sophoin sells sugar cane juice in front of the house and also wants to expand her business by selling gasoline to travelers. The picture shows Sophoin and Hor with gasoline bottles and the sugar cane juice machine.

Therefore, Hor is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more motorbike and bicycle spare parts for his stock and to expand his wife's business of selling gasoline and sugar cane juice.

loans.use: To buy more motorbike and bicycle spare parts for his stock and to expand his wife's business of selling gasoline and sugar cane juice

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Siete Estrellas”, ubicado en la Av. Bellavista Nº 801, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años D. edad, es madre D. 4 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como independiente. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta D. costura. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad es profesora D. confección textil y tiene en casa un pequeño taller D. costura. D. Lunes a Viernes trabaja en su especialidad y los fines D. semana confecciona las prendas D. vestir.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará una remalladota, 10 kilos D. tela D. licra  y algodón, elástico, cierre, hilos, etc.
 
Gracias a la ayuda brindada del Banco Comunal, su negocio ha crecido y la estabilidad económica D. su familia ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the "Las Siete Estrellas" [Seven Stars] communal bank located at Av. Bellavista Nº 801 in Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 52 years old and is the mother of four adult children. Vilma is married, her husband has an independent living. She decided to invest the first loan of 300 soles she received from Manuela Ramos in the sale of needlework. She has been working with the communal bank for five years.

At present Vilma is a textiles teacher and has a small dressmaker workshop at home. From Monday to Friday she is active in her profession and on weekends she sews clothes.

She will purchase a sewing machine, 10 kg of lycra and cotton, elastic material, zippers, threads etc. with the present loan of 2000 soles. It will be paid back in 6 months.

Thanks to the support provided by the communal bank Vilma’s business has improved and the economic stability of her family has increased.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine, fabrics, elastic material, zippers, threads, etc.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mr. Yorn A. is a villager in Prey Char Krouv village in the Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Ou Yoeurn, are farmers who own a piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. The plantation has a field with infertile soil which is lowering the crop yield. In order to resolve this problem, Mr. Yorn A. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to support his field and make his crop more productive. Mr. Yorn A. is 68 years old and the father of a child who is a tailor. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Khaem

texts.en:
Mrs. Khaem P. is a villager and lives in Dambong Derk Village in the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She is a farmer who cultivates rice twice a year. Now is the time to cultivate rice in the dry season. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to cultivate rice so she decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in the rice field.

Her husband, Mr. Ny Try, helps her on the plantation. Mrs. Khaem P. is 61-years-old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a farmer. The remaining child is attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the rice field.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 38-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon. Samar has been selling household items and flowers for two years and a half. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for Valentine’s Day. This is the first time that Samar has requested a loan.

Her customers are her friends, family members, and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had difficulty finding customers. She decided on doing this business because she knows and likes doing handicrafts, accessories, and flowers arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for Valentine’s Day

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married with two sons. She owns a business that produces wood products - various souvenirs and decorative items. Her shop is located at home so she does not pay any rent. Her husband and sons are involved in this business too.

Olena has been in this business for more than 10 years. Her husband used to work at a small factory that made similar souvenirs. When the factory downsized, her husband was fired, and they began to produce similar items at home. The produce is sold in bulk in a different city located about 300 miles from them. Recently they bought a van to transport their products.

Olena would like to get a loan of 7,500 UAH to purchase raw materials for production. She hopes to increase the production and use additional profit to fix their house, which burned last summer.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Erick

texts.es: Erick A. L. reside en el municipio de San Luis Talpa en el departamento de la Paz, tiene 59 años de edad, pero esto no es obstáculo para que cada día salga a las calles, barrios y colonias a vender emparedados y fresco, así también posee una pequeña tienda en su hogar. Gracias a su pequeño negocio Erick logra pagarse lo más básico en la vida, como lo es la alimentación, ropa y una pequeña casa. Debido a que lo que obtiene de sus ventas es la única ganancia que obtiene, solicita un préstamo, de manera que con esto logre comprar más productos para su tienda y así mejorar sus ventas, lo cual contribuirá a que Erick tengo un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Erick A. L. resides in the municipality of San Luis Talpa in the department of La Paz. He is 59 years old but this is not an obstacle to his every day outings to the streets, neighborhoods, and residential developments, where he sells sandwiches and refreshments. Erick also owns a small store in his home. Thanks to his small business Erick is able to afford the most basic things in life, such as food, clothing, and a small house. Given that what he obtains from his sales is the only earnings that he obtains, he is requesting a loan so that with this he is able to purchase more products for his store and in that way improve his sales, which will contribute to Erick being able to have a better lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for his store.

location.town: San Luis Talpa,  departamento de La Paz.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Es cliente nuevo el mismo que viene por referencias de otros clientes que ya sacaron créditos con anterioridad.
El vive en la localidad de Villa San Carlos del municipio el Torno, cuenta con casa tiene su vagoneta que la hace trabajar como taxi, el cual trabaja hace 1 año.
El crédito que le fue dado fue para la compra de una línea el mismo que tenia un costo de $us. 550 dólares americanos. 
El tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y comenta que dentro de un tiempo va invertir en la agricultura para la siembra de maíz y papa. Don Rogelio esta casado y tiene hijos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
He is a new client referred by other clients who have previously received loans. He lives in the Villa San Carlos neighborhood of El Torno municipality. He has a home and a small car with which he has worked as a taxi driver for a year. The loan was given to buy a taxi route that cost $US 500 American dollars. He has a great desire to continue working and he says that shortly he will invest in farming by growing corn and potato. Rogelio is married and has three school-aged children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a taxi transportation route

loans.name: Awolola

texts.en: Awolola is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and medicines. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and medicines to sell

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame B. awa est une femme qui est mariée à un monsieur qui est un mécanicien automobile, elle a 03 enfants. Le revenu de son mari étant insuffisant pour couvrir toutes les charges du foyer, elle a commencé par exercer en 2005 le commerce de chaussures, elle y a associé aussi le commerce de produits génériques ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de bons chiffres d’affaire. Voulant agrandir son commerce pour attirer encore plus de clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un premiers crédits pour acheter des chaussures et des produits génériques. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’adawlato.
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa B. is married to a gentleman who is an automobile mechanic, and she has 3 children. The income of her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she began selling shoes in 2005. She has also been selling generic products which allows her to have a good turnover. Wishing to expand her business so as to attract more customers, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy shoes and generic products. She does her buying at the local market of Adawlato.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes and generic products for re-sale

loans.name: Rahimata

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Rahimata M.. She is married with nine children between the ages of 7 and 9. She has been running a crops business since 2007, purchasing and selling crops. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about $120 a month. Rahimata is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. She thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Lolo sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge 30 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le  quartier N’kola de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba (région de Sikasso, république du Mali).
Elles ont spécifiquement comme principale activité génératrice de revenus la restauration et cela depuis 7 ans. Elles ont  leur restaurant situé au cœur du village qui est un point d’escale pour les voyageurs et commerçants en provenance de la république de la Côte d’Ivoire (une république sœur qui fait frontière  avec cette localité de  la république du Mali). 
Pour satisfaire le besoin sans cesse croissant de cette clientèle, ce groupe  a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 1000kg de riz, 500kg de petit mil, 100kg de haricot, 500kg de pommes de terre, de la viande,  du poisson et le reste sera utilisé pour acheter une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires. Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement dans le marché de Fakola auprès des forains et effectuent leur vente dans le dit marché à une clientèle riche et variée.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Lolo group are all married and have an average age of 30 years and 2 children. They live in large traditional families in the N'kola neighborhood in the Fakola subprefecture, in the Kolondièba prefecture (which is in the Sikasso region in Mali). Their main revenue-generating activity is a restaurant and has been for 7 years. Their restaurant is situated in the heart of their village and is a stopover point for travelers and merchants coming from Côte d'Ivoire (a sister country bordering this area of Mali). To meet the ever-increasing customer demand, this group has decided to turn to the microloan institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which the group is on its third solidarity loan. Their previous loans were all repaid in full with no problems. The women hope to use this loan to purchase, 1000 kg of rice, 500 kg of small millet, 100 kg of beans, 500 kg of potatoes, beef, and fish and the rest will be used to purchase a large amount of condiments. The women purchase their stock in the Fakola market with traveling merchants and sell their goods in the market to a diverse and affluent client base. They each hope to make 60,000 CFA in profit that will be used to pay the interest on the loan, provide for their families, and invest back into their business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for restaurant

loans.name: Elioba

texts.en:
Elioba is 29 years old and is married to a driver. She has five children who are all in school. Elioba sells charcoal, and is requesting a loan to build a store for this activity. With the profits generated from her business, Elioba hopes to buy a lorry truck for transporting charcoal to her store.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a charcoal store

loans.name: Mollecito De Covadonga Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mollecito De Covadonga es un banco nuevo que inicia su primer ciclo con 11socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de ropa, abarrotes, frutas, comida, animales menores, brindan servicios de trasporte.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, haciendo un total de 4,200 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, ropa, animales menores.

Los sueños de las socias son mejorar su negocio, superarse como persona y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Mollecito de Covadonga," is a new bank that is starting it's first loan with eleven members. The members have different businesses like selling clothing, groceries, fruit, food, small animals, and offering transportation services. The members need loans in different amounts like 300 and 450 PEN, which all total to 4,200 PEN for the communal bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, clothing, and young animals. The members' dreams are to improve their businesses and themselves and to see their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, clothing, and small animals

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene G., 26 years old, is from the village of Lao Sta. Cruz. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. Mylene owns & operates a fishing business. Her business is harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Mylene has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mylene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Mylene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Mylene is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mylene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Silvia Maribel

texts.es:
antes de explicar el negocio de la Sra. Silvia R. en la foto que se presenta es el hijo el que aparece en ella, ya que el hijo es el que siempre le ayuda a mantener su negocio y atender a sus clientes. Ademas ella es una sra. que no le gusta que le tomen fotos y nunca se le pudo tomar una foto con su negocio.
la sra. SILVIA MARIBEL R. V.. tiene una Pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia "SILVIA" ella tiene 11 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar.
ella es casada, su esposo emigro hace 3 años a los EE. UU en busca de mejorar sus 
condiciones de vida, y hasta la fecha lo ha logrado ya que con las remesas que le envia han sido invertidas en mejorar su vivienda.
desde hace 3 años a doña Silvia le a tocado estar frente a la educación de sus hijos, su hija esta cursando los estudios universitarios y se siente alegre ya que con grandes esfuerzos la han mandado a estudiar y ella les ha respondido muy bien en los estudios.
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio cubre a un 100% los gastos del hogar y lo que su esposo le envia lo invierte en mejorar y ampliar mas la vivienda.
manisfesto que se siente muy alegre por el apoyo que su hijo le da todo el dia.
texts.en:
Before describing Silvia Ramírez´s business, the photo is of her son who always helps her take care of the business and wait on customers. In addition, she is a woman who does not like her picture taken and we were unable to take a picture of her at her business. Silvia Maribel Ramírez V. has a convenience store which operates under the name "Pulperia Silvia" She has been in business for 11 years and it should be noted that she has known how to manage it. She is married. Her husband emigrated to the United States 3 years ago in search of a better life and up to now has achieved this because the money he sends back has been used to make improvements to their house. For the past 3 years it has been up to Silva to take care of her children´s education. Her daughter is in university and she feels happy that with great effort they have been able to send her to school and her daughter has responded well in her studies. The income generated from the business covers 100% of her household expenses and what her husband sends is invested in making improvements to their house. She is very happy for the support that her son gives her every day.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bread, spices, salt, coffee, lard, rice, beans, dairy products, soup, paper, flour, soft drinks, juices, cereal, oil, etc.

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
La Sra. Estefana González de Rodríguez es propietaria de un negocio de compras de aluminios, cobres, plásticos, y fabricación de baterías para automóviles. Posee el negocio desde el año 2,000, y trabajan en forma familiar debido a que es madre de 6 hijos.
 inició con un capital que obtuvo de una empresa financiera lo cual mantiene buenas referencias comerciales ,  cabe mencionar que el negocio está ubicado al costado de una de las avenidas más concurridas de la ciudad, se trata de personas trabajadoras y pioneras en la zona del Alto Parará.
texts.en:
Señora Estefana González de Rodríguez is the owner of a business that buys aluminum, copper, and plastic, and that makes car batteries. She has had this business since the year 2000, and they work as a family since she is the mother of 6 children. She started with capital that she obtained from a financing company that has good commercial references. It is worth mentioning that her business is located on one of the most frequented streets in the city. It has hard-working people and pioneers in the Alto Parará region.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aluminum, copper, plastic, and other items

loans.name: Narmandakh

texts.en:
Narmandakh K. lives with her three sons and her husband in a ger (a yurt or Mongolian nomadic dwelling) in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her three sons all attend university, which makes it difficult for them to earn enough money. 

Several years ago, she sold clothes outdoors by putting her products on a table. But, by working deligently, she made enough money to buy a counter in a shop, which was much nicer and much more comfortable than sitting outside. She bought her counter in 2000 and now she conducts her business with her husband. 

The secret of her business success is her smile. This makes her customers buy their clothes only from her. She is a very kind and polite person who always tries hard to give people happiness. She wants all her three children to be very helpful to the people around them. So she always tells them to make people happy and make them trust you. After that, your business will flourish without any obstacles. 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug ($725 USD) loan to continue her business, which is only source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's apparel

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es: La señora Maricruz I. es casada y vive en casa con su esposo el señor Francisco Javier y son padres de 2 niños hermosos, ella trabaja en una farmacia desde hace un año en el área de mostrador, su esposo labora para un taller mecánico contando con una antigüedad de 3 años. Son una familia establecida, unida y trabajadora que buscan una mejor comodidad para su familia y un mejor futuro para sus hijos, por tal motivo están tramitando este crédito ya que desean construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maricruz I. is married and lives with her husband, Francisco Javier. They have two lovely children. She has worked at the counter in a pharmacy for one year. Her husband has worked in a mechanic’s shop for three years. They are an established, united, hard-working family looking for greater comfort for their family and a better future for their children. They are asking for a loan because they wish to build a room on their house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room on their house

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: K. Elisabeth est née en 1958 et réside depuis trente ans au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elisabeth est mariée à KIKISOME Louis, un chauffeur. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et vivant avec eux. Elisabeth et Louis supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Elisabeth n’a jamais été à l’école et s’est mise depuis vingt cinq ans à vendre du sel de cuisine, du savon, des conserves (tomates en boîtes, sardines, lait) de façon ambulante. Elisabeth mène également comme activité secondaire la vente du jus de bissap et de l’eau glacée. Elisabeth s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a déjà obtenu trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Afin d’agrandir le volume de son activité et réaliser plus d'économies qui lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Elisabeth sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Elisabeth K. was born in 1958 and has lived for thirty years in the Cadjehoun à Cotonou neighborhood , economic capital of Benin. Elisabeth is married to Louis Kikisome, a driver. The couple has six children all attending school and living with them. Elisabeth and Louis bear together the family expenses. Elisabeth never attended school and has dedicated herself for twenty five years to selling kitchen salt, soap, canned foods (tomatoes in cans, sardines, milk) by travelling from place to place. As secondary activity, Elisabeth sells bissap juice and frozen water. Elisabeth purchases her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a former customer of ALIDé, who has already obtained three loans that she repaid well. In order to grow the volume of her business and realize more profits that will allow her to provide the necessities for her family, Elisabeth requests a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various supplies (sardines, tomatos in can, soap, milk, sugar packages)

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. sells smoked fish at the Elmina seashore.  Grace has received a junior high education.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is a carpenter. Grace has been selling smoked fish since 2004. She is responsible for supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business save to build and to invest.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Traoré est âgée de 51 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit  avec  ses  enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye  de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).  
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Madame  Fatoumata Traoré s’est très vite intéressée au commerce d’articles divers et à la transformation des noix de néré en sounbala. Elle exerce cette activité de transformation depuis plus de 30 ans. Elle est très appréciée et jouit d’une grande notoriété à Koutiala et environs.  
Le sounbala est un produit de première nécessité pour la préparation de certaines sauces en Afrique de l’ouest, ce qui montre toute l’importance  et l’avantage de cette activité qui procure assez de revenus à ces pratiquants.  
Pour remédier aux petites ruptures qu’elle subit et qui la fait perdre de la clientèle, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle  il y a 5 ans.  
Après  8 prêts  solidaires  (prêt du groupe) tous correctement  payés,   elle est à son  6ème  prêt  individuel  et tous les précédents ont été bien payés.  
Elle compte acheter, 10 sacs de noix de néré. Elle  s’approvisionne au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue sa vente  à Bamako (capitale Mali)  à une clientèle essentiellement composée  de femmes, au comptant ou à crédit. 
Avec le renforcement de son fonds de commerce, elle espère sur un bénéfice moyen de 125.000FCFA  par mois  qu’elle envisage  utiliser  pour payer les  intérêts du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, participer aux dépenses familiales et s’entretenir elle même ainsi que ses enfants. 
Madame  Fatoumata ambitionne  devenir grossiste de condiments  alimentaires à Bamako.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Traoré, aged 51, is a widow and the mother of three children.  She lives with her children in the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Not having had the chance to go to school, she soon got interested in the commerce of a variety of goods and in the processing of néré nuts into sounbala.  Fatoumata has been in this processing business for over thirty years.  She is much appreciated and enjoys great distinction in Koutiala and the vicinity.  Sounbala is essential for making certain sauces in West Africa, and this speaks to the importance and the advantages of this business, which brings in a fair amount of revenue to those in it. To remedy the sundry shortages which she suffers and which cause her to lose customers, Fatoumata decided five years ago to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy her customers properly.  After eight solidarity loans (group loans), all properly repaid, she is now on her sixth individual loan.  These previous loans have all been repaid.  She intends to buy 10 sacks of néré nuts.  Supplies are gotten at the big market of Koutiala.  Sales are made in cash or on credit to customers composed essentially of woman in Bamako (capital of Mali).  With the boost to her working capital, Fatoumata is hoping for an average profit of 125,000 francs CFA per month that she envisions using to cover the Soro Yiriwaso loan interest, to assist with family expenses, and to support herself, as well as her children.  Her ambition is to become a wholesale merchant of condiments in Bamako.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Néré nuts

loans.name: God's Grace Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth J. is the leader of a group of four borrowers called God’s Grace. She is 32 years old and a single mother with three children aged 3-13 years old. They are in Kindergarten through 5th grade. She also cares for two siblings. She is a 5th grade drop-out due to lack of financial support. Elizabeth and her children live around the Gbarnga central market but she works in the Gbarnga Dry rice market, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong County, Liberia.

Her business is selling plastic materials .She buys plastic materials like plastic plates, cups, spoons, bowls, etc. wholesale and sells at retail in the Gbarnga Dry rice market. Elizabeth has been running this business for two years and hopes to move her business to a shop. Transporting goods is the difficulty Elizabeth faces. Elizabeth’s good relationship with customers makes them always patronize her business. She needs this loan to purchase more goods to improve business. Elizabeth dreams of giving her family the best support.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Rosario Cristina

texts.es: Doña Rosario R. tiene 25 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Cortes Típicos”, habita junto  a sus Papas, ella se dedica en el Comercio, llevan  6  años de Vender,   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Xecaja del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella  pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más Mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rosario R., 25, is married and is a merchant. She has sold typical clothing tor 6 years. She lives with her parents in Paraje Xecaja which is in the Poxlajuj territory of the department and municipality of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, demand for her products has grown but her economic conditions have not allowed her to increase her capital. For this reason, she has called upon Asociación ASDIR to request financing in order to buy more stock items so that her sales will increase hoping, thereby, to help her family get ahead in life and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is a widow with six children who lives in Delta State, Nigeria. She sells bread to earn a living and meet her family's needs. She is a focused, hard worker who puts in long hours in order to keep her business sustainable. Patience is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bread to sell and increase her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Ikhtilat

texts.en: Ikhtilat I. is a 49-year-old man who sells turkeys and chickens in the small village of Agsu city. He is married and has three children.  Ikhtilat has four years of experience in poultry breeding. He needs 1200 AZN to purchase more poultry and increase his income.

loans.use: purchase more poultry

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
L. Lê Thị (20203020034) is a 60-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - B. Ninh. L. is the group leader for a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).

L. is married and has three adult children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling beef products in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. is requesting her first loan from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Nguyễn Thị L. (20203020035) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

2. Ngô Thị B. (20203020037) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,360,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Trương Thị G. (20203020036) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

4. Nguyễn Thị B. (20203020038) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

5. Ngô Thị G. (20203020039) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.

6. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203020040) is an 18-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a general store.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

L. Lê Thị (20203020034) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - B. Ninh. L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ T.t bò trong cộng đồng địa phương. L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Nguyễn Thị L. (20203020035) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

2. Ngô Thị B. (20203020037) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Trương Thị G. (20203020036) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4. Nguyễn Thị B. (20203020038) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

5. Ngô Thị G. (20203020039) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.

6. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203020040) là 18 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía B. Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất L. & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Dulmaa

texts.en: Dulmaa is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Dulmaa sells wooden products made by her husband at the “Itgelt” market. They have been living in their current home for six years. Her husband started his carpentry business with a man named Namsrai in 1998, but they have worked separately since 2002. Since that time, his business has expanded and he has purchased electrical appliances and equipment for the business, which he runs from his own home. Dulmaa is an honest and decent person. She says, “I would like to create my own workplace for the business.” She is requesting a 1,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of wooden planks for the business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of wooden planks

loans.name: Duyshobubu's Group

texts.en:
Duyshobubu U. is a creative individual. From childhood, she has had the ability to see the world in a different way and the things that we pass by. She has kind of a gift from above and tries to develop it. She did not study at the university though she is well educated. Her teacher was Life. Now she is 46 and a married woman. She is a brilliant mother of two sons. Her elder son is a student. His tuition is 16,000 KGS (363$). He wants to be a teacher. The youngest one is a schoolboy who studies in ninth grade. Her staggering husband works as in security at a company. What she has now is a result of years of hard work. Her business, her family, her friends, everything is deserved by her. Last year, with 1,000 KGS (22$), she started her little business which turns to a kind of national heritage. At present, she is an art teacher at the school and she sews incredible national items at home from expensive fabric. She has three types of sewing machines. She sells her fabulous works to tourists who visit the city. Her revenue is 6,000 KGS (136$). She is planning to open a factory where national items would be made. By getting a loan from Mol Bulak Finance, she wants to invest all the money in business by buying raw materials for sewing more national items. 

Gulmira S. is 45 and married. She has two daughters who are at home now. Her husband is a bus driver. She works as a cook in a café and earns 2,100 KGS (47$). She wants to get a loan to buy clothes for children. 

Nurgul A. is a widow. She is 43 and has two children. Her older daughter works in a café as a waitress. Her younger daughter is a schoolgirl. Nurgul sells bloater. She has a smoker and her turnover is 7,000 KGS (160$). Now she wants to get a loan to grow barley on her lot. 

Kumush K. is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. Her older son takes passengers and his income is 5,000 KGS (113$).  Her daughter works as a teacher and earns 1,800 KGS (40$). Her husband works as in security. At first, they bought 10 cattle for the family's needs 10 years ago. Now they are fattening five cattle and will sell them soon. This business began with 40,000 KGS (909$) and now they earn 3,000 KGS (68$). They want to buy four other small cattle by taking a loan.      

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing more national items

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
With pig farming and rice farming, Geralyn’s family is sustained. She is 29 years old and from Norala, South Cotabato. In the year 2000, she started these farming businesses. Today she manages a 4-hectare rice field and a piggery with 20 piglets. 

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to back up her business with additional capital. She requested 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy farm supplies and feeds.

loans.use: Feeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosita S. is from Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. She is one of the center chiefs in the micro-finance unit. She manages her sari-sari store and livestock business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from their farm. She has operated her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita successfully repaid her previous loan of 14,000 from PMPC. She now has a new loan of 50,000 which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be the 8th cycle taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She palns to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie C. is from the village of Watefall, Balingasag Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie has a business making and selling food products, primarily meats. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina C. is from the village of Mitimos. She is 55 years old, married and has six adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling her harvested crops in the local community. Victorina has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Victorina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC which was used as additional capital for her business. Victorina is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials for house renovation. This will be the ninth loan she has taken out from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials for house renovation

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Annie V., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Togetherness. She is 44 years old, widowed and has 10 children who range from four to 28 years old. She currently attends the University of Liberia. 

For 10 years, she has been selling soap, sugar, tea, milk, eggs, toothpaste, toothbrushes and other provisions in the Congo Town Community, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 10,500 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more soap, sugar, tea, milk, eggs, toothpaste, toothbrushes and other provisions.

Her dream is to grow her business, make more profit and continue to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, tea, milk eggs, toothpaste, toothbrushes and other provisions.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives in Multan, Pakistan with her husband and children. She operates a sewing business in her home to financially support her husband who is a daily wage laborer. She has hired a worker who takes orders from the nearby areas for her and she completes them on time. She pays him on a monthly basis from her earnings.

Now, Zarina wants to buy a new sewing machine because the old one is not in a working condition and gives problems during sewing. She also has a plan to hire a tailor for fulfilling orders on time. She is hopeful that in this way she can increase her household income and also improve her family’s living standard.

In the photo, these ladies are holding a piece of Zarina’s cloth that she has for sewing.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jose Concepción

texts.es:
La señor J. C., tiene la edad de 52 años y  vive en el barrio Medardo Andino, es casado y su esposa se dedica a los trabajos del hogar, tienen dos hijos que se dedican a los estudios, el señor J. C. es agricultor y tienen más de 20 años de experiencia en esta actividad.

La agricultura ha sido el sustento de toda su familia, años atrás con la reforma agraria y su esfuerzo propio fue que logro comprar un terreno y sembrar aguacates, dentro de sus máximas necesidades para las cosechas es la inversión de materiales agrícolas que aporten un mejor mantenimiento para la producción de las siembras, razón por la cual solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de fungicidas, repelentes e insecticidas que le permitan llevar a sus terrenos a un nivel optimo, esta inversión le traerá a futuro beneficios económicos que le permitirán mejores condiciones sociales para su familia.
texts.en:
J. C. , age 52, lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. He is married, and his wife does the household chores. They have two children who go to school. José C. is a farmer, and he has 20 years of experience in this activity. Farming has supported his entire family. Years ago, with the agrarian reform and his own effort, he bought some land and planted avocados. One of the biggest necessities for the crops is buying agricultural materials that support better maintenance for crop production. That is why he is requesting a loan to buy fungicides, repellents, and insecticides. These will allow him to bring his crops to an optimal level. This investment will bring economic benefits in the future. This will allow his family to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fungicides, repellents, and insecticides that will allow him to bring his crops to an optimal level

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI IV  est composé de femmes mariées du village de Sokan de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou,  qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, au moins 4 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans. 
Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
GNIRI C., compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana, M’Pèrèsso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI IV comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25.000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi IV group is composed of married women from the village of Sokan in the San prefecture, in the Segou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). The women live in traditional families. They are on the average 30 years old , have at least four children, and cultivate peanuts. In order to make their agricultural work profitable, three years ago they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. After having duly repaid previous loans, they are now on their first agricultural loan. Gniri C. plans to use her loan to purchase a sufficient supply of peanut seeds, small tools and agricultural inputs, at the big market in Kimparana. After the winter season, the harvest is stored for a while as its price increases, before being sold at the big market of Kimparana and other nearby markets, retail (often wholesale) for cash to customers mostly coming from big towns. After selling their produce, members of the Benkadi IV group plan to obtain an income, between 25,000 and 40,000 West African francs each, which will be used to pay off the loan interest and cover ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural inputs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Kurbonboy

texts.en:
Kurbonboy A. is a married father of four children. Faced with high unemployment in his country and the difficulty of finding a job, he began his own business selling men’s clothes. Fortunately, sales have been good and his business is growing thanks to the quality of his products and the good service he provides. Kurbonboy now requests a loan of 5200 Somoni which he will use to buy more clothes to meet his customers’ demand.  He is very thankful to you for helping him improve his business and therefore the quality of life for his family.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new summer clothing for selling.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Benigno nació en la ciudad de Carhuayo y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la Asociación Arariwa. Actualmente, Benigno vive en la ciudad de Ocongate junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos de las cuales dos están vivos y uno falleció.  (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Actualmente, Benigno trabaja en la municipalidad de Ocongate como asistente del teniente alcalde. Ya son 4 años que trabaja en la municipalidad y le va muy bien. Le pueden encontrar en su oficina de la municipalidad, los 6 días de semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. 

Hace 12 años, Benigno que se dedica a la producción de truchas, el tiene 8 pozas de agua en su domicilio donde se encuentra las truchas. La idea de abrir este negocio fue cuando la municipalidad del lugar decidido dar charlas de capacitación acerca de la crianza de truchas. Benigno vio en este tema una gran oportunidad para dedicarse al negocio, al principio le fue complicado pero ahora es un hábil productor de truchas. Benigno vende sus truchas a sus amigos, vecinos, a gente que tiene restaurantes y a otras más. Benigno y su esposa también preparan trucha al horno para las personas que vienen a visitar su granja. Benigno quiere dedicarse solamente a distribución y venta de crías de truchas a diferentes piscigranjas de la zona de Ocongate. 

Con el próximo préstamo, Benigno que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar más crías de truchas. 

Ya son dos años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. El sueño de la socia es construir una centro recreacional en su domicilio.
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Benigno was born in the city of Carhuayo . He belongs to “Las Margaritas Ocongate” (The Ocongate Daisies) Communal Bank with the Arariwa Ascociación. Benigno currently lives in the city of Ocongate with his wife and their two children. He had three children, but one of them died. The city of Ocongate is two hours from the city of Cusco. Benigno works in the Ocongate municipality as an assistant to the mayor. He has worked in the municipality for four years, and it is going very well for him. He can be found in his office in the municipality six days a week from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. For 12 years Benigno has devoted himself to trout production. He has eight ponds of water, where the trout can be found, at his house. He got the idea to open this business when his municipality decided to present training talks on how to raise trout. Benigno saw that there was a great opportunity for a business of raising trout. At the beginning it was complicated, but now he is an adroit trout producer. Benigno sells his trout to his friends, neighbors, people who have restaurants, and others. Benigno and his wife also prepare baked trout for the people who come to his farm. Benigno wants to work only with the distribution and sale of young trout to different fish farms in the Ocongate area. With the next loan Benigno hopes to receive 1,000 soles. He would like to use the money from this loan to buy more young trout. He has participated in the communal bank for two years. It is going very well for him thanks to the reliability of his colleagues and the punctuality of their payments. His dream is to build a recreational facility at his house. He is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more young trout

loans.name: Walter Ivan

texts.es: Walter Ivan L. H. de 32 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, lugar en el cual está ubicado su  negocio el cual es un cibercafé, en el que trabaja desde hace 10 años. Él vive junto a su madre quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y la cual depende de Walter. En el negocio  no solamente brinda el servicio de internet sino también comercializa productos como: Cd’s, lapiceros, folders, paginas de papel bond, cuadernos y diferentes tipos de papelería, lo cual le permiten ampliar su negocio. Con el deseo de poder mejorar el cibercafé, Walter solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar accesorios para computadoras como: monitores, mouse, parlantes, audífonos, cámaras y otros más, esto con el deseo de poder  brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, así mismo Walter quiere invertir en papelería y así mismo para comprar una fotocopiadora, la cual es un muy buen negocio. Él es una persona que cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, ya que es muy emprendedor y así mismo por contar con un enorme deseo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Walter Ivan L. H., 32, lives in Soyapango which is where he has also had his Internet café for the last 10 years. He lives with his mother who is a housewife and who depends on Walter. The business isn’t just an Internet café, he also sells merchandise like: CDs, mechanical pencils, folders, sheets of bond paper, notebooks and various stationery items that allow him to expand his business. Wanting to improve his Internet café Walter is asking for funds to buy accessories for the computers like: monitors, mice, speakers, microphones, webcams, etc. in order to provide better customer service. He also wants to buy more stationery items and buy a photocopying machine, which is a very good business. He has very good personal references because he is very enterprising and has a strong will to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy PC accessories.

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy S. is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:   General Store, Pig Fattening and charcoal sales. She lives in Proper, Brgy. Maricalum, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her General Store, Pig Fattening and charcoal businesses. She is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP. Billy is now borrowing  28,000 PHP so that she  can  fund operations of her three businesses and buy more stock to sell.   This will be her 25th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 24,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Billy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn M. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Mahigugma-on, Barangay Patic, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and rice retail. Her husband Rolando, who is 42 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children, 4 months and 2 years old. 

Analyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Analyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to buy more inventory for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future business improvements. Analyn M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable).
