Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Cherrymel

texts.en:
Cherrymel T. is 24 years old, married and has an infant. She is from the village of Villa Verde in the barangay of Balulang within Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Cherrymel runs a retail store from which she primarily buys and sells electronic reloads of several networks like GLOBE, SMART and SUN CELLULAR to the local community. Cherrymel has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cherrymel joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Cherrymel successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional electronic reloads to sell. Cherrymel is requesting a new loan, her second from HSPFI, of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 23 años, es soltero y participa en el banco comunal “Señor de Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.  Enrique es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi en ciudad del Cusco. (En la ciudad de Cusco se encuentra ubicada una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Enrique con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles, él pagara las ultimas letras del taxi que compro a crédito. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Enrique is 23 years old and single.  He is a member of Arariwa's “Señor de Los Temblores II” community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Enrique is an enterprising and hard-working young man who offers taxi services in the city of Cusco (The city of Cusco is home to one of the eight wonders of the world, the citadel of the Incas known as Machu Picchu).

Enrique will use his loan for 1,500 nuevos soles to pay off the last bills for his taxi which he bought on credit.

He is grateful for the opportunity which he is being given with this loan and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To pay off the last bills for his taxi which he bought on credit

loans.name: Israel

texts.en: Israel is a 30-year-old father of one child, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His wish is to see his child graduate and work for a reputable organization. He is a motorcycle driver and, with the three years that he has been in the transport sector, he has been able to buy his own motorcycle. Israel intends to use this loan to buy land for the construction of a rental house so as to have increased sources of income.

loans.use: To buy land for construction of a rental house

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul T. is a Kenyan entrepreneur in the lakeside city of Kisumu, Kenya. He is married to Mary Apondi, who is a tailor. The couple has a son, Washington Otieno, who is in nursery school.

Paul runs a carpentry workshop where he makes and sells furniture on the premises. He operates his business from the populous open-air market of Kibuye, located near the heart of Kisumu Town. He has applied for his second loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he will use to purchase wood, velvet, and cushions for making sofa sets (couches). He will use the anticipated profits to buy his wife a sewing machine so the family can earn more income.

Paul hopes one day to own a big furniture shop in Kisumu as well as furniture shops in other parts of the city where his customers can get his quality furniture. He also dreams of buying a plot of land and building a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase wood, velvet, and cushions for furniture making

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a butcher shop for the past seven years.  Neighbors and passersby are his potential customers. Juma faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to establish another butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 75,000 he wants to purchase cow meat for sale in his butcher shop. He decided to join Yehu because of its simple enrollment procedure.

loans.use: To purchase cow meat for sale in his butcher shop.

loans.name: La Benito Juarez Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama la Benito Juárez porque así se llama la colonia en donD. viven ellas ,esta ubicado en MoreL. en México ,esta comunidad se distingue por su tradicional feria del pezcado la cual fue el 28  D. noviembre ,el grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes.Roció Gutiérrez es la tesorera del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes negocio que inicio hace 1  año .solicita su préstamo para comprar más mercancía para la tienda, tiene 36 años D. edad, estudió la secundaria, es casada  ella tiene 4 hijos: tres mujeres D. 15, 11,5 años y su pequeño hijo D. 3 años, sus clientas se sienten agusto por que siempre encuentran L. productos que necesitan. Al momento D. solicitar su préstamo  se siente contenta por que con el podrá comprar detergentes y productos enlatados que le hacen falta en su tienda  y con las ganancias ella comprara  un refrigerador para su casa.
texts.en: This group is called Benito Juárez because that is the name of the neighborhood where they live.  It is located in Mexico in the state of MoreL., and the community stands out for its traditional fish market which was November 28th.  The group is comprised of 10 members and Roció Gutiérrez is the group treasurer.  She works selling groceries, a business which she began a year ago.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for the store.  She is 36 years old, has secondary education, and is married with four children – three girls (15, 11, and 5 years old) and a small 3-year-old son.  Her customers feel at ease because they always find the products that they need.  Upon applying for her loan, she is happy because she will be able to buy detergents and canned goods that she is lacking in her store and with the earnings, she will buy a refrigerator for her house.

loans.use: Merchandise (detergents and canned goods)

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn K., 26, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own land for many years. In addition, she raises a few pigs in a stall at her home. She is married to Voeurn, age 36, who assists her in the business. The couple has been married for years and they have three school-aged children, all living under one roof. 

With growing family expenses, Soeurn K. needs to increase her income. Soeurn K. requests a loan to purchase small pigs to raise and to buy pig feed to fatten them. By using this loan she will get more income and be able to support her family more effectively.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to raise, and feed for them.

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
Purificacion R., 55, is from the village of Naggasican Santiago. She is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Purificacion runs a general store.  Purificacion has been in business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Purificacion joined ASKI to access financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Purificacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI to purchase additional products to sell.  Purificacion is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gessler Stivenson

texts.es:
Gessler Stivenson tiene 22 años y se dedica a la venta de mercancias variadas como ropa y calzado, y tambien al comercio de joyas fabricadas en oro golfi brasilero y en plata. Gessler naciò en un hogar Santandereano (Gentilicio de quien nace en el departamento de Santander) donde el negocio independiente y la gran capacidad de trabajo es parte de su cultura. En su experiencia familiar y desde muy  niño tuvo todo su aprendizaje para emprender su propio negocio, sin descuidar sus estudios, por eso se graduò tambien como “Tecnico de Laboratorio” en la universidad, y desde allì empezò a comercializar joyas entre sus compañeros de estudio, profesores y empleados de la academia,  apoyado por un capital de trabajo que le regalaron: su padre quien aportò $200.000 cop , su tia adiciònò $200.000 cop mas y su madre,  tambien prestataria de la Fundaciòn  le dio. $200.000 cop, con los que completò su capital inicial.
En la actualidad està solicitando su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, pues necesita un capital de trabajo adicional para lograr dar respuesta a  pedidos que han hecho nuevos clientes y requiere ser oportuno. Con el comprará mercancia surtida como ropa femenina, joyas de plata y de oro golfi brasilero : pulseras, aretes, cadenas, tobilleras y anillos. 
Su sueño es tener una casa propia adecuada con un local donde exhibir toda la variedad de productos que vende, pues en la actualidad su gran desafio es la compertencia quien aborda el mercado con productos de menos calidad pero bien exhibidos y él debe hacer mayores esfuerzos para posicionar sus productos en el mercado. Actualmente su negocio presenta una razon corriente de 7,23, un endeudamiento total de 13,4% y con el nuevo credikiva serà de 28,45, mientras maneja unas cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 27 dias , su rotaciòn de inventarios es de 51 dias  y su  rotacion de cuentas por pagar son de 14,8 dias. 
Gessler es un jòven muy capaz de salir adelante en todo lo que se proponga, asi que su emprendimiento muy probablemente generarà en un futuro, no solo sus propios ingresos, sino tambien empleo para muchas personas y esto  es con lo que Gessler realmente sueña.
texts.en:
Gessler Stivenson is 22 years old and he sells various merchandise, such as clothes and shoes. He also sells jewelry made with Brazilian goldfill and silver. Gessler was born in a Santanderean home (people who are born in the Santander department), where independent business and a great work ethic are a part of his culture. In his family experience, and since he was very small, he learned everything to be able to have his own business, without neglecting his studies. That is why he also graduated as a laboratory technician from the university.  It was there that he started to sell jewelry to his classmates, professors and school employees. He was helped by working capital that was given to him: his father gave her $200.000 COP, his aunt gave him another $200.000 COP and his mother, another borrower from the Fundaciòn, gave him  $200.000 COP. With that, he had all his initial capital.  

Presently, he is asking for his first loan from the Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo. He needs working capital to be able to respond to orders that new customers have made and he needs to be able to respond quickly. With it, he will buy various merchandise such as women's clothes, silver and Brazilian goldfill jewelry such as: bracelets, earrings, chains, anklets and rings.    

His dream is to have his own house that can have a locale where he can exhibit all of the products he sells. At present, his biggest challenge is the competition that exists in the market with lesser quality products. He has to make a bigger effort to position his products in the market. At present, his business has a current ratio of 7.23, and a total debt of 13.4%. With the new Kiva loan, it will be 28.45, while he manages some accounts payable that rotate every 27 days. His inventory turnover is 51 days, and his accounts payable rotation is 14.8 days. 

Gessler is a young man who is very capable of getting ahead in everything he sets his mind on. With his enterprising spirit, it is very probable that he wil generate a future, not only for his own income, but also a job for a lot of people. This is what Gessler really dreams of.

loans.use: Various merchandise, such as women's clothing, silver and Brazilian goldfill jewelry: bracelets, earrings, chains, anklets and rings.

loans.name: Flory

texts.en:
Flory is a married woman who lives in Candoni, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari store and a sugarcane farming business. Her husband Ernesto, who is 50 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are between 14 and 27 years old. Flory joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Flory has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to use as additional funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Flory is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou S. is from the city of Sta. Cuz. Ozamiz City. She is 53 years old. Marilou is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Marilou is selling snacks in the market. Marilou has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Evelyn is married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Evelyn sells used clothing, called "ukay-ukay" in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of used clothing like t-shirts & blouses. This will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used clothing like t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn, age 37, owns and operates a sar-sari (general store) business. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as biscuits and canned goods. She and her husband have two children, both in school. Roselyn works very hard to provide for them.

Roselyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

In the future, Roselyn would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family .

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
El grupo está compuesto por 11 socias, todas señoras muy trabajadoras con muchos sueños y metas por cumplir, sus edades van desde los 26 años hasta los 60 años. La mayoría de integrantes solo completaron la educación primaria y se dedican a las actividades agropecuarias para ayudar a sus familias; que en muchos casos es la única fuente de ingresos económicos para el hogar. Esta es la primera solicitud de crédito de Banco Mujer Mujeres En Acción y se enteraron de los servicios de Fundación Mujer, gracias a que la actual tesorera, Doña Emilce B., ya había estado en un grupo hace más de 4 años. 
Las solicitantes van a invertir el préstamo en la compra de cerdos, pollos, terneros, alimentos, concentrados, abonos, químicos y otros insumos para la cría de animales y siembra de cacao. Las integrantes del grupo tienen la experiencia de muchos años en las actividades productivas, pero no cuentan con capital de trabajo para poder hacer crecer sus negocios, y si a esto le sumamos otras dificultades como el alto costo de la materia prima, el transporte los productos, falta de un mercado fijo, y los bajos precios con los que logran vender sus productos. Todos estos obstáculos son los que tiene que enfrentar día a día, por ello el crédito viene hacer de gran ayuda para todas las microempresarias que integran esté Banco Mujer.  
El grupo se ha fijado objetivos muy importantes como agrandar sus negocios, llegar a ser autosuficientes, seguir estudiando, y muchos otros. Donde el crédito es un primer paso para alcanzarlos.
texts.en:
The group is composed of 11 members, all of which are hard-working women with a lot of dreams and goals yet to fulfill.  Their ages range from 26 up to 60 years of age.  The majority of its members only completed elementary education and have dedicated themselves to agricultural activities in order to help their families, who in most cases, is the only source of income for the household.  This is the first loan from Banco Mujer Mujeres En Accion (Women's Comunal Bank Women in Action) and they heard of the services of Fundacion Mujer thanks to the current treasurer, Emilce Bermudez who had been in a comunal group for more than 4 years.

The members will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs, chickens, calves, feed, concentrates, fertilizers, chemicals and other inputs to raise livestock and grow cocoa.  The members have many years experience in their productive activities but do not have the working capital to grow their businesses; and if we add to these struggles the high cost of raw materials, product transportation costs, lack of a stable market, and the low prices in which they manage to sell their products, all of these obstacles are what they have to face day-to-day.  This is why the loan is of great help for all of the entrepreneurs who make up Banco Mujer.
The group has set forth very important objectives such as: growing their business, becoming self-sufficient, continuing their education, and many more. This loan is the first step to reach those objectives.

loans.use: to purchase Pigs, Poultry, Livestock and Agriculture

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 29 years old. He lives in Adjara, in the village of Kveda Tsinsvla. Koba and his wife Mziuri run an agricultural farm in the village. They have a one-hectare plot of agricultural land where various fruits and vegetables are grown. After the harvest season, the fruits and vegetables are sold to the retailers. Along with the above-mentioned business, Koba is a craftsman of gas counters. When he has orders from the villagers, he repairs gas counters and gets additional income. 

With the requested loan, Koba and Mziuri will purchase a milk cow. They plan to produce Georgian cheese and sell it on the market. It will increase the income of the family. In the future, the couple plans to renovate their house, as it is already old and needs some remodeling.  They hope that the cheese production will allow them to save for the renovation.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Angela Gardenia

texts.es:
Angela de 50 años, tiene un pequeño salón de belleza ya que en su juventud trabajo como ayudante en una peluquería. Poco a poco fue guardando dinero para poder tener su propio local. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano en su propio local de belleza. Poco apoco a comprado todos los implementos y herramientas para trabajar con eficiencia para sus clientes. Trabaja desde las 10h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Hace cortes de cabello, tinturados, anchados, maquilla etc.  

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar cosméticos y poderlos vender en su local. En el futuro quiere  agrandar el local.
texts.en:
Angela, 50, has a small beauty salon.  In her youth, she worked as an assistant in a hair salon.  Little by little she saved money so that she could have her own place of business.

Now she starts work each morning in her own beauty salon.  She has gradually managed to buy all of the tools and equipment that she needs to work effectively with her customers.  She works from 10am until 10pm every day.  She does haircuts, dyes, hair straightening, makeup, etc.

She has a lot of aspirations for her business, and for this reason she wants a loan so that she can buy cosmetics to sell in her salon.  In the future, she wants to expand her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Angela Felisa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 49 años de edad, actualmente mantiene una relación de unión libre pero de otro compromiso que tuvo hace varios años tuvo tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad. Su actual marido es chofer. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en un taller que enseñaba esta rama artesanal.
 
Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su taller para que les elabore sus prendas, también cose uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad en temporadas de clases. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar: telas, hilos, botones, cierres  y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta todo del banco.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Exitosas” (The Successful Ones) meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have received attention on a national and international level. This place is where the famous Panama hats are made.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Angela. She is 49 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three adult children from a previous relationship. Her current husband is a chauffeur. She learned sewing and dressmaking several years ago at a workshop that provided classes in various crafts.

Angela has a small sewing business where she has worked many years as a seamstress. She makes all types of garments and works according to orders she receives from customers who come to her establishment and are in need of clothes. Angela also makes uniforms for businesses, schools, and colleges whenever classes are in session. She works every day from 6am until 10pm, and sometimes even later whenever she has orders to be delivered.

This new loan will be used to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials. She has been with the Communal Bank for five loan cycles and enjoys everything about it. Her dreams are to have a much larger business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 24 years old and single. He has been quarrying for three years and has no other source of income. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. Previously, he was employed in a transport van.

Joseph is very thankful to Faulu Kenya because he has managed to grow his business. He hopes to become financially stable in the future. Joseph has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy working equipment and materials.

loans.use: To buy working equipment and materials.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urubamba en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Carlos; el socio tiene 24 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad; el socio se dedica a la atención de su taller de reparación y prestación de servicios mecánicos, el socio entre los servicios que presta vende llantas nuevas, el socio tiene este negocio desde hace 2 años y  desea que siga creciendo e implementarlo poco a poco, el socio ahora desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de llantas para el negocio. 

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Carlos is a member of the "El Diamante de Urubamba" (Diamond of Urubamba) community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Carlos is 24 years old, lives with his partner, and has one child who is 4 years old.  He owns an auto repair shop where he provides a range of services including selling new tires.  He has owned this business for two years.  He would like it to continue growing and would like to gradually stock it.  Carlos would like to invest his loan in buying tires for his business.

Carlos is grateful for the support that he is being given and pledges to make his repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en: Apollo is a 48 year-old married man with 5 children between 8 and 28 years old.  He also has two dependents, and he lives with 6 people in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. For 4 years Apollo has been in the produce business which he has developed.  He has managed to buy a plot of land and build a house. Apollo faces the challenge of limited capital to buy enough cereals to meet the increasing demand of his customers.  His dream is to own a food store. Apollo needs a loan to buy rice, tobacco, and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, tobacco, and beans to sell

loans.name: Expectacion

texts.en:
Expectacion is 50 years old and married with 6 children.

Expectacion works hard to provide for her family.  She buys and sells Avon products in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of avon products to sell.

Expectacion has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running this Avon products business for 5 years and also earns an income from rice mill operations and electronic re-loading.

Expectacion aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Ramiro Jose

texts.es: El señor Ramiro , es agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Ramiro desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden las plantas y en ocasiones el robo del producto  , los planes que tiene hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo y obtener mayor ingresos  , Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que son muchos los agricultores que se benefician con estos programas de apoyo ya que le brinda asistencia técnica para desarrollarse mejor como un pequeño comerciante de piña .
texts.en:
Ramiro’s a farmer in Ticuantepe with his family.  His future plan is to improve living conditions.  Ramiro has been farming pineapples for several years.  The greatest challenge he faces is the infestations that invade his plants and sometimes the theft of product.  The plan he has for his crops is to diversify them and earn higher income.  

He is grateful for the support Afodenic provides through Kiva funds because there are a lot of farmers who benefit from these support programs because they provide technical assistance to develop better as small merchants of pineapples.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Meguela

texts.en:
Meguela is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Meguela has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Meguela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Meguela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, a married man with two children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, Francis has owned a boda boda (motorcycle) business, operating from the market with neighbors and passersby as his potential customers. He faces the major challenges of seasonality and theft in his business, and dreams of establishing a spare parts shop in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business, Francis wants to purchase motorcycle spare parts, oil and lubricants with a loan of Kshs 20,000.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts, oil and lubricants.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Sen is a 51-year-old married woman who comes from a low-income family in the Baray district of the Kompong Tom province. Everyday, Mrs. Sen sells fish caught by her husband from the river and the lake in and around the village. The couple works well together in running this business smoothly to provide for their livelihood. They typically earn an income of around $5 USD per day in order to meet the needs for daily expenses. Mrs. Sen has four children, three of whom are single and the other one is married. Two of her children are now working in a garment factory and, like other villagers, get their salary monthly. Now, Mrs. Sen and her husband are asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase a fishing trap and other fishing materials because their old ones are broken. In the future, this couple hopes that they will able to raise some small fish by themselves so that they can generate more profit.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing trap and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 56 years old and married, with 7 children.  Rosana works hard to proviD. for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Rosana has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.  Rosana aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 23 years old married woman with two children whom attend school.

She sells fish in South Sudan and has been in business for five years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC to enable her purchase more fish to sell.  She says the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been working in selling women's clothes since seven years ago.
 
Rania is a hardworking woman. She started her business seven years ago to help her husband in improving their social and financial situations. Rania is requesting a loan from Kiva-partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her merchandise with the new season's collections, especially for the Adha Eid “Muslim Holy Pilgrim.”

Most of her customers are family members, friends, neighbors and relatives; they highly support her in order to provide a good living for her children. Rania’s special reputation earned her customers’ support and trust. She insists on improving her business as much as she can in order to expand it through opening a shop instead of working from her own house.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with new collections.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Maria, vive con sus dos hijos, propietaria y administradora de un comedor y una pupuseria, cuenta con experiencia en el trabajo ya que lo realiza hace 15 años, no tiene un horario definido para atender a sus clientes.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para el negocio: Aceite, condimentos, carnes, chicharrón, esta compra le ayudara a surtir sus negocios y a mejorar las ganancias económicas.
Su mayor sueño es crecer mas y mas en su negocio para mejorar su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María lives with her children.  She owns and manages an eatery and pupusa [stuffed corn dough grilled cakes] stand.  She has experience since she’s been doing this work for 15 years.  She does not have a fixed customer service schedule.

She’s asking for a loan to buy raw materials for the business: oil, condiments, meats, chicharrón [fried pork skin].  This purchase will help her stock her businesses and improve profits.  Her greatest dream is to grow more and more in her business to improve her and her children’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy oil, condiments, meat and fried pork.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario es socia del banco comunal Las Caribeñas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos
Lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años aproximadamente, tiene un negocio de ventas de lubricantes y repuestos de motos, negocio que tiene como socio a su esposo, que es el que se encarga de la atención al cliente.
Con su nuevo préstamo de /. 3,000.00 nuevos  soles comprará: 5 cajas de aceite de litro, 6 filtros, 1 caja de bujías, 1 balde de grasa, 1 caja de rodajes, ½ docena de intermitentes, cámaras, 1 paquete de parches.
Este negocio lo maneja junto a su esposo, todo lo hacen coordinadamente para que puedan llevarlo todo en orden, de esa manera su familia esta mas unida porque los dos saben trabajan para que sus hijos puedan tener un futuro mejor.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos su situación económica ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the communal bank "Las Caribeñas" ["The Caribbean Women"], of the district of Manantay, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old and married with two children. 

She has been a client of Manuela Ramos for approximately 7 years. She has a business selling lubricants and spare parts for motorcycles. She operates this business as a partner together with her husband, who is responsible for serving the customers. 

With her new loan for 3,000 Peruvian new soles, she will buy: 5 cases of 1-liter oil containers, 6 filters, 1 case of spark plugs, 1 bucket of grease, 1 case of bearings, ½ dozen turn signals, inner tubes and tire patches. 

She manages this business together with her husband, and they do this in a coordinated manner so they can keep everything in order. This means that their family is more united, because the couple knows how to work together to help provide their children with a better future. Thanks to the help from Manuela Ramos, their economic situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy 5 cases of 1-liter oil containers, one case of spark plugs and other merchandise.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 57 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 

To earn a living, Leonila has a business selling nutritious snacks. She earns about 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Leonila has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase primary ingredients for her snack-vending business. Leonila has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  

In the future, Leonila would like to have her own refreshment stand in town.

loans.use: to purchase primary ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is a 49-year-old businessman who is married to Josephine, who is a farmer. They are blessed with four children aged 16, 12, 10, and 8 years respectively. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past two years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Japheth will use the loan to service his motorbike. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to start a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: to service the motorbike.

loans.name: Lili Elivira

texts.es:
Doña Lili sigue en el comercio de venta de ropa variada de adulto y niños a si como zapatos, ropa interior, manteniendo a sus clientes sastifecho, el cual ha venido surtiendo sus ventas a traves de los financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado.
Es madre soltera de tres hijos, casados e independientes, en donde se apoyan para el bienestar de la familia. Hoy con este nuevo prestamo  invertira en mas ropa interior y trajes de niña y niños, asi como compras de encargos de los clientes, siendo las venta alta en este fin de año. Obteniendo mejores ganancias para sus gastos basicos como personales.
texts.en:
Lili is continuing with her business selling clothes of various kinds for children and adults, including shoes and underwear. She is keeping her customers satisfied, and she has been increasing her stock and her sales thanks to the loans granted to her by Afodenic.

She is a single mother of three children, who are married and independent, and they help each other for the well-being of the family. Now, with this new loan, she will invest in more underwear and boys' and girls' outfits, as well as purchases in response to customer orders, since the end of the year is a high season for sales. In this way, she will obtain higher earnings to cover her basic and personal expenses.

loans.use: to invest in underwear and children's clothing to increase her sales.

loans.name: Guzaloi

texts.ru: Гузалой 41 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находиться на заработках в России. Ежемесячно присылает ей деньги.  Гузалой торгует в магазине продовольственными товарами и продукты питания. Первый кредит получила на расширения ассортимента товара. За это время она купила машину С того времени ее семейное положение улучшилось, она провела летом ремонт в квартире, а сейчас решила обновить свою домашнюю мебель. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2009 года. Настоящий кредит получила для покупки мебели для дома.
texts.en: Guzaloi is 41 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works in Russia and sends her money monthly.  Guzaloi sells grocery and food products at a store.  She obtained her first loan for the expansion of product selection.  Since that time, she purchased a car.  Her family situation improved as well since then.  She did repairs in her apartment in the summer and now decided to update her home furniture.  Guzaloi has been partnering with our organization since 2009.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of furniture for home.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for home

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 27 years old and married with three children. He runs an electronics shop and repairs bicycles to earn a living. He has been in business for four years and describes his ventures as competitive because many people are in the same trades.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Samson has been able to improve his living standards. He has now applied for a 20,000 KES loan to buy phone chargers and bicycle spare parts. He hopes to expand his businesses and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy phone chargers and bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VICTOIRE est formé de quatre personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Séliatou Dansi, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Séliatou Dansi est âgée de 46 ans et n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Séliatou Dansi est mariée à un tailleur nommé Raouf. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Séliatou Dansi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Séliatou Dansi vend des condiments et du poisson fumé depuis une vingtaine d'année. Séliatou Dansi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Séliatou Dansi désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Séliatou Dansi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe VICTOIRE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Group “Victoire” (Victory) is composed of four persons residing in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, named Séliatou Dansi, is raising her hand in the photo. Séliatou Dansi is 46 years old; she never went to school. Séliatou Dansi is married to a tailor named Raouf. The couple has four dependent children, who all go to school. Séliatou Dansi lives together with her children and husband. The couple supports the household together.

To pay for her various expenses, Séliatou Dansi has been selling condiments and smoked fish for about twenty years. Séliatou Dansi gets her supplies from a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her business and to better satisfy her clients, Séliatou Dansi wants to increase her stock. To do so, she is requesting a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of group “Victoire”.

loans.use: to buy condiments and fish.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 59 years old, married and has six children. She lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City-Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Adelaida has a general store. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP500.00. Adelaida has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, and sugar, etc. 

Adelaida has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Adelaida hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Yedjannagnon Angelo

texts.fr: Âgé de 32 ans, Yedjannagnon Angelo a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire, mais a appris la maçonnerie. Activité, qu'il exerce depuis neuf ans. Yedjannagnon Angelo est marié à une marchande nommée Odette. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Yedjannagnon Angelo vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Pour cette raison, de façon secondaire Yedjannagnon Angelo à un moulin à maïs qui lui rapport des revenues ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Yedjannagnon Angelo s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Yedjannagnon Angelo devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Yedjannagnon Angelo sollicite pour la quatrième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter moulin à maïs et des pièces de rechange.

loans.name: Gabil Bahman Oglu

texts.en:
23-year-old Gabil lives his family life with 2 children. His family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. He is an internally displaced person (IDP). Since 2004 Gabil has been engaged in butchery to improve his family’s living condition. As he didn\'t have enough funds, he couldn\'t develop his business well enough in the beginning. He applies for a loan amount of $1000 for the first first time. 

Gabil needs $1000 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy new cows and sheeps (rams), to increase his income, and to improve his family\'s education needs for good.

loans.use: To buy new cows and sheeps (rams)

loans.name: Lê

texts.en:
Lê's husband, Mr.Cu, incurred a brain injury during the war and is now mentally handicapped. Lê struggles to support the family, and they still have 3 children in school. 

She sells pottery, which she produces herself. The moneylender charges her 50% interest. She is requesting a loan from KIVA for $75 which will enable her to produce more pottery and repay the loan's very reasonable terms.

loans.use: Lê wants to improve her production of pottery

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa S. and her husband Juan T. Perez work together in their small businesses. Rosa weaves and sews the fabric herself. She has two sewing machines purchased with help from a Puente de Amistad loan. She and her husband sell corn and beans in Santa Avelina, and when they aren't out selling they work at home. He does carpentry and she weaves and together they tend a small shop where they sell traditional clothing and kitchen ware. She now keeps her wares bundled because she doesn't have much space but with this loan she would like to buy a display stand. Puente de Amistad has been a great help for Rosa and her family. She has worked hard to build her business because the family could not get by on her husband's income alone. These loans have helped her a great deal to her raise her children and give them a good education.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Rosa S. y su esposo Juan T. Perez trabajan juntos en sus pequeños negocios. Rosa hace tejidos y ella misma las cose a maquina ya que con sus ganancias y el crédito de Puente de Amistad ella ha comprado dos maquinas. Con su esposo ella vende maíz y fríjol en la aldea de Santa Avelina, y cuando no salen a vender su esposo se dedica a la carpintería y ella se dedica a tejer y cuidar a su pequeña tienda donde tiene: Morales Típicos, Güipiles, Rebozos y Utensilios de cocina. Rosa tienen todo su venta junto porque no cuenta con mucho espacio pero si Dios le da vida para otro crédito piensa en comprar un mostrador para colocar su venta. Puente de Amistad a sido una gran ayuda para Rosa y su familia, ya que se ha esforzado en surtir su negocio para poder sostener a su familia porque si solo el esposo trabajara no alcanza el dinero. El credito ha ayudado bastante a Rosa, y es asi como ella ha podido darle a sus hijos una vida y una educación mejor.

loans.use: Making traditional textiles and sales of kitchen wares, corn and beans.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda M. de Morales is 48 years old, married and the mother of 11 children, 5 of whom still live with her. She produces chipas, a very popular cornbread street snack in Paraguay. She produces about 200 chipas per day, but more during the colder season. She spends from 2 am to 7 am baking the chipas in a large brick oven behind her house. She can produce about 18-20 chipas on each tray.

Her husband is 51 years old and is a part-time taxi driver who also helps Hilda in her chipa business. After producing the chipas each day, both Hilda, her husband, and two of their sons, aged 22 and 13, travel to Asuncion to sell the chipas. They usually work until 8 in the evening.

Hilda is requesting a $250 loan to buy more ingredients, such as grated corn and cheese, from a store close to her house in order to make more chipas to sell.

Hilda is member of a committee of women. This group lending allows members to guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group fails to repay their loan, the other group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: Purchase grated corn and cheese

loans.name: Agarza

texts.en:
Agarza has 2 children and lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. He is 42 years old.  He started his farming business 8 years ago.
Now he needs a loan of $600 to buy pesticides for improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Melfy

texts.es:
Melfy is a married woman of 44 years, who has a stand where she sells many types of beverages and ice, and also has a motorcycle which she uses for a taxi service. Beyond those activities, she crochets and sells tablecloths, and her husband works as a clerk. Melfy has 4 years of experience in her commercial business, and she sees a lot of competition. However, demand is also growing. This current loan is to instal a call center (where people can make phone calls for 35 cents) and to increase the merchandise she sells at her stand to include the sale of beer. She has previous loans with this institution, and has repaid them all in a timely and responsible fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Melfy es una señora casada de 44 años de edad, tiene un puesto donde vende todo tipo de bebidas y hielo, por otra parte tambien cuenta con una moto que la hace trabajar como moto-taxi, paralelamente a todas estas actividades confecciona y vende manteles que los elabora a croche, su esposo trabaja como empleado en industrias del Norte. Melfy cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el negocio de comerciante, la competencia es bastante elevada pero así también la demanda es creciente. La presente solicitud es para instalar un Punto VIVA (call center) para lo cual requiere $us. 350.- y para incrementar su mercadería en su puesto de venta (cerveza) $us. 650.- Anteriormete ya saco créditos en nuestra Institución, mismos que los pago de manera responsable y puntual.

loans.use: VENTA DE CERVEZA Y PUNTO VIVA

loans.name: María Encarnación

texts.en:
María is thirty-nine years old, and she and her husband have five children, four of them boys, ranging from twelve to twenty-two years old. For six years, María has been selling women’s clothing. She says that it's a very lucrative business.

Every Tuesday, María goes outsiD. her community to purchase the goods she will resell in her neighborhood. She told us that she makes a weekly profit of about US$ 170.

The entrepreneur has requested a loan to purchase clothing in bulk in Elías Piña, a frontier city with Haiti where garments can be obtained at very low prices. She hopes someday she can have her own locale where she can run her business and no longer have to rent one.

loans.use: to be invested in buying clothing in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Hello from Tanzania! Agnes L. is a 36 year old woman. She is single with four children, ages 7, 10, 15, and 19. In 2002 Agnes established a dry cleaning business and in 2004 she started a grocery business. She now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock and equipment. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her grocery store and equipment for her dry cleaning business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 22 year old man living in south Lebanon, in Saida.  Ahmad sells scrap materiA. and wants to buy a new van for business use. He is therefore asking for a loan from A. Majmoua to help him sustain and expand his trade.

loans.use: To buy a new van

loans.name: Zarbibi

texts.ru:
Zarbibi Davlyatovna M. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 51 years old, married and has ten children. She also has a secondary education. She is in the retail business and has own vendor space at the local market where she sells polyethylene. She brings in the product from Dushanbe (capital of Tajikistan) where she buys it from wholesalers at a lower price and then resells it on the market at a more profitable price. She has been in this business for the past five years. Zarbibi plans to use the loan to increase her commodity turnover. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмудова Зарбиби Давлятовна проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 51 год , замужем имеет 10 детей. Так же имеет среднее образование. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли.Имеет торговую точку на рынке.Продает полиэтилен. Товар привозит из города Душанбе покупая у оптовых реализаторов по более низкой цене и перепродает у себя на рынке по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса 5 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity turnover

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is married with 2 children. She is 32 years of age and hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She rents video Cd’s and sells drinks. O. acquired the skill for 2 years and she has being in this business since 2003. She needs a loan of $875 to enable her buy more drinks and video Cd’s. This  will help her serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more CD cassettes and drinks for sale

loans.name: Anipha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Anipha A.. She is married, and has three children between the ages of 3 and 12. In 2006, Anipha established her small retail business. She earns about US $150 every month from this business. Anipha requires a loan in order to purchase stocks of soap and oil in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets. The lack of tangible collateral assets means they are deemed not-creditworthy by financial institutions, restricting access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of soap and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is 40 years old and is married with 5 children. She lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and cooked food. She learned the restaurant business for one year before going into the business 15 years ago.

Rose has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. She needs a loan of $600 to buy more food and drinks to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and cooking items for sales

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La Sra. V. tiene la edad de 39 años, casada, con un bebé de 40 dias, con 18 años de servicio en educacion. Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar en la docencia, ya que su mayor ilusión ha sido dar el pan de la enseñanza a la niñez de su comunidad, siempre ha trabajado en la modalidad de primaria. La profesora V. esta solicitando un credito, el que utilizara para continuar mejorando su vivienda, ya que hoy mas que antes necesita tener una vivienda digna para poder dar mejores condiciones y mayor comodidad a su primera hija que tanto habia esperado. La profesora aseguró que los creditos le han servido mucho, y es de la unica forma que ha podido realizar el sueño de su vida, ya que con su salaria no podria tener su vivienda en optimas condiciones.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. V. is 39 years old and married with a baby who is 40 days old; she has worked for 18 years in education. From a very early age she began working in teaching, always at the grade school level, and her greatest illusion was to give children in her community the gift of learning. Professor V. is asking for a loan that she will use to continue improving her home; now more than ever she needs to have a dignified home for her first child that she waited so long to have. The professor assures us that the loans have helped her enormously saying that it is the only way she has been able to fulfill her lifelong dream since with only her salary she could not have had her house in optimal condition.

loans.use: Purchase of bathroom tile for the walls and paint

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr:
Arame F. is 45 years old, married with 2 children and 3 other people in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Lélo in Thiès for 8 years. She would like to buy and sell local fruits such as mangoes. Arame hopes to strengthen her business and improve the living conditions of her children. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Arame F., 45 ans, mariée avec 02 enfants et 03 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Lélo à Thiès depuis 8 ans. Elle veut acheter et revendre des fruits locaux comme les mangues. Arame souhaite renforcer ses activités et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To sell local fruit

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 40 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 15 and 7 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Rehema is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: He is 27 years old, is married and has one child. Rashad started his taxi business five years ago. He currently lives in Baku City. Rashad would like a loan of $1200 to help buy more spare parts in order to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Thi Thoa's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Thoa, sinh năm 1977 ( Ms 05050017), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư kinh doanh cửa hàng bán quần áo. Chị là người hoạt bát, nhanh nhẹn, thẳng thắn và được cả nhóm vay vốn yêu mến bầu làm nhóm trưởng. Chồng chị là lái xe, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. N.ài việc kinh doanh hàng quần áo, chị còn nhận thêm hàng chổi tre về làm tại nhà tạo thu nhập. thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Trong nhóm vay vốn của chị còn có:
Ngô Thị Hương, sinh năm 1982 ( Ms 05050002 ), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm chổi tre, chổi nan. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vn đ/ tháng.
Tạ Thị Ly, sinh năm 1958 ( Ms 05050003 ), tham gia vay vốn mức:3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi cá, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vn đ/ tháng.
Chử Thị Lý, sinh năm 1966 ( Ms 05050001), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm chổi tre đem bán.
Lê Thị Thi, sinh năm 1973 ( Ms 05050005), tham gia vay vốn mức: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư kinh doanh chổi tre, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 2.500.000 vn đ / tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Thoa (ID Number 05050017), born in 1977, would like to borrow 4,028,000VND to invest in her clothes shop. She is an active and righteous person, so she was voted to be the group leader. Her husband is a driver, whiL. her two children are still going to school. Besides having the clothes shop, she also makes bamboo brooms at home. Her family's average monthly income is about 4,000,000VND (about 250USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Huong (ID Number 05050002 ), born in 1982, borrows 4,028,000VND to invest in making bamboo brooms. Her average monthly income is about 2,000,000VND (about 125USD).
  • Mrs. T. Thi Ly (ID Number 05050003), born in 1958, borrows 3,604,000VND to invest in raising fish. Her average monthly income is about 2,000,000VND (about 125USD).
  • Mrs. C. Thi Ly (ID Number 05050001), born in 1966, borrows 4,028,000VND to make bamboo brooms.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Thi (ID Number 05050005), born in 1973, borrows 3,604,000VND to invest in making and selling bamboo brooms. Her average monthly income is 2,500,000VND (about 156USD).

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in clothes shop

loans.name: Hom

texts.en: Mrs. Hom U. is 25 years old. She lives in Ta Sean village in Kampong Cham Province where she sells fruit. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so Mrs. Hom U. decided to ask for a loan to bU. more fruit. Her husband, Mr. Met Mean, is a driver in a company. Mrs. Hom U. has two young children, ages 8 months and 4 years.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fruits for her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ducks and duck food.

loans.name: Dora Hilda

texts.es:
La casa que habita la señora R. es muy amplia, pero no siempre fue así, como la mayoría de las familias de este sector poco a poco han ido fabricando su vivienda; con el paso del tiempo han logrado mucho, pero aún no es suficiente,  en este instante pretenden aplicar el enjarre exterior, para cambiar la apariencia de su casa.
Doña Dora trabaja como auxiliar contable para una empresa transportista, además de atender a sus 4 hijos para que crezcan sanos y con buenos hábitos.
Su colaboración será infinitamente agradecida por esta familia.
texts.en:
The house Mrs. Ramirez lives in is large, but this was not always the case. Like the majority of the families in this area, she has built her home little by little. In time, they have accomplished a lot, but their home is not yet finished. They now intend to plaster the exterior of their home, to change its appearance. Dora works as an assistant accountant for a transportation company as well as caring for her four children so that they grow up to be healthy and have good habits. This family will be forever grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida tratando de salir adelante, vive en su casa propia y a sus 50 años lucha por darle a sus 3 hijos; Alexander, Jakeline y Flor la vida que se merecen. Con la ayuda de ellos emprende su negocio diario, ella vende ropa en su propia casa y disfruta de conversar con sus clientes, lo más difícil es conseguir la ropa que vende, puesto que tiene que adquirir lo más bonito y elegante, su negocio es muy rentable, ya que no solo vende ropa a sus clientes, sino que también le vende a pequeños puestos de ropa, los cuales compran las prendas directamente de la casa de Juana. La experiencia de 8 años que tiene haciendo este negocio, le ha dado el conocimiento necesario para hacerlo crecer, quiere tener una tienda en un lugar céntrico, para vender más y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Juana se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con MFP y sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte para pagar sus cuotas, además es la secretaria de su banco comunal y tiene que dar el ejemplo. Con este nuevo préstamo, quiere incrementar su mercadería, comprar más zapatos, blusas, jeans, etc., e invertirá todo el dinero del crédito en ello.
texts.en:
Juana has spent a large part of her life trying to improve her economic situation. She lives in her own house and she is 50 years old. She has worked hard to give her 3 children, Alexander, Jakeline and Flor, the life that they deserve. Her children now help her with her business. She sell clothes out of her home and she enjoys talking to her customers. The hardest part of her business is getting the clothing to sell, since she needs to get the prettiest and most elegant clothing. Her business is very profitable. She also sells clothing to small stores and stands. These stores buy the items directly from Juana's house. Juana has 8 years of experience in the business and it has given her the knowledge that she needs to make the business grow. She wants to open her own store in a central location. She wants to sell more and to increase her income. This will be Juana's second loan through MFP and she knows that she will have to work hard so that she can make all of the payments. She is also the secretary and her communal bank and she has to be a example for everyone. She will invest the money for the loan in the purchase of new merchandise, like shoes, blouses, jeans, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Her Merchandise

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 33 years old and married with a child. He has a medicine store, where he sells medicine both wholesale and retail to his customers. He needs a loan in the amount of N50, 000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Kadévi

texts.fr: Mr Kadévi A. est né en 1958, il est marié avec dix (10) enfants en charge. Menuisier de formation, il manque de fond de base pour bien démarrer ses activités. Très courageux, il est déterminé à s'exprimer par son travail. Il sollicite ainsi un financement pour ouvrir un atelier, s'équiper en outils de travail et acheter des planches. Des fruits de son travail, il pourra désormais faire face aux problèmes de son ménage et assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr Kadévi A. was born in 1958 and is married with ten children. A carpenter by trade, he is lacking some of the basic necessities required to start up his business. A very brave man, he is determined to express himself through his work. He is therefore asking for a loan to open a workshop, to kit himself out with the tools of the trade and to buy some planks of wood. In the future, the fruits of his labour will allow him to confront the problems of running a home and ensure his childrens’ education.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a carpentry workshop, buy tools and planks of wood

loans.name: Kaseen

texts.en: Kaseen is a furniture maker. He is 45 years old and married with five children. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nairas to purchase more wood to make furniture to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase wood to make furniture

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 29 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en la casa de su familia junto a su única hija, Maira de 9 años, y lo que más desea es darle una buena vida, aunque para eso tenga que trabajar mucho. Tiene un puesto de venta de juguetes en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable, lleva realizando esta actividad 2 años y lo que más le gusta es ver el rostro de felicidad que ponen los niños cuando tienen uno de sus juguetes en la mano, ya que siempre le gustaron los niños, es por eso que decidió dedicarse a este trabajo. Elena espera tener en el futuro una tienda más grande donde pueda vender muchos más juguetes, para ello sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro y sin descanso, considera que lo más difícil de su labor es traer los juguetes desde la ciudad de Tacna (ciudad al sur de Péru, límite con Chile), ya que el viaje le es muy largo y cansado, causando que pierda mucho tiempo en conseguir su mercadería. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los 500 soles que solicita comprará más juguetes para implementar mejor su tienda y así ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elena is 29 years old. She is a very happy woman. She lives in her family's house with her only daughter Maira, who is 9 years old. Her greatest desire in life is to give Maira a good life, even if she has to work a lot to make it possible. Elena has a vending station in the San José market (a large market in the city of Juliaca) where she sells toys. She is very happy with her business, seeing it's quite profitable. She has been in this business for two years. The thing she likes most is seeing children's happy faces when they are holding one of her toys, as she has always loved children. This is also the reason she decided to start this business. In future, Elena hopes to have a larger shop where she can sell many more toys. To do this, she knows she must work very hard and without breaks. The most difficult aspect of Elena's work is transporting the toys from the city of Tacna (a city in the south of Peru, near the border with Chile), seeing the trip is very long and tiring. As such, it takes a lot of time to acquire her merchandise. This is Elena's second loan with MFP [Kiva partner]. She understands that she needs to pay it back on time and is prepared to do so. Elena is a very responsible member of her community bank. She always makes sure agreements among members are fully met. She plans to use the requested loan of 500 soles [about US $175] to purchase more toys in order to improve how her shop operates and, in doing so, provide greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand merchandise on offer

loans.name: Uyuni

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This Myuni M. from Meya. She is forty-five years old and married with three  children, who are between the ages of fifteen and twenty-five.

Myuni has been running a soap production business since 2006. She both manufactures and sells her soaps. She works at her business for five to eight hours a day, six days a week, and is assisted by two employees. Myuni currently earns about $110 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to increase production. In the future, she plans to further develop her business. Myuni thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To increase production.

loans.name: Alexandra Guadalupe

texts.es: Alexandra C. López tiene 27 años, es madre soltera y no tiene hijos. Alexandra se dedica a la actividad económica como es la venta de ropa, la ubicación de su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado central. La Señora empezó este negocio hace mas de 6 años,  tiempo en que inicio debido a que su familia ha estado en este negocio desde hace tiempo, y es por eso que nace esta idea en Alexandra. Sus inicios se dan con muy poca cantidad de ropa, ya en su mayoría de clientes siempre solicitaban productos como  ropa para niños, y con el tiempo es que ha logrado incrementar un poco su inventario. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de trajes para damas, ropa para caballeros, ropa para niños y sabanas. El deseo de Alexandra es seguir con vida para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Alexandra C. López is 27 years old. She is a single with no children. She sells clothing in the central market. She started her business more than 6 years ago, and got started in this line of work because her family had been in it for some years, which gave her the idea. She started with very little clothing, as most of her customers always requested children’s clothing, and over time she has managed to increase her inventory a bit. The money she is requesting is a capital investment for the purchase of women's dresses, men's clothing, children's clothing and sheets. Alexandra's wish is to stay alive to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor M. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Eleonor is married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonor owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Eleonor has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eleonor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleonor is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Eleonor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Isael

texts.es: Isael tiene 30 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 6 años en su casa propia. Se dedica a las tareas agrícolas desde niño, ya que proviene de una familia netamente agricultora. En la actualidad siembra papa y maíz para el consumo familiar y para comercializar cultiva la alfalfa, la cual vende en la plaza de su localidad, asimismo alquila los surcos de sus chacras a sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene ingresos económicos extras. Como este trabajo no requiere de mucho tiempo durante la siembra y crecimiento de los productos, Isael aprovecha para ofrece su labor como albañil. Para un futuro cercano, desea adquirir más extensiones de terreno para seguir sembrando alfalfa y tener mayores ventas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, es su primera experiencia de trabajo en un banco comunal y su compromiso es de ser una persona colaboradora para el desarrollo de su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado en la compra de fertilizantes y para mejorar algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Isael is 30 years old, and lives in a house he owns with his wife and 6-year old son. He has dedicated himself to agricultural activities since he was a youth, given that he comes from a farming background. Currently, he plants potato and corn for his family’s consumption. He also grows alfalfa, which he sells in his town’s plaza. Concurrently, he leases sections of his farmlands to neighbors, which generates additional income. Isael takes advantage of the fact that there is less work to be done during his crops’ planting and growing stages by offering his services as a construction worker.
