texts.en: Hamid Allah lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his own family. He has a car parts shop, and he has been working in this business more than 5 years. During the last 5 years he attracted a lots of clients, but he was unable to complete his stock. He has requested an individual loan to complete his stock. He wants to make a good monthly income to help his family. He is happy. He would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.en:
Ana is a persistent and visionary businesswoman. Two years ago, she left her hometown and moved to Palavé, a community of San Cristobal to open a wholesale sandwiches store with her husband. “I’d been visiting many places until I came here, and I knew that I’ve reached my target market. Then, my husband and I, we decided to set up the business here”, she explains. “Naturally, for our sons, it was difficult the adjustment to that new life," she continues saying.

Fortunately, the children gradually got used to the new atmosphere, and Ana’s business has been very dynamic and profitable. Currently, her customers visit the store every day to purchase sandwiches in order to retail in the surroundings. Ana would like to add new goods to diversify her offering and attract new clients. She has requested a loan to purchase raw materials to keep producing her delicious sandwiches and make a good income. That way, the entrepreneur will maintain a comfortable lifestyle for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to continue the production for her wholesale sandwiches store.

loans.name: Marach D(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Rukia N.. She is currently in the business of matooke selling and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Rukia is 40 years old and married. She has 2 children aged 18 and 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Rukia makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to help her husband with the construction of their new house. Previously, Rukia had a loan from BRAC Uganda in the amount of UGX 150000 to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Rukia is joined in her small group by Fatuma A. and Patricia N.. Fatuma A. has a business in selling used clothes and wants to increase her stock of clothes. Patricia N. currently sells used clothes and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more matooke for sale

loans.name: Shani

texts.en:
Shani is 29 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, aged 7 years old. Shani owns a small grocery store and sells charcoal, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin A. is married with 3 children.  She is 48years of age and hails from Ijaniki, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and drinks, a trade that she acquired for 2 years. She has been in this business since 1988 and has been with LAPO Microfinance for 4 years. She needs the sum of $1200 to enable her to buy more food items and drinks for sale. With this she will be able to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food items

loans.name: Mario De Jesús

texts.es:
Mario R. is a gentleman who has stood out as a hard worker in the agricultural business, having acquired vast experience over the years. He is the father of two children of whom he is really proud because they have excelled in their school in the municipality of El Sauce in the beautiful city of León, Nicaragua.

A problem that Mr. R. has faced for some time is that there is no electricity in his community because he lives in a rural area. It is difficult for them to have light at night, which he does by means of an oil lamp that only illuminates a section of the living room and not the rest of the house. As a result, he has requested the installation of a solar panel to have electricity. He now has a debt which he must pay off, so he is seeking the help of Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will help him pay for the panel, thus providing his beloved family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario R. es un caballero que se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador y dedicarse al negocio agropecuario habiendo adquirido basta experiencia a través de los años que se ha dedicado a esta labor. Es padre de familia con dos hijos que según comenta se siente muy orgulloso debido a que ellos se han destacado como buenos alumnos en su colegio en el municipio de El Sauce en la bella ciudad de León en Nicaragua.

Una problemática que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado el señor Mario de Jesús es que vive en una comunidad donde no existe energía eléctrica por ser una zona rural y para ello le es imposible iluminarse por las noches por lo que lo hace por medio de un candil que no abarca toda su vivienda sino una cierta parte de la sala. Para esto, ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para usar la energía para iluminarse. Al haberlo adquirido tiene el deber de cancelar esta deuda y es aquí donde busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita la cancelación del panel y así iniciar a brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida a su amada familia.

loans.use: Payment of home solar panel

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita O. makes a living selling palm oil in one-gallon jugs, a trade that she taught herself.  She has been in this business since 2003. Rita is 32 years old and married with five children. She has been a client at LAPO Microfinance for the past three years. Rita needs a loan of $850 to buy palm oil and a generator that will help her business function more efficiently.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and a generator

loans.name: Agustín

texts.es:
Agustín is a gentleman who works as a technician at a gasoline station in the town of Ticuantepe, where he is from. Agustín lives with his wife and 4 children for whom he must provide and also educate.

He has two manzanas (a unit of measurement for land equal to 1.68 acres) of land on which he cultivates pineapple. He has been working in agriculture for 8 years. While looking for better opportunities for his family, he decided to look for another job, since pineapples can’t be harvested every month of the year, and he needs to feed his family. For this reason, Agustín gets up very early every morning so that he can dedicate some time to his pineapples.

He needs the loan so that he can buy organic fertilizers to use on his land. That way, the pineapples will show the expected results and be of the best quality, so that he can earn enough to continue getting by, just like he always has.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Agustín es un señor que trabaja como técnico en una bomba de una gasolinera del municipio de Ticuantepe, de donde es originario. Don Agustín vive con su señora y con 4 hijos, a los cuales tiene que darles educación y el sustento diario. Tiene 2 manzanas de tierra, en las cuales cosecha piña, tiene 8 años de experiencia en la agricultura. En busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia, decidió buscar un empleo, ya la cosecha de piña no se da todo los meses del año, y necesita alimentar a su familia. Es por eso que donAgustín se levanta muy temprano en las mañanas para poder dedicarle tiempo a sus piñas. El motivo del préstamo es para adquirir abonos orgánicos para regarlos en sus tierras, y así las piñas al momento de la cosecha puedan rendir los resultados esperados y sean de la mejor calidad para poder obtener suficientes ganancias para seguir saliendo adelnate como siempre lo ha hecho.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to use on his pineapples so that he can acheive improved production

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with two children, Oleg and Diana. He is a businessman from Zaporozhye. He runs his clothing venture in the local covered market. Vitalyi is very thorough and hard-working which helps him run his business efficiently. He has been in the trade for 10 years. Presently, he has about $2400 in inventory. His gross income is about $1600. 

Vitalyi is seeking a 5500 Grivna loan to increase his turnover capital and increase his income as a result. He has seen different challenges along the way as after the reconstruction of the marketplace he had to move his to a different location. However, nothing could stop him, he says, and he decided to persevere and achieve even greater success. We believe this strong desire to strive for more and see his business develop will guarantee outstanding results and current loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase sales stock

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 35 years old. She is married with 6 children between 18 and 3 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 1998. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Djavid

texts.en: Djavid was born in 1983. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, and settled in the Fuzuli region in Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. He has been in the auto repair business for 5 years. He is married and has 2 children. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts

loans.name: Savan

texts.en: Mr. Savan B., age 28, earns about $10 per day making money transfers for Cambodians who work in neighboring Thailand. His wife, Mrs. Channy Nit, is a grocery seller who earns about $5 per day. Together, they live with their two children, who are students. The family lives in the Kbal Spean village in the Banteay Meanchey province. Savan now asks for a loan of $1200 to increase capital for his money transfer business. The loan will help him improve his family’s income and support his children’s school fees in the future. Savan's wife is pictured because he was not available at the time.

loans.use: To increase capital for his money transfer business

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol P. is 47 years old and a widow. She lives with her three children in the Battambong province, Cambodia. In 2000, to earn a living, she started selling groceries around the school campus. Thol  is able to earn US$5 a day. Her three children attend the school and always help her during their spare time. She said that each month her family spends an average,  US$60 on food , US$5 on utilities, US$20 on children's education and US$10 on transportation.

Thol P. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to increase her supply of groceries to meet her client’s needs. (The oldest daughter is pictured as Thold P. was not available)

loans.use: Purchase an increased supply of groceries

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị S. năn nay 34 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2005 chiịtham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán quần áo. Hiện nay ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ buôn bán và lương lái xe của chồng nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh quần áo
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi S. is 34 years old. Her family has three children of school age. In 2005, she joined TYM Fund to borrow fund for her clothing business. Currently, besides the income from raising livestock, she has the additional income from clothing sales and her husband's driver salary. Her family grosses 4,000,000 VND per month. Mrs. Tran wishes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in her clothing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Durante más de veinte años Amalia ha dedicado gran parte de su tiempo en la atención y manejo de su bodega. Siempre ha estado buscando la forma de generar ingresos a su casa, por lo que la bodega no ha sido su primer trabajo. Anteriormente, ella se dedicaba a la venta de frutas como ambulante, no obstante, pensó que mantener una bodega seria más seguro. 

Por las noches, además de atender su negocio prepara Salchipapa (plato conformado por papas y salchichas fritas) y vende fuera de su casa. Su hija menor la acompaña y ayuda siempre.

Ella tiene planeado seguir implementado su bodega para tenerla surtida y poder vender mucho más. Por ahora se siente contenta de haber ayudado a sus cinco hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
For more than twenty years Amalia has spent a great part of her time working and managing her grocery store. She has always looked for a way to generate income for her home, which is why her grocery store is not her first job. Previously, she worked at a moving fruit stand. However, she thinks that maintaining her store is a more secure job. In addition to attending business at her store, at nights she prepares Salchipapa (a dish comprised of potatoes and fried sausages), and sells Salchipapa from her house. Her youngest daughter accompanies her and always helps. She plans to continue improving her grocery store in order to have an diversity of goods and to be able to increase her sales. For now, she feels happy to have helped her five children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar mercadería a su bodega

loans.name: Varet

texts.en:
Mrs. Varet D., 28, and her husband, Mr. Chhounvy Khim, 36, were married in 2003 and have one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Varet has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mechanic and mason since he got married. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is married and has one daughter, Victoria, who is 9 years old. She sells women's shoes at the market. Elena has been in this business for 6 years. She was able to develop her business due to her husband's support. Having repeat customers makes this business a steady source of income.

Recently Natalia started up a second business location with a different type of goods - small hope products. She wants to try it out to see if this business direction is profitable enough.

Natalia would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the inventory. She would spend the additional income to remodel their house.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es: Noemí es una madre soltera, tiene 67 años y actualmente vive con sus 2 hijos quienes ya son profesionales y de familia. Todos viven en su casa, la cual es propia, que pudo ir construyendo poco a poco con el esfuerzo de toda su vida. Su actividad diaria es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, porque ella vende frutas regionales y gaseosas, en las instalaciones de su casa desde hace 10 años, durante todo el día, Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con muchas personas y tener un trato directo con sus clientes, que es lo más importante, porque según el trato que ella les brinde, regresarán o no a comprarle, por eso Noemí esta siempre dispuesta a darle una gran sonrisa a toda persona que se acerca para comprar sus frutas o bebidas. Y como ese fue su pensar durante muchos años, cuenta con una gran gama de clientes, quienes no dejan de comprarle ni un día, debido a su buena atención, y así sea una pequeña fruta, le compra a diario. Adicionalmente, ofrece productos de belleza por catálogo y también le va bien. En adelante, Noemí quiere refaccionar el espacio donde tiene su negocio para que se vea más acogedor a sus clientes. El dinero que solicita es para su negocio de venta de frutas regionales y bebidas, y lo restante lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para tener en stock.
texts.en:
Noemí is a single mother, is 67 years old and she currently lives with her two sons who are already professionals with families. All of them live in her house, which she built herself, bit by bit, as her entire life’s effort. Her daily activity is to provide a good service to her customers, because she has been selling regional fruits and soft drinks at her house all day long for ten years. What she likes about her job is interacting with so many people and dealing directly with her customers, which is very important because, based on the treatment she gives them, they will or will not return to buy things. That is why Noemí is willing to give a big smile to everyone who comes to buy her fruit and drinks. And this is why she thinks that for so many years she has had a wide range of customers, who continue to buy a little fruit or a newspaper from her every day, thanks to the good treatment. Additionally she offers beauty products from a catalog and this also does well. In the future, Noemí wants to repair the area where she has her business so that it is more welcoming to her customers. The money that she is asking for is for her regional fruit and drinks business, and the rest will be invested in the purchase of beauty products to have in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Bayandik

texts.en:
Bayandik T. is a 40-year-old farmer. He is married and has two adorable daughters.

He has seven years of experience breeding calves. He purchase small calves, fattens them, and then, after several months, sells them to the local traders. He wakes up early in the morning to pasture them in the field. All day long, he spends with his calves. Calf breeding is the only source of income for Bayandik`s family and he tries very hard to meet the family's needs.

Bayandik has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase two calves and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Ashurhon

texts.ru:
В центре города расположен салон красоты «Бону» что в переводе с таджикского означает «Прекрасная женщина». Этот салон принадлежит Ашурхон. Ей 34 года, замужем и имеет 4 детей. Муж занимается перевозками людей, а Ашурхон оказывает услуги по украшиванию невест. Эта услуга включает в себя весь спектр услуг: от создания прически до подбора платья и сдачи его в аренду. Те девушки которые выходят замуж заранее записываются к Ашурхон и в назначенный день приехав к ней делают себе прическу макияж и одевают свадебное платье. Ашурхон довольна своей работой и считает, что дарить людям радость это прекрасно!
Для расширения своей деятельности Ашурхон решила получить небольшой займ на КИВА.
texts.en:
Located downtown is a beauty salon called Bonu, which is Tajik for "beautiful woman." This salon belongs to Ashurhon. She is 34 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is in personal transportation, and Ashurhon provides bridal services. These services run the gamut from styling hair to selection and renting of a gown. The girls who are planning to marry make an appointment in advance with Ashurhon and come to her on the day of the wedding to have their hair and make-up done, and to put on their wedding dresses. Ashurhon enjoys her work and feels that making people happy is great. Ashurhon decided to take out a small loan with Kiva to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is 26 years old, single, and has two children, ages 7 and 3. For the past 6 years, she has been running a small shop in the Ruaha  neighborhood of Iringa. Happy belongs to the Ngeleli loan group (Group code 2015), and currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $95. She works for about 12 hours every day.

Happy is now requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to be able to increase her current stock of goods and thereby improve her business. She hopes that, through this loan, her profit will increase, and she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of items for sale at a store

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander Antonio M. C. tiene 26 años, es un joven soltero. La actividad económica de este joven es venta de ropa. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Alexander es un joven con muchas ganas de trabajar, y esto lo impulso a buscar este medio de trabajo, por lo que recorre las calles ofreciendo su productos y lo realiza con una sonrisa y brindándoles a sus clientes lo que ellos necesitan. Por lo que los financiamientos le ayudan a incrementar su inventario. Es por eso que solicita este capital de trabajo para la compra de calcetines, ropa interior, toallas, camisolas y shorts. El sueño de Alexander es establecer un negocio en un lugar determinado y además lograr estudiar.
texts.en:
Alexander Antonio M. C. is 26-years old and single. His work activity is clothing sales, which he has worked in for more than seven years. Alexander enjoys working and this characteristic prompted him to begin working in sales; he travels the streets offering his products with a smile and delivering the products that his customers need. Financing helps him increase his inventory, that's why he is requesting this working capital loan to purchase socks, underwear, towels, camisoles and shorts. Alexander dreams of establishing his business in a store location and also of continuing his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Constancio

texts.en:
Constancio is 49 years old and is married to Jessica. The couple help each other in maintaining their corn and rice farming business to combat life difficulties. They are blessed with four children: Joseph - 19 years old, a baker; John – 16 years old, and still in grade school; Texso - 15 years old, who is not studying; and Joan - 13 years old, who is helping them earn a living through vegetable vending. The family is living in the village of San Vicente in Angadanan, Isabela.

Constancio is requesting to borrow PHP 23,000 from Kiva lenders as farming capital for this planting season. He will buy fertilizers, a bag of seed and hire farm laborers to cultivate and plant crops. Constancio is working hard towards the development of his farming and their family living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Reshma

texts.en:
Reshma M. is the owner of a small vegetable shop. She opened her vegetable shop a year ago to uplift the standard of living of her family. She sells green and non-green vegetables in her shop. She buys the vegetables from Kalimati which is one of the famous wholesale vegetable bazaars of the Kathmandu valley. She has already taken out a first loan and has cleared her loan. With her first loan she was able to raise the income from her shop.

Now Mrs. M. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 15,000 to buy various types of vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, onions etc. for her shop.

Mrs. M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two daughters. Her older daughter is studying in grade 2 and her younger daughter is only 20 months old. She wants to provide good education for her daughters but in Nepal the cost of good education is very high.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her shop

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline G. manages a small rice field. She is 40 years old and has four children who are all studying in school. She wants to send them to college but, because of poverty, she is afraid that she might not be able to do it. Young as she is, Evangeline will never just give up easily. She is doing all her best to be able to grow her farm even more. She needs a loan to buy the two bags of fertilizers and ammonium sulfate needed on her farm. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides all its clients with not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of fertilizers and ammonium sulfate

loans.name: Enith Vanesa

texts.es:
Vanesa es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfadoras.
Vanesa es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Vanesa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Vanesa necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y leche.
Los sueños de Vanesa son mejorar su negocio y brindar toda comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vanesa is a member of the Triunfadoras Community Bank. She cohabits, is 30 years old and has 3 children. Vanesa has a store in her house in which she sells general groceries like fruits, vegetables and meat. She is able to perform this activity with the help of her daughter. Vanesa needs a loan of $225 which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and milk. Vanesa's dreams are to improve her business and provide total comfort to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Faraja

texts.en:
Faraja is a member of the Frelimo A borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 i child.Her child is aged 2 years.

Faraja started her own shop business selling rice,cooking oil, sugar 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 350,000 Tanzania shilling.

This is Faraja`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Faraja hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Uranbileg

texts.en:
S. Uranbileg lives with her two children in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. Both of her children currently attend college, making it very difficult for the family to save money. Uranbileg operates a small food service business in her town. She makes and sells Mongolian traditional foods such as huushuur (meat covered with flour and fried from the outside) and buuz (steamed meat dumplings).

As these foods are popular for those on the go, her main customers are college students and office workers. She produces and packages her products quickly making it easy for customers to grab a quick bite to eat. For the future, her ultimate goal is to grow her business and open a small restaurant. She says, “It will be great contribution to my children's welfare.” She is requesting a 750,000 tugrug (~530 USD) loan to open that small restaurant.

loans.use: to open a small restaurant

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta L.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Matatufu. Elisapeta is married and has five adult children. She has just started this business and earns approximately 400 talas a month.

Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elisapeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 talas from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Elisapeta is now requesting a new loan of 1500 talas which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fourth loan from SPBD. Elisapeta plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lily Miriam

texts.es:
La señora LILY MIRIAM M. Q., tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS 5 ESTRELLAS . Ella presenta estudios superiores de enfermería técnica y está casada tiene 2  hijos pequeños quienes  depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedicaba a la venta de ropa para niños, jóvenes y adultos. Actualmente se dedica a la alfabetización (educación)de personas mayores, esta actividad la realiza en su misma casa.
Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para retomar su negocio de la compra y venta de ropa para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
LILY sueña con empezar a vender obtener dinero y poco a poco hacer que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Señora LILY MIRIAM M. Q. is 40 years old and lives in the Trujillo district of Trujillo province in the La Libertad region of Perú. She belongs to the communal bank "Las 5 Estrellas." She has completed studies in technical nursing, and is married with two small children who depend on her economically. She used to sell clothing for children, youths and adults. Currently she is involved in literacy training for adults, and she carries out this activity in her own home. This is her first loan; she needs 300 nuevos soles that will be used to resume her business of buying and selling clothing for children, youths and adults. Lily dreams of starting to sell and making money, and seeing her business grow little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothes for children, youths and adults

loans.name: Emerita Yolixa

texts.es:
La señora EMERITA YOLIXA, tiene  24 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II. Ella presenta estudios técnicos de docencia (profesora). 
Ella se dedica a dar servicio de locutorio instalado en la casa de sus padres, en sus ratos libres se dedica a la alfabetización.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro tarifadores, sillas, teléfonos para poner mas cabinas de locutorio en su casa. 
Con este préstamos de 800.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá para poner otro locutorio en la casa de sus padres como así también comprar máquinas tragamonedas.
EMERITA sueña con expandirse, lograr tener una cadena de locutorios y también comprar máquinas tragamonedas.
texts.en:
Sra. Emerita Yolixa is 24 years old and lives in the District of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Esfuerzo de Mujeres II” (Effort of Women II). Emerita has a teaching degree.

She provides calling services out of her parents’ home. In her free time, Emerita teaches literacy classes. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought tarifadores (devices that measure and monitor telephone usage), chairs, and telephones so that she could install more phone booths in her house.

Emerita is requesting a new loan of 800 soles in order to establish another call center in her parents’ home. In addition, she will use part of the money to buy slot machines. She dreams of expanding her business by owning a chain of call centers and purchasing more slot machines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Establish a call center in her parents' house & purchase slot machines

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mr. Sat S. lives in the village of Sdao Kanlaeng in Kandal Province. He and his wife, Mrs. In Sin Nary, are farmers who own a plot of land for cultivating both rice and vegetables. In their cultivating, they face an obstacle, because they do not have enough money to buy some vegetable seeds and fertilizers for their field. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Sat S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. He is 60 years old and the father of two children who are fishermen. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy some vegetable seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega 1,2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group Alfa y Omega (Alpha and Omega), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the areas surrounding Santiago, the DR's second largest city, which is located in the Cibao valley and is famous for agricultural production. In this area, however, running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 4 children.

Ana is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, selling a variety of items that she has identified a market for, including inexpensive jewelry, shoes, and perfumes. She will use the profits to invest in her family and improving her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Shoes, perfumes, and jewelry to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi is twenty-nine years of age. He is single and has no children. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the occupation of the people is mainly farming. Kofi deals in herbal and scientific medicines. He sells them in a shop by the roadside in his community. Kofi has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Aliyu Keturu Draru Group

texts.en:
K. Draru is the chairperson of her group; she is thirty-two years of age and married. She looks after five dependents although she has no child of her own. Three of her dependents are going to school.

Draru has dealt in produce such as cassava flour, groundnuts (peanuts), beans, etc., so far for ten years. She is using the loan to purchase more produce to improve her business stock for much better profits.

Draru is a hardworking businesswoman who is looking forward for prospering and helping her family, especially her parents.

loans.use: To purchase more produce to improve her business stock

loans.name: Myline

texts.en:
Myline A. is from the village of Taboo,Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Myline is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Myline owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Myline has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Myline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myline is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: Agueda M. M. de 56 años de edad, residen en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su único hijo. Ella posee una venta de cosméticos, y cremas para el cabello, así mismo comercializa ropa para mujer. La venta esta ubicada en su propia casa de habitación, lugar el cual cuenta con muy buena ubicación, ya que su casa esta en la esquina de la calle principal, y se encuentra muy cerca del punto de buses del transporte público, lo que provoca que muchas personas transiten por el lugar a toda hora del día. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de cosméticos, así mismo desea poder comprar ropa en diversidad de colores y tallas, de manera que pueda obtener mayor cantidad de clientes. Agueda es una persona muy trabajadora quien siempre ha deseado seguir adelante con su negocio y poder crecer como comerciante, de esta manera ella espera mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Agueda is 56 years old and lives in the San Salvador Department with her only son. She sells cosmetics, hair creams, and ladies’ clothing out of her home. Her home is in a good location, on the corner of a main street, close to the public bus depot, and many people pass by daily. She is requesting this loan in order to invest in larger amounts of cosmetics and clothing in a variety of colors and sizes, so that she can increase her number of customers. Agueda is a hard worker who has always wanted to get ahead with her business, grow as a businesswoman, and improve her financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in cosmetics and clothing for resale

loans.name: Berth

texts.fr: F. Berth est née le 20 Décembre 1958 au quartier Allomey à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique, où elle réside depuis sa naissance. Mariée à DASSI Michel, un instituteur retraité, Berth est mère de six enfants, mais cinq restent encore à sa charge. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. Berth vit avec ses enfants à Allomey. Mais le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Berth a fréquenté jusqu’au secondaire. Il y a 18 ans environs que Berth mène comme activité, la vente des canaris, de l’oignon et des épices au marché de Allada. C’est à Bohicon et à Malanville que Berth se ravitaille. Berth a bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Berth sollicite un troisième crédit pour renforcer surtout son activité de vente d’oignons et d’ails, et mieux faire face à la demande des clients. Berth ambitionne plus tard construire sur sa parcelle.
texts.en:
Berth F. was born December 20, 1958 in the Allomey neighborhood of Allada, in the Department of the Atlantic, where she has lived since her birth. Married to Michel DASSI, a retired schoolteacher, Berth is the mother of six children, of whom five are still under her care. Only some of the children are in school. Berth herself has attended school up to secondary level. She lives with her children in Allomey, and shares family expenses with her husband. Some 18 years ago Berth began selling canaris (pottery containers), onions and spices at the Allada market. She gets her supplies from Bohicon and Malanville. Berth has been granted two previous loans from ALIDé, both of which were repaid in full. She is now requesting a third loan, to strengthen in particular her sales of onions and garlic, so she can better respond to customer demand. Berth’s ambition for the future is to build on her plot of land.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy canaris (pottery containers) and one bag of onions and garlic

loans.name: House Wives Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “House Wives” group from Makeni. Isatu C. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She sells 'gara lappers' (locally dyed cloth, sometimes with fabricated designs), shoes, and bars of soap. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She and her colleagues are seeking from Kiva lenders a loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to invest in their businesses. Isatu C. will use her share of SLL 800,000 to buy shoes, gara lapper-making materials, and soaps in order to improve her business. 

Isatu C. was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The 30-year-old is married with four children. Her husband is a businessman and all four of her children are attending primary school.

loans.use: Buy shoes, gara lapper-making materials, and soaps in order to improve her business

loans.name: Srimathi

texts.en:
Srimathi is a 34-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, Matara with her husband and three children who are still studying. Her husband is an army officer.

Srimathi has a small business making string hoppers, which are a form of long thin rice noodles, which she sells to local stores and food cabins. Every morning she wakes up early to make the food to be sold to the shops, and she has been doing it for four years now.

When Srimathi’s husband is not busy with military duties, he assists her in the business. Her children help her as well when they have the time. She has a very good location for her business, as she supplies food next to some government offices so the nearby businessmen purchase breakfast and dinner very often.

Srimathi has requested a 45,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to purchase new equipment for her food production business.

In the future, Srimathi hopes to pay the rental fee for her rented paddy field and to pay her children’s tuition fees using earnings from her business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for food production

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Mrs. Ban P., aged 43, is a farmer. She owns a piece of farmland on which she plants many types of crops, especially rice, from which she earns a living. She has a life partner, her husband, who is helping her with her business activities. The couple has been married for many years and is blessed with five teenage kids. All of them are going to school or work as well. Ban P. will use her first loan to improve her daily profits from the farming business. She will buy insecticide, fertilizer, and seeds to improve her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, fertilizer, and seeds to improve her crop yield.

loans.name: Daryl Joy

texts.en:
Daryl Joy M. is happy taking care of her family, especially her four children whose age range is from 3 to 12 years old. Despite poverty, the love and support she gets from her husband is the bond that keeps her holding on to life and making it worth living. Her dream of graduating her children from college is her reason for putting up her own small “sari-sari” (variety) store business using a loan she received through ASHI. Proceeds of this business will be her financial source for achieving her dream. 

Daryl Joy hopes that someday her small “sari-sari” will grow into a huge grocery store that can bring convenience to people in their village. To be able to reach this vision, Daryl Joy is requesting a larger loan through ASHI (14,000 PHP). Her husband and the entire family is excited for Daryl Joy’s business endeavor.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store.

loans.name: God Our Father Group

texts.en:
Ivy K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Our Father. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children aged 2 and 14. She also cares for four siblings. She is presently a college student.

For the past ten years, Ivy has been selling rubber plates and spoons, clothes, pots,and hair wigs at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She provides good service to her customers, which keeps them returning. Ivy sometimes faces problems with a scarcity of customers, which makes business slow for her.   

Ivy plans to use her 14,000 LRD portion of this 62,000 LRD group loan to buy more rubber plates and spoons, clothes, pots, and hair wigs. Her goal is to grow her business and continue to support her children so that they have a better future.Ivy describes herself as a friendly Liberian business woman. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Ivy is holding the sign. And Sinoe is inset at the lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more rubber materials, such as plates and spoons, cloths, pots, hair wigs and weaves

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen termino de estudiar la carrera de Antropología y actualmente viene realizando los tramites para obtener su Bachiller, Karen es soltera, tiene 25 años y vive con su madre, vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. Los sueños de Karen son obtener su titulo e implementar una florería para lo cual esta buscando local.
Karen es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella y necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de flores artificiales.
texts.en:
Karen finished her studies of Anthropology and presently she is processing her batchelor's degree. Karen is single, 25 years old and lives with her mother. She sells cosmetics from catalogs to friends and relatives. It is Karen´s dream to obtain her degree and set up a flower shop for which she is searching for premises.

Karen is a partner of "Banco Comunal Estrella" and requires a loan of 1000 soles to be invested in buying artificial flowers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase artificial flowers.

loans.name: Susana's Group

texts.en:
Susana C. is from the village of Misom Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Millions. Susana is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Susana sells coconuts and has a "sari-sari" store selling products such as eggs, noodles, sugar, and biscuits. Susana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Susana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2009 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Susana is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Susana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Patricia Pilar

texts.es:
Patricia es conviviente y tiene un hijo que estudia, Patricia vive en la casa de sus padres y su mayor sueño es construir su casa, Patricia tiene una tienda en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, condimentos que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Además Patricia trabaja en una empresa de transportes como administradora.
Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azúcar, arroz y aceite.
texts.en:
Patricia is in a common law marriage and has a son who is in school. She lives in the home of her parents and her greatest wish is to build a house of her own. Patricia has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables, meats, and condiments that she prepares herself. Her business is open every day from 6am until 10pm. In addition, Patricia works at a transportation company as an administrator.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Lirio” (Iris) and needs a loan of 2600 PEN to invest in the purchase of milk, sugar, rice, and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem C., 50, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. 

C. and her husband are farmers who grow rice for an income of USD 1 each per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 200 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to improve her family's farming business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German vive en alquiler con su esposa e hijos en la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado tiene dos hijos que están en edad escolar; hace un año atrás se compro un auto el cual trabaja el mismo como taxi  todos los días, con los ingresos que obtiene mantiene a su familia, la esposa vende cds y algunas otras cosas para ayudar a su hogar; el crédito que saco anteriormente fue para reparar su movilidad, y fue parte de Kiva en dos créditos, y de Impro con 8 créditos. German esta satisfecho con los créditos obtenidos y desea solicitar uno para comprar más productos como ser dc, mp3 musicales, películas, etc., para continuar el negocio de su esposa. 

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, pues se lo considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Germán lives in a rental home with his wife and children in the San Martín zone of the city of La Paz. He is married and has 2 children who are of school age. A year ago, he bought an auto which he drives as a taxi every day. With this income, Germán maintains his family. His wife sells CDs and some other things to aid with household expenses. His previous loans were used to repair his car. Two of these were with Kiva and 8 were with Impro. Germán is pleased with the loans he obtained and now, he wishes to solicit another to buy more products, such as CDs, MP3 musicals, films, etc., to help his wife continue her business. Given his historical antecedents, Germán qualifies to obtain a new loan, since he is considered a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CDs, MP3 MUSICALS, AND FILMS TO SELL

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia S. is from the village of Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. She is 61 years old. Lucrecia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lucrecia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables, meat, and fish in the local community. Lucrecia has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lucrecia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucrecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucrecia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lucrecia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza B. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 39 years old. Esperanza is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Esperanza raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Esperanza has been engaged in her business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

Esperanza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Esperanza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28000 PHP from ASKI. Esperanza is requesting a new loan of 24000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Esperanza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Jessica Guadalupe

texts.es:
Jessica de 33 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la casa de sus padres.  

Tenia 18 años cuando comenzó con su pequeña tienda con el fin de darles a sus pares un pequeño negocio ya que ellos no tenían mucha estabilidad económica, fue así que comenzó a trabajar y a invertir sus ahorros en víveres y venderlos. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas víveres como arroz, azúcar, bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere ampliar el negocio y poder ubicar otra tienda en otro lugar para tener mas ingresos y poder ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Jessica, 33, lives in El Fortín, Guayaquil, an area noted for its unpaved streets and informal merchants. She has a small grocery store in her parents’ house. She was 18 years old when she opened the store with the goal in mind to provide her parents with a small business since they didn’t have much economic stability. She started working when she used her savings to buy foodstuffs to sell. Since then and to this day she works from 6am until 10pm daily. She will use the loan to buy more stock items like rice, sugar and beverages for the store. In the future she’d like to expand it and be able to open a second store somewhere else to earn more income and be able to help her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, sugar and beverages.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly, de 35 años, es una madre muy trabajadora, vive en casa de suegra en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. La actividad a la que Kelly se dedica, es la venta de ropa casual, medias y prendas interiores para ambos sexos de ese modo gana su propio capital. El gran carisma y el buen trato que posee, ha sido muy beneficioso en su negocio, aunque sus ventas lo realice de manera ambulatoria, siempre los clientes la prefieren. Se siente muy feliz y contenta de trabajar con este negocio, donde ya lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad, sin embargo le es dificultoso trabajar con su pequeña hija, por lo enfermiza que es y no tiene quien la ayuda a cuidar de ella. En adelante piensa ampliar su negocio y construir su casa con material noble, para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP y  se compromete en pagar a tiempo sus cuotas,  para acceder a otros con mayor tranquilidad sin complicaciones a su grupo comunal, donde la valoran y la tienen presente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más ropa casual, para abastecer su negocio y tener variedad que ofrecer.
texts.en:
Kelly, 35, is a very hard working mother.  She lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her husband and three children.  Kelly sells casual clothing, stockings and underwear for both sexes to earn her own capital.  Her great charisma and kind treatment of customers have been very beneficial for the business.  Even though her sales are ambulatory, customers always prefer her.

She feels happy and content to work with this business where she’s been occupied for four years.  However, it is difficult to work with her small daughter because she is sickly and she doesn’t have anyone who can help care for her. In the future she plans to expand her business and build a house out of substantial materials to improve her children’s quality of life.

This is her 15th loan with MFP and she commits to repay in a timely fashion so that she can access future loans more easily and without complications for her communal group where she is held in high esteem.

She will use the requested funds to buy more casual clothes to stock her business and have variety available.

loans.use: To acquire casual clothes to have in stock.

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk D., 35, sells beverages in a local school in Kampong Chhnang province. She is married with one child, who still lives at home, and her husband is a car driver. She typically makes about US$20 in revenue each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$1000 to purchase more beverages.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages.

loans.name: Cira Silva

texts.es:
Cira tiene 51 años, vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú y desD. hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón D. San Sebastián” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas Arariwa. Cira es docente y se considera una persona trabajadora y emprendedora, ella está casada y fruto esta unión tiene un hijo.   

Luzmila con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir D. $ 500 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para realizar uno D. sus sueños D. viajar al extranjero. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cira is 51 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco, Peru. For a long time she has been involved in the Patron of Saint Sebastian Community Bank through the Arariwa Microfinance program. Cira is a teacher and is considered to be a hard-working and enterprising person. She is married with a son.

She hopes to receive $500 from her next loan and will use the money to fulfill her dream of traveling abroad.

She is very thankful for the opportunity given her through this program and is committed to repaying her loan according to schedule.

loans.use: To fulfill her dream of traveling abroad

loans.name: Pablo Marvin

texts.es: Pablo Marvin tiene 64 años, su actividad es el servicio de comedor. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. El inicio este medio de vida porque tenía una familia de la cual hacerse cargo. Pablo es un hombre muy trabajador y siempre se ha caracterizado ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es la gran competencia que tiene debido a esto le brinda buen servicio y platillos cómodos y algunos buenos clientes tienen crédito. El motivo de Pablo con este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, verduras, jugos, gaseosas entre otras actualmente se aproxima la época navideña.
texts.en:
Pablo Marvin is 64 years old.  He runs a small restuarant and has been for more than 10 years.  Pablo began this type of life because he has a family to take care of.  Pablo is a very hard working man, characterized by always offering the best service to his customers. One of his greatest challenges is the competition his restuarant faces.  Because of this, Pablo offers good service and convienent food and gives some clients meals on credit.

Pablo wants to use this loan to buy primary goods like basic grains, vegetables, juice, and soft drinks among other things, since it is entering the holiday season.

loans.use: Buying food and drinks for his restaurant.

loans.name: Samson Gathigi

texts.en:
Samson Gathigi, 32 years old, has been farming for the past seven years with an income of KES 9,500 per month. He is married to Gladys Muiruri, who helps with the farm. They have two children aged 5 and 6 years old.

Samson is taking his fourth loan with Kadet to buy an extra dairy cow in order to increase milk production on his farm to meet his clients' needs. He hopes to become the leading entrepreneur in dairy farming and to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy an extra dairy cow

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past three years, his potential customers are passersby. Abdalla faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to purchase another motorcycle in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to open a spare parts shop and purchase rims for sale. He decided to join Yehu because of their reliable services.

loans.use: To open a spare parts shop and purchase rims for sale.

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Hernán; el tiene 27 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio se dedica al servicio de taxi, el trabaja todos los días por el día a veces trabaja de noche pero de preferencia lo hace por el día, esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento y espera poder encontrar otro tipo de trabajo para así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de un auto para su uso personal y para algunos días ponerlo como servicio de taxi. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario de Cusco" ["Virgin of the Rosary of Cusco"] Communal Bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Mr. Hernán.  He is 27 years old, married, and has three children.  He works providing taxi service.  He works every day and sometimes at night, although he prefers to work during the day.  This is his only job right now but he hopes to find another type of work so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.

Mr. Hernán is requesting this loan to buy a car for his own personal use and to also use as a taxi on certain days.

He is happy to receive this loan and promises to make his repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy a car for personal use and to use as a taxi

loans.name: Rayhon

texts.ru: Аликулова Райхон проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 48 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Райхон более 8 лет занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи для продажи. Целью кредита является закуп семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора. Она хочет посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: A. Rayhon lives in the Shahrituz region. She's forty-eight years old, married and has three children. Her husband works in Russia. For over eight years Rayhon has raised plants, specifically vegetables, for sale. She's asking for a loan in order to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for her tractor. All this will enable her to reap a bountiful harvest.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita, age 52, has a very supportive and responsible husband, Francisco, who is now 56 years old. Her husband is a fisherman – that’s why one source of their income is from fishing. Her husband works hard in the day catching fish in the lake, but he only brings home a small amount of money because the owner of the fishing equipment gets a larger amount – they only give him a percent.

So Isabelita decided to apply for a loan from Kiva's field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), to buy the things needed in fishing so that the revenue will be only for them. She will use the loan to buy fishing cages (fish traps), fishing nets, and other things needed in the fishing business. She will help her husband sell the fish he catches in the lake. 

Isabelita decided to put up this business in order to increase their daily income and meet their needs, like everyday expenses and the education of their two children. With more fish to catch and sell, Isabelita believes that sales will increase leading to higher revenue. As a dedicated member of ASHI, she ensures strong performance with regular attendance at group meetings and steady repayments. Isabelita is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will continue to flourish to improve the family’s quality of life and fund her children’s education until they finish college.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, fish traps, and other supplies

loans.name: Freddy Wilson

texts.es:
Freddy de 48 años, es un microempresario que vende arroz por quintal y en ocasiones trabaja como peluquero para tener ingresos adicionales. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su ventas por eso quiere continuar con el negocio de venta de quintales de arroz. Trabaja desde las 07h00am vendiendo por el sector donde vive el arroz a un valor aproximado a $ 32.00. Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo quintales de arroz para darles mas oportunidades a sus tres hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal. En el futuro quiere tener un local grande y surtido para la venta del arroz.
texts.en: Freddy, 48, is a small businessman who sells quintals of rice and sometimes works as a hairdresser for extra income.  He has a lot of aspirations for his sales and therefore wants to continue with the business selling quintals of rice.  He works from 7:00 a.m. selling rice in his neighborhood for approximately $32.00.  He wants to continue with his business, therefore, he wants to buy quintals of rice with the loan in order to give his three children more opportunities to study in a public school.  In the future he wants to have a big store that is well stocked to sell rice.

loans.use: Rice.

loans.name: Manuela's Group

texts.en:
Manuela R. is from the village of Sto. Domingo. She is 45 years old. Manuela is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Manuela R..

Manuela is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Manuela plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Manuela has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Manuela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and  living situation. Manuela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Manuela is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Manuela from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel G. is from the village of Simanoc, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Liezel is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Liezel makes and sells specialty food products like rice cakes and cassava cakes in the local community. Liezel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Liezel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Liezel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital. 

Liezel is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale like flour & eggs. This will be the third loan taken out by Liezel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like flour and eggs needed to make rice and cassava cakes for sale

loans.name: Leah Jepkemboi

texts.en:
Leah Jepkemboi is a 52-year-old, hard working woman.  She is married and blessed with four children aged 25, 20, 18 and 12 years. Her husband, Barnaba K., is a church pastor. Leah owns a timber yard in Kapketuny Trading Center where she buys timber and firewood for resale. She has been in the business for four years and earns a monthly income of KSH 10,000.

Leah is requesting a loan of KSH 80,000 from Kiva partner, Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET).  This loan is her fourth after successful repayment of previous loans.  She intends to use the money to purchase timber and firewood for resale. She hopes to be provided a large tender so that she can supply wood to the Chebut Tea Factory.  The profits will be used to educate her children and also increase her stock.

loans.use: To purchase timber for resale

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. His daughter and two sons all attend the local secondary school. 

He is a carpenter who manages a wooden-product-making business in cooperation with his wife. Munhbat started his business in 2004 in his backyard. As a carpenter, he needs a,big space where he can make household wooden products such as chairs, beds and tables. etc. His wife is in charge of selling goods at a rented stall at a local market. 

Their products are well-known amongst residents of Hovd province. Munhbat is a polite man who is planning to improve his workshop and to increase the quantity of his products. He says, "I want to open a big factory, which will provide a wide collection of wooden products for Hovd residents." He is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Soa V., age 50, resides in Takeo Province in Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian Temples. V. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of 3.60 USD per day. His wife produces cow ties and raises chickens and ducks, earning an income of 2.50 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 75 USD on food and 90 USD on other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a new motorbike to operate his business more efficiently. This will be his third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to operate his business more efficiently.

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.ru:
Ulviyya uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov dlya prodaji molochnix produktov. Ona delayet yogurt, kefir, tvorog i t.d iz moloka i prodayet v magazini.
 Ulviyya A. 34 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Ulviyya nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnix produktov.
texts.en: Ulviyya has been working as a dairy farmer for four years. She makes yogurt, farmer's cheese, and other products and sells them in stores. Ulviyya A. is 34 years old. She is married and has two children who go to school.  Ulviyya needs 2300 AZN to buy cows in order to increase milk production.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Epifanio le esta haciendo falta el vitro piso en el interior.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Don Epifanio pagara el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
Desea que su pequeño hijo tenga la seguridad y que este en mejores condiciones para su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Epifanio's home needs Vitropiso (a brand of ceramic tile) flooring.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy the materials he needs and pay the person who will carry out the work.

Epifanio will repay his loan with part of the wages he earns in his job which is his family's source of income.

Epifanio would like his young son to be safe and for his house to be in better conditions as he grows.

loans.use: to lay Vitropiso flooring in his home

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha de 33 años,  de estado civil soltera, con dos  hijos, tiene ya 5 años dedicándose a la venta de comida como asaditos, refrescos y comida en un puesto ambulante que tiene en la parada de una línea de micros  y algunos días de la semana en el domicilio de su vecina que esta a tres cuadras de su puesto. La Sra. Martha vive con su conyugue que se dedica a la electricidad ambos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia. La Sra.  Martha   se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la necesidad y  urgencia que posee de construir un techo en su domicilio y así no tener que salir a la calle para vender su comida, como también víveres para la elaboración de sus platillos.  Ella  tiene un buen historial de deuda, es cliente antiguo  de la institución con buen comportamiento de pago,  es un apersona muy cordial, amigable, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Martha is 33 years old, single, and she has two children. She has been selling prepared foods for 5 years, including roasts, soft drinks, and other foods from a stall that she has at a bus stop. Some days of the week she works from her neighbors house, which is three blocks from her stand. Martha lives with her common-law husband, an electrician, and they both strive to provide for their family. Martha saw the need to access a loan from our institution given the need and urgency to build a roof on their house. She will not need to go out on to the streets to sell her foods. She 
also plans on purchasing groceries to prepare her recipes. She has a good credit history and she is a long-time client of the institution. She has had a good repayment record. She is a very cordial and friendly person, and she is thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase rice, potatoes, meats, vegetables, and to build a roof on their house to improve her business.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong is a 36-year-old farmer and mother who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She was blessed with four children, most of whom attend public school. Her husband, Sorm, is 39 and works in the farming business. Mrs. Hong inherited the farmland from her grandmother and she and her husband grow different kinds of crops on it. They earn an average of $5 each day to help pay for the family's expenses. Rainy season is a good season for planting crops but Mrs. Hong doesn't have enough savings to do so. Therefore, Mrs. Hong would like a loan from Kiva as an advance for planting sugar cane.

loans.use: to plant sugar cane.

loans.name: Livy

texts.es:
La señora Livy es socia del banco comunal Las tesoritos del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Son cuatro ciclos que lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene un pequeño local, a donde tiene que llevar a su pequeño hijo porque no tiene con quien dejarlo, trabaja todo el día, solo regresa a su casa para descansar.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: ½ saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, 1 bolsa de fideos, menestras, 1 galón de aceite, vinagre, sillao.
Estos productos son muy indispensables en la elaboración de sus comidas, es un trabajo agotador pero de esta forma ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. El es chofer de moto car (transporte).
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser parte de sus sueños, quiere seguir trabajando y mejorar la vida de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Livy is a member of the communal bank "Las Tesoritos" in the district of Yarinacocha in the department of Ucayali.  She is 26, married and has a son.

For four cycles she has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos.  She has a food business in a small stall and takes her son with her to work because she has no one to leave him with.  She works all day and only returns home to sleep.

With the new loan of 1,700 PEN she will buy 1/2 sack of rics, 1/2 sack of sugar, 1 bag of pasta, vegetable soups, 1 gallon of oil, vinegar and soy sauce.
