She runs a general store out of her home where she sells fruit, basic household goods, and other items. She runs the business on her own.

Elizabeth will invest this loan in more merchandise (sugar, rice, pasta, detergent, and shampoo), and in firewood and coal, which will be needed in this region in southern Chile for the cold winter. Because these are needed products, this will be a good business. Her dream is to increase the variety of merchandise in her store.

Elizabeth’s greatest motivation is her 13 year-old daughter; she wants to give her everything she needs for her basic and advanced studies so that she can secure a solid economic future for herself.

What Elizabeth has liked best about working with Fondo Esperanza has been the opportunity the organization has given her to move forward, without putting up obstacles to her ability to access credit. Additionally, the good treatment she has received in the entrepreneur training and educational workshops, has made her feel valued and important.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile’s indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: Assorted merchandise, charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard B. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 25 years old, married and has 2 very young children. Eduard owns and operates a business offering motor transport services. Eduard has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it..

In 2010, Eduard joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduard is requesting his first loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna Q., age 50, is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. Lorna is married and has nine adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a specialized retail store, where she sells ready-to-wear clothing and shoes in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell as well as being implemented as working capital. Lorna is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two children who both attend school. She is married to a businessman who contributes to the family's needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and electricity.

Mwanasha has been operating her business of selling bags of charcoal and coconuts for the last five years. She sells from door to door to her neighboring community. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase five bags of charcoal and coconuts. Mwanasha faces the challenges of transportation and seasonality in her business. 

Mwanasha has another source of income: rental houses. In the future, she hopes to start a cosmetic shop. She decided to work with Yehu because of its good reputation in the community and for accessibility to sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase five bags of charcoal and coconuts.

loans.name: Hercilia Patricia

texts.es: Doña Hercilia tienen 39 años de edad es originaria de San RAymundo su esposo esta en los Estados Uidos, tienen 4 hijos 3 viven con ella y 1 ya no, ella se dedica a la venta de carne de marrano y chicharrones en su casa ya hace 25 años, nos cuenta que le ha ido muy bien por eso quiere incrementar la venta, ahora quiere invertir una parte en la comra de marranos peruqeños y asi ella engordarlos para luego destazarlos, asi espra un poco mas de ganancia ya que los marranos grandes se los venden un poco caros y la otra parte quiere invertirlo en la compra de marranos ya grandes, ella espera lograr sus objetivos y aún mas.
texts.en:
Hercilia is 39 years old and comes from San Raymundo. Her husband is in the United States. They have 4 children, 3 of whom still live with her; one is already grown. Her work is selling pork meat and chicharrones [fried pork skin] from her home. She has done this work for 25 years now, and she says that it has gone very well for her. For that reason, she would like to increase her sales. She would now like to invest part of the loan in buying small pigs to fatten up and later butcher. In this way, she hopes to achieve a little more profit, since large pigs are rather expensive to buy. She would like to invest the other part of the loan funds in buying large pigs. She hopes to achieve her goals and even more.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza D. is from the village of Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Flordeliza owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Flordeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Flordeliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Randah

texts.en:
Randah is a 46-year-old married woman living in Tripoli with her husband and four children. Randah sews curtains, bed covers and blankets. She’s a professionA. seamstress, and her customers like the perfection of her work.

Randah is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy new textiles that fulfill her customers’ needs. Initially, her problem was that she had only one sewing machine. With her previous loan Randah bought another sewing machine, which made her work more productive and easier. She hopes to continue buying more machines until she can open her own factory.

loans.use: To buy new textiles

loans.name: The Winds Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Cristina González M., vive en coapilla Estado de  Chiapas México, es casada con señor Emilio Díaz Pérez, en el cual procrearon tres hijos dos varones y una mujer, Deysi que ya está casada Daniel de diesi seis años de edad en tercer semestre de preparatoria, y el más pequeño es wilder Iván de quince años.

       Ella se dedica a su hogar y a la actividad de  elaborar antojitos como son comida y tamales, desde hace dos años, donde comenta que le va bien ya que con eso ha logrado a horrar y  empezar a construir,  una casa más amplia para poner una tienda de abarrotes para que con eso obtenga ingresos para su hogar.

  Lo que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad de vender comida y tamales fue su familia para aportar y cubrir los gastos de sus hijos que están estudiando, a un así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja del diario para que juntos aporten y saquen adelante a su familia.

   Con las ganancias que   obtiene de su venta, ha estado ahorrando para trabajarlo y con ello comprar los ingredientes para elaborarlos con mejor calidad y los clientes se interesen en consumir sus antojitos.

   Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa para que ya pueda tener su tienda de abarrotes que es lo que más desea tener y con ello sacar adelante a sus hijos para que terminen una carrera donde ellos de pendan para vivir.

  Formo parte del grupo ya que su mama la señora María Luisa la invito a participar y Solicitar un préstamo para trabajarlo en sus actividades. El grupo se llama las brisas le pusieron ese nombre ya que cuando se izo la solicitud estaba bisando.

  Las personas que integran el grupo son tres señoras muy trabajadoras y son las siguientes:
 
  Belén M. P.: invierte el préstamo  en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes como son: harina, aceite, huevo, entre otros.
  María Luisa M. Pérez: invierte el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración de panes como son: aceite, huevo, harina, aceite, leña, entre otros.
  Isabel Cristina Gonzales M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar comidas y tamales.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina G. M. lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas in Mexico. She is married with Emilio Diaz P.. Together they had three children, two are boys and one is a girl. Dyesi is already married. Daniel is sixteen years old and he is in grade 9. And the youngest is Wilder Ivan and he is 15 years old. She runs her house and she has had a catering business for the past two years, making snacks and tamales. The business has been successful and she has managed to put away some savings and start building a larger house. Her goal is to set up a store in the house to obtain another source of income for the household. The reason for her catering business is her family. She wishes to support them and be able to pay the school tuition for her children. She sees support from her husband who works daily, so that together they can support the family. With the earnings obtained from her sales she has been saving money and she reinvests back into the business, purchasing ingredients to make quality foods to keep her clients interested and always coming back. Her dream is to finish building her house so that they will be able to have their grocery store, what she most wishes to have. She will be able to provide for her children and see them have careers and make their own living. She joined the group after her mother Maria Luisa invited her to participate and request a loan for her business. The group is named The Winds, a name that was chosen because it was a windy day when the group formed. The individuals that make up the group are three very hard working women: Belen M. P.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to make breads (flour, cooking oil, eggs, etc.) Maria Luisa M. P.: she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make breads (cooking oil, eggs, flour, firewood etc.) Isabel Cristina Gonzales Moralez: she will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to prepare foods and tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare foods and tamales, such as: chicken, vegetables, seafood, meat, cooking oil, flour etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Esfuerzo 3 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Santos (Estela, como todos la conocen) es una de los miembro D. Grupo Esperanza y Esfuerzo 3 y 4, dedicados a las ventas de ropa, cosmeticos, zapatos, ventas de alimentos, etc. Su familia está compuesta por ella, su esposo y sus 4 hijos,  la cual disfruta al maximo, tambien le encanta asistir a la iglesia y cantar. Su principal reto actualmente es poder construir un apartamento, para alquilar y generar mas ingresos.

Santos está muy emocionada de recibir su septimo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 6 años, el cual inició con su primer prestamo. Santos está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de alimentos (arroz, hachuelas, aceite, azucar, etc), para su pequeño colmado, negocio que se basa en la venta de todo tipo de alimentos y otros productos, es una pequeña tienda en la comunidad. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.

Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque necesitaba invertir en su negocio. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona bordeada de campos de caña en San Pedro de Macoris, una ciudad famosa por sus jugadores de pelota y por la industria azucarera, su economía actual depende de la Zona franca, la industria D. cemento y otras actividades menores como el turismo.

La persona en el circulo, no pertenece al grupo, es el acompañante de uno de los miembros.
texts.en:
Santos (or Estela, as she is known to everyone) is a member of the group Hope and Striving 3 & 4. The members sell clothes, cosmetics, shoes, food, etc. Her family is made up of her, her husband, and their 4 children, who she enjoys hugely. She also loves to go to the church and sing. Her main challenge at the moment is to build an apartment to rent out and generate income for the family.
Santos is very excited to receive her 7th loan from Esperanza Internacional after having successfully repaid her previous loans and having taken the first steps in growing her business. She has had her business for about 6 years, and she started it with her first loan. Santos plans to use the new loan to buy food (rice, beans, oil, sugar, etc) for her small grocery store, a business that depends on selling all sorts of food and other products. It is a little community store. She is going to use the income to continue investing in her business. 
She started this association with us because she needed to invest in her business. Her story is being used to represent the rest of the members of this group who are clients of Esperanzo, who are a mix of Haitians (who for the most part have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) and Dominicans, who for the most part live in very poor communities. This area, in common with many other resource poor areas of the Dominican Republic, lacks potable water and a reliable electricity supply. This group can be found in an area at the edge of the sugar cane fields of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and for the sugar industry. Its present day economy depends on the free trade zone, the cement industry, and other more minor activities like tourism. 
The person circled in the picture is not a member of the group - this is someone who was accompanying one of the group members.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, flour, etc

loans.name: Verene

texts.en: Verene is 30 years old. She is married and has two children between the ages of five and seven. Both of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a businessman. Verena sells furniture. She has had this business for seven years. With this loan she will buy new equipment for the business. With the profit from the business she will renovate her house. She says that her business is successful because people buy furniture from her. In the future she would like to prosper by importing salon equipment and sell them to salon users.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for her business.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: Maria Erlinda tiene 51 años. Es una mujer viuda. Tiene 4 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de abarrotes, hace más de 4 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, sus clientes recurrían a su negocio ya que la atención de Maria es muy buena y además atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa en sus labios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y maíz. Su mayor sueño es seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Erlinda is 51 years old.  She is a widow who has 4 children, only one of whom is in her care.  Her business is selling groceries.  She has been in this business for more than 4 years.  Her business is located in her home.  She started out with very little capital but a great desire to succeed.  She had to pay her household bills and also pay for her children's studies and food.  Little by little she increased her inventory with the small profits which her business made.  Her customers frequented her business because her customer service is very good and she serves her customers with a smile.  The loan which she is requesting is to increase her working capital and buy goods such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, etc.  Her greatest dream is to continue increasing her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hazron

texts.en: Hazron is a 28-year-old married man.  He is blessed with a two-year-old child.  For a living, he sells wood products and runs a boutique.  He has been in the business for nine years.  In addition, he sells fruits and vegetables for extra income.  He gives gratitude to Faulu Kenya for helping him to improve his business.  He has also managed to save his money through Faulu Kenya.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kes to buy African design fabric called Kitenge, children’s clothes and bed covers.

loans.use: To buy African design fabric called Kitenge, children’s clothes and bed covers.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 43 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Shirley plants and harvests rice. She also grows pigs in her backyard.  Shirley fattens the pigs and sells them in the market. 

Shirley joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Shirley is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs and pig feeds.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pig feeds

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en: Ngoun L. is a 61-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province Ngoun L. is married to Nao Roun, age 60. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to three children: one of whom is single and two are married. One of her daughter earns her living by selling some items in her community. Her products are fast foods, soft drink, shampoo, and plastic goods.  Ngoun L. is concerned that her core income in her family comes from her daughter’s business. Therefore, Ngoun L. will use her loan for her daughter to purchase additional products such as fast food, soft drink, and other necessary items for selling and to hire a domestic laborer to cultivate the rest of her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as fast food, soft drink, and other necessary items for selling and to hire a domestic laborer to cultivate the rest of her farmland.

loans.name: Valeria Tatiana

texts.es:
Valeria Tatiana C. T. tiene 23 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Valeria Tatiana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es culminar sus estudios.

Le gusta practicar la cocina.
texts.en:
Valeria Tatiana C. T. is 23 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and their children in the canton of Ventanas, in Ríos province.  She has two children.

The members of the San Jacinto rural communal bank are based in the precinct of Campo Alegre ["Joyful Country"], which is in the parish of Guare and canton of Baba. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice. Collectively, they have been doing this work for a long time.

Valeria Tatiana plants corn and rice. She buys products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa markets and sells her produce in López market.

She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice. With the economic support of this loan, she will be able to better meet her needs. She faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as changes in the climate. Her dream is to finish her studies.

She enjoys practicing her cooking.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar T. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a house and fence. His two children attend a local school. Ganbaatar operates a clothing trade business. He sells a variety of clothing items and has gained a lot of experience in his trade. He has proven himself to be trustworthy to customers who paid off all his previous loan on time in full. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import a large amount of clothes from China in order to sell for upcoming Mongolian New Year holiday.

loans.use: To import a large amount of clothes

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion M. is from the village of Brgy. Quezon, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Concepcion is separated from her spouse and has an infant. To make a living, Concepcion runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Concepcion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Concepcion from ASKI. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nos

texts.en:
Nos M. works in the garment industry as a sewing worker in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is able to earn a profit from this occupation in the amount of about $2.50 each day to use toward the family's daily expenses. Nos M.’s husband works as a casual construction worker who spends at least eight hours per day in the construction field. They are good parents who try their best to earn money to support their child, who is enrolled in school. 

The house in which the family lives is old and in much need of repair, particularly since they have lived in this house for many years without the ability to make necessary repairs. Nos M. wishes to make these repairs, but she does not have enough in savings to make it possible. For this reason, Nos M. would like to request a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to make necessary repairs to the family home

loans.name: Yatoufa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1955 à Nèbabougou Préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur  Yatoufa G. est époux de deux épouses et père de neuf enfants. Il réside avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants dans sa propre maison à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié il y environ six années aux activités vente de bois de construction qu’il achète dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décide de collaborer avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son premier prêt. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Born around 1955 in Nèbabougou, in Sikasso prefecture, Mr. Yatoufa G. is the husband of two wives and the father of nine children. He resides with his two wives and his children in his own house in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to go to school, and after having run several businesses without success, he soon became familiar with selling construction lumber about six years ago. He buys his supplies in towns surrounding Sikasso.

Concerned about further satisfying his clearly growing customer base, Yatoufa decide to collaborate with the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first loan. 

With this loan, Yatoufa envisions making a monthly profit of 300,000 francs CFA. He plans on using the profits derived for resolving most of his expenses, and those of his family, and for covering the loan interest. The rest will be invested in his principal business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of lumber for construction

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Убайдов Саид проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 34 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование-среднее. Вместе с женой занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает арбуз, дыню, овощи. Уже год как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Said U. lives in the Farkhor region.  He's 34, and married with 4 children.  He is a high school graduate.  He and his wife grow crops for a living.  He rents his fields, where he sows wheat, and grows watermelon, melons, and vegetables.  He's been doing this for a year.  He plans to use his loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Mandakh

texts.en:
Mr.Mandakh is 52 years old. He lives with his wife and son in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two eldest daughters study at University in Hong Kong and his youngest son studies in the local secondary school. His wife works as cleaner. 

Mandakh used to work for the Mongolian railroad company as an engine-man for his entire life. In 2009 he had to leave his job on a disability pension. He has to pay for his 2 daughters' University fees each year. Therefore, on top of his disability pension, he earns some extra money by running a taxi business, using his family car. He is asking for a loan to buy some spare parts and to do proper service to his car which he uses as a taxi.

loans.use: To buy some spare parts and to do proper service to his car, which he uses as a taxi.

loans.name: Ansu

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Ansu.  He is single and has one child, age 6. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he is his nephew.  In 2001, Ansu established his men's shoes and sport shoes business. He began his business because he wanted to create a source of income to support his family. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about $210 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Ansu requires a loan in order to buy additional men's shoes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Ansu plans to build a shop and educate his child to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for his business.

loans.name: Housein

texts.en:
Housein is a 50-year-old married man who is the father of 3 children.   For 20 years, he has worked in electronic repairs and as a DJ.  This experience has given him special expertise over his competitors. Housein is a smart and hardworking man.  He is recommended by most of his clients.   Housein loves his business a lot.  He works hard on improving it as much as he can, but family is his first priority. 

Housein is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a new and updated recording and sound system necessary to improve his business. He needs this equipment because during the summer season parties and weddings become more numerous. Housein hopes to keep on improving his business and satisfying his family's needs.

loans.use: buy a recording and sound system

loans.name: Arto

texts.en:
Arto and his wife have engaged in farming. They grow maize, oat and wheat, which they use as fodder for their cows and pigs. When they do not have enough fodder to feed their animals, they buy it from villagers. Also, Arto has some bee families on his farm. Thanks to the profit from farming, Arto is able to support his family. 

Arto needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy five bull-calves for his farm and more fodder for his farm animals. This is Arto’s second loan from Nor Horizon. 
 
Arto is 38 years old and he lives in Koti village, Tavush marz. He is married and has a son and a daughter who are pupils in the village school.

loans.use: To buy five bull-calves for his farm and needed fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Cissy has a dairy farm business, which sells milk and bread, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase milk and bread for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Cissy hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Cissy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: to purchase milk and bread for resale.

loans.name: En Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "En camino al exito" porque que las integrantes trabajan arduamente dia con dia para llevar al exito sus negocios. El grupo está ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo, está conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Guadalupe es la tesorera del grupo. Tiene 30 años de edad, estudió hasta la secundaria y tiene una hija de 11 años. La señora se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo desde hace 7 años, dado que el numero de clientas que atiende va en aumento necesita el préstamo para invertir en mercancia y asi poder atender la demanda de sus clietas. Quiere el prestamo para comprar cosmeticos ya que sus clientas la prefieren por que los pagos son flexibles y de muy buena calidad. Con las ganancias quiere ahorrar para la educacion de su hija ya que algun dia quiere verla con una carrera, tambien apoyar en los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called "En Camino al Éxito" (On the Path to Success) because its members work hard every day to achieve success in their businesses.  The group is located in the State of Hidalgo and has nine members.

Guadalupe is the group's treasurer.  She is 30 years old, studied up to high school level, and has an 11 year-old daughter.  She started her business selling cosmetics seven years ago.  As the number of customers she serves is increasing, she needs a loan to invest in merchandise, so that she can meet her customer demand.  She would like this loan to buy cosmetics.  Her customers are loyal to her business because the payments are flexible and her products are very good quality.  She would like to use the profits from her business to save up for her daughter's education as she would some day like to see her with a career.  She would also like to help cover her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mary has operated a second- hand clothing business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Having joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business, Mary has requested a Kshs 20,000 loan to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. Her major dream is to become a wholesale supplier of clothes in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old and is married to Josphat. The couple is not yet blessed with children. For the past ten years, Regina has been operating a retail shop and she earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

Regina was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client. She is requesting her first loan of 30,000 KES to increase her stock of sugar, rice, and many other items. Regina will use the extra profit from her loan to open another shop. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesale dealer.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es: Bacilio tiene 53 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa  propia en su tierra natal Hace 20 años hace planos  arquitectónicos porque es  arquitecto de profesión y es una de sus grandes pasiones. Siempre  realiza estos trabajos para  construcciones  de municipios  cercanos su localidad, es un profesional muy reconocido  de su zona que conocen de la calidad y vocación de su trabajo, otro negocio paralelo que tiene es la venta de cervezas y también la agricultura   de las cuales sus principales apoyos son sus hijos que le ayudan en el transporte y cuida de cada detalle en el  comercio que realiza, los servicios como arquitecto son rentables por lo que ha decidió implementar  y mejorar sus herramientas.  Es la sexta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, tiene la satisfacción de trabajar de hambrea  grupal con las personas que considera de su confianza porque en todo este tiempo han cumplido puntualmente con sus pagos.En esta ocasión su dinero lo invertirá en la compra de mas mercadería en cerveza.
texts.en:
Bacilo is 53 and lives with his wife and 3 sons in his own home on native soil.  For 20 years he has been doing architectural projects because he is an architect by profession and this is one of his greatest passions. He always works on buildings in towns near his place.  He is a widely recognized in the area where they know about the quality and professionalism of his work. Another parallel business he has is the sale of beer and also agriculture, where his sons are his principal helpers and assist with transportation and overseeing every detail of the businesses he runs. His work as an architect is profitable, therefore he has decided to update and improve his tool kit.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. He has the satisfaction of working with an amiable group of people whose confidence he has earned because in all this time he has always made his payments on time. He will use the money from this loan to purchase more beer merchandise.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more beer merchandise.

loans.name: Raissa

texts.fr:
Cliente de 22 ans, mariée sans enfant a sa charge, 2007  elle perd son père était obligée d’arrêter ses études en classe de quatrième et avec la somme d'argent reçue a la mort de ses parents, elle se lance dans la vente des pacotilles,ses ventes sont de 18.000 a 40.000 frs par jour.
Elle s'approvisionne a Kinshasa et elle a pour stratégie de faire des prix accessibles pour favoriser l’écoulement de sa marchandise.
A l'octroi de son prêt, elle va acheter des bijoux en pacotilles,des barrettes et de parures de tous genre et  tous ce dont les femmes ont besoin pour leur fête,acheter des tôles et des planches pour construire un étalage pour donner une visibilité de son affaire.
Elle est très gentille et entreprenante , elle pense aller loin dans son business.
texts.en:
Raissa is 22 and married with no children. When her father died in 2007, she was forced to stop her studies during her third year of high school. With the money she inherited on the death of her parents, she started a retail business selling low-cost goods. Her daily sales amount to between 18 000 and 40 000 francs. She gets her merchandise in Kinshasa and resells it at affordable prices in order to encourage sales.
She will use this loan to buy cheap jewelery, hair clips and party finery for women. She will also buy sheet metal and shelves with which to build a display on which to showcase her wares. Raissa is a kind and enterprising woman who has the confidence to go far in her business.

loans.use: to buy cheap jewelery, hair clips, etc.

loans.name: Angoritas 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGORITAS 25 DE JULIO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Julia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Venta de pescado, artesanías tejido de mantas, venta de productos cosméticos, venta de comida.

La señora Julia,  indica que es el primer año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados que viene trabajando hace cinco años aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la Huyustus y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias los jueves y domingos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “ANGORITAS 25 DE JULIO” has begun its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes focal center.  The group is made up of six members, and is headed by a board of directors led by Señora Julia. The businesses which the members of the Communal Bank are progressing are varied, among them are selling fish; handicrafts - blanket weaving; selling cosmetic products; selling food.

Señora Julia tells us that this is her first year working with Pro Mujer, and that she joined the institution at the invitation of a promoter.  She currently has a business selling footwear, which she has been doing for five years.  She learned the business from her mom.

The loan that she is now requesting is to grow her capital (by buying wool), which she will buy in Huyustus, and later make up for sale at the markets on Thursdays and Sundays.

This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has a child.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Juanita has a retail shop. She buys & sells vegetables like spring onions, ginger, & garlic. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Juanita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juanita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is single and has a tobacco business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more tobacco to sell in her stall.  Evangeline has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.  In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco to sell in her stall

loans.name: Mehrubon

texts.ru: Мехрубон проживает в районе Дангара. Она замужем. Ей 31 год. У нее двое детей. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Сама Мехрубон занимается торговлей у себя дома. Она в основном занимается торговлей детских костюмчиков, женской и детской летней обуви и тканей. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки детской одежды, женского и мужского нижнего белья, носков и платков.
texts.en: Mehrubon lives in the Dangara district.  She is 31 years old, married and has two children.  Her children attend a secondary school.  Mehrubon is involved in sales at home.  She primarily sells children's jumpsuits, women's and men's summer shoes and fabrics.  She has been in this business for four years.  Mehrubon is requesting this loan to purchase children's clothing, women's and men's undergarments, socks and scarves

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing, women's and men's undergarments, socks and scarves

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Marie.  She is married to a trader who earns Le500,000 every month  and has one child aged 10 years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because they were brought by her husband from the village to assist them in their schooling.  

In 2001, Marie established her household utensil business.  She began her business because she was not privileged to go school and after she was full grown, her elder brother gave her some money to start selling cakes.  After she got married, her husband asked her to change the business to household utensils because of the fire risk involved in baking the cakes.  

Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,095,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  Marie has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to purchase drinking buckets 13 dozens @ Le1,740,000, bathing bucket 3 dozens @ Le330,000, set pans - 10 sets @ Le350,000, bowl pans - 5 dozens @ Le600,000, dish pan - 1 dozen @ Le900,000 and plastic bowls - 3 dozens @ Le450,000.  The balance of Le130,000 will be used for transportation.  

Marie hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 164,250. In the future, Marie plans to build her own house and educate her children to university level.  She feels good because this loan will add to her capital and this loan will help her to improve her business and earn more income.  

Her major challenge is that some of the items may get damaged or spoilt when travelling with them.  She serves about 10 customers each day.  The business is popular because the items are used by the majority of people and they are of good quality.  She is assisted by her younger sister who doesn't go to school.  Her suppliers are in Freetown and Guinea Conakry.    She usually uses public transport and she buys twice a month.  She saves some of her profit and ploughs the balance back into the business.   She is planning to expand and this can be achieved by adequate utilization of her capital and profit.  She is hardworking and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase drinking buckets 13 dozens @ Le1,740,000, bathing bucket 3 dozens @ Le330,000, set pans - 10 sets @ Le350,000, bowl pans - 5 dozens @ Le600,000, dish pan - 1 dozen @ Le900,000 and plastic bowls - 3 dozens @ Le450,000 with Le130,000 for transportation.

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Amado has rice fields that produce rice that he sells in grains per kilogram or sack during harvest time. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Amado has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Amado hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 29 years old and lives in Tongo, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Ailyn operates a snack-selling business. She earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Ailyn requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack business.

Ailyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 7 months. In the future, Ailyn would like to save money to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Bidii Shg Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG group. Patrick and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Patrick takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on ½  acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Patrick will educate his children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ayuen

texts.en:
Ayuen is a 45-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a food stall business in Dokoru bor, South Sudan for two years.

Ayuen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions for sale. In the future, she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house .

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el décimo cuarto ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2007. Todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras y lo han demostrado en todos los ciclos.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Elvira, ella tiene 3 hijos  esta acompañada con el Sr. Aldo, quien trabaja como empleado en una yerbatera y ella se dedica hace varios años al bordado. Cuenta la Sra. que por medio de este trabajo ella puede ayudar en la casa y de esa forma compartir los gastos con su marido para poder mantener a la familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y agujas para los bordados que hace, ya que esos son los insumos indispensables para su negocio.
texts.en:
This group in the city of Encarnación formed because of contact by one of its members with the Fundación,. The group is in its fourteenth loan cycle and has been working with the Fundación since 2007. All are very hardworking and enterprising women and they have demonstrated this in every cycle.

One of the members of the group is Sra. Elvira. She has three children and lives with Sr. Aldo, who is employed by an herbalist. She has done embroidery work for several years. She notes that with her work she can help support the family by sharing household expenses with her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase thread and needles for the embroidery she does, since these are indispensable supplies for her business.

loans.use: to buy thread and needles for embroidery.

loans.name: Kuña Arandu Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Arandu, se conformó en el 2.009, gracias a una de las ex miembros. Actualmente se encuentran en el octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras capaces de sobrellevar cualquier desafío.
Gregoria es una de las integrantes de este grupo trabajador. Ella comenta que se dedica a la elaboración de ñanduti, el cual es un tejido tradicional de Paraguay. Comenta que le va muy bien ya que siempre es muy solicitado el tejido. Comenta que su sueño es que su producto sea exportado y de esa forma ser muy conocida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos de todo tipo, agujas y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración del tejido que vende. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Arandu” women’s committee formed in 2009 thanks to an ex-member.  They are currently in their 8th cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women’s Program.  They are very hardworking, tenacious women who are capable of overcoming any challenge.

Gregoria is one of this hardworking group’s members.  She comments that she makes “ñanduti,” a traditional Paraguayan textile.  She comments that she does quite well because her textiles are always highly sought after.  She comments that her dream is that her product is exported and becomes very well known.

She requested the loan to buy all types of thread, needles and other supplies needed to make this textile that she sells.  She is thankful for the opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to buy thread and needles.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa, de 38 años de edad, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y tiene tres hijos que viven con ellos.

Rosa, tiene una pequeña tienda, en donde vende productos de primera necesidad y bebidas gaseosas y además los fines de semana hace pupusas y antojitos para vender y sus hijas le ayudan.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas y ampliar su negocio para tener una fuente de ingresos fijos para sus hijas.

Rosa, sueña con que sus hijos estudien y se preparen académicamente y tengan una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: para comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has a store where she sells a variety of products. She started off by selling home made popsicles and tortillas. She continuously reinvested her profits into the business and now she sells perfumes and other cosmetic products as well. She needs the loan because she wants to invest in a new line of products for her business. She sees great business potential for the future but insists that the lack of capital is holding her business back from growing. She uses most of the profits for her business for her home and the education of her 13 year old daughter.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invests in products by purchasing from wholesalers

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Aunt Georgina is a petty trader who is also a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has gone through the TEACH Lending program and is very much conversant with simle record keeping methods. She needs a loan amount of $750 to expand her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Maria would like to buy cereals and household goods for her shop.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Mrs. Mirta L. Alcaraz is 28 years old, is married and has a 2-year-old son. A few years ago, motivated by the desire of self-improvement Mirta gathered her few savings and established her own microcompany. She opened a small kiosk on the municipal market of the city. Thanks to the big commercial movement of the area, she was able to extend her business with the profit that she was obtaining. Today, she is a proprietor of a big grocery store where she commercializes all kinds of products of basic necessities, such as oil, noodles, canned products, candies, soap, etc. Mirta works everyday from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. She tells us that her goal is to go so far as to buy her own house, since where she lives now it is a rented house. To increase her profits she wants to sell wholesale products since in the area where she is, there are many wholesale clients. For this reason she needs a loan of $600 that she will use to buy wholesale basic products such as oil, flour and sugar. With this Mirta will obtain bigger profits that will allow her to save more and buy one day the house that she desires so much.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mirta L. Alcaraz tiene 28 años, está casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años. Hace unos años, Mirta impulsada por el deseo de superación, juntó unos ahorros y montó su propia microempresa, abrió un pequeño kiosco en el mercado municipal de la ciudad. Gracias al gran movimiento comercial de la zona, ella pudo ir ampliando su negocio con las ganancias que obtenía, hoy día, ella es dueña de una gran despensa donde comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, como aceite, fideos, productos enlatados, golosinas, jabón, etc. Mirta trabaja todos los días de 6 a.m. a 7 p.m., y nos cuenta que su meta es llegar a comprar su casa propia, pues donde vive ahora es una casa alquilada. Para aumentar sus ganancias ella desea vender al por mayor sus productos pues en la zona hay muchos clientes mayoristas; para ello necesita un préstamo de US$ 600 con lo que emperezará a adquirir los productos básicos al por mayor como aceite, harina y azúcar. Con esto ella obtendrá mayores ganancias que le permitirán a su vez ahorrar más para poder comprarse la casa que tanto desea.

loans.use: Buy whosale oil, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi A.-C. is a hard-working woman who scarcely rests from working with her husband at developing their plantation business. She is thirty years old and has four children and they are all attending school.

Striking hard for a better future for her children, Naomi sells anything from her plantation in order to make money. Products like bananas, coconuts, taro, and yams are what she sells at the market in town where most people come to buy. She uses her loans to buy equipment to help her make her work easier and faster. She earns more than a hundred tala (about US$ 40) a day from her selling. Naomi much appreciates the help of S.P.B.D for women who need a boost toward developing their micro-businesses.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her little farm

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif I. (his employee is pictured) owns and operates a market in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Arif is 45 years old and is a single man. He was born and raised in Khachmaz and has been running his store for 10 years. Arif is looking for funding in the amount of $1,750 in order to increase and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is single with two kids – a 16-year-old and a 14-year-old. She is from Khoost, which is in the western part of the Ukraine. Ganna has been in business selling women’s blouses and shirts for 8 years. She has gained a good reputation in the central town market. Currently, Ganna’s monthly income is about $800.

Ganna’s venture is the only source of income for the family. She tries hard to keep high standards and offers only exceptional quality inventory in her kiosk because competition is very high. Ganna enjoys communicating with her clients and is always willing to meet their needs. She has already received and repaid 12 loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. She is now requesting a loan of $900 to increase her inventory stock and continue to grow as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase clothing stock

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en: Teopista works as a cook in a restaurant. She intends to use the profits from her business to buy a Friesian dairy cow. She will also buy a phone, so she can receive orders for the restaurant.

loans.use: To buy a public pay phone

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two children. She is from Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Mariya owns a store in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk and sells children’s clothing and toys. Her business is well known for affordable prices and a good selection of merchandise. Mariya has been in this trade for 3 years. Presently, she has about $8000 in inventory. Her monthly income is around $1400 – 1600.  

Mariya is always on the run. She combines her entrepreneurial activity with a bookkeeping job for a small private firm. Mariya loves owning her business and is thinking about quitting her other job to commit herself fully to her entrepreneurial endeavors. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase assorted stuffed toys for further retail sale. Mariya is hoping to invest generated profits into the reconstruction of her private house.

loans.use: Increase assorted goods

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
<

The Friendship Communal Bank is a bank that recently formed and at present has 23 associates. Some of them were guests of associates of another Communal Bank and of the property development company. The associates have different business such as selling food, clothes, pottery, shoes, tamales, fruit, vegetables, beverages, cheeses, and groceries. Their businesses also incluD. a pharmacy, workshops and carpentry shops.

Each associate has a different story to tell, such as the case of Juana Rose who makes northern-style tamales and then sells them in the prison of the city of Ayacucho, an activity that she performs 2 times a week. With the loan that Juana Rose will obtain she plans to sell chicken soup in the door of her house.

On the other hand, Mariana sells clothes in the Marshal Cáceres country fair and with the loan that she will obtain she plans to add more products.

The associates need different amounts of loans, some amounts are of 300 soles, 600 soles, coming to a total of 11,700 soles of loans in the Communal Bank.

The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, pots, dishes, teapots, ladies shoes, alcohol, cotton, cheese, oil, noodles, fabrics, mangos, grapes, carrots, tomatos, gourds, polos and sweaters.

The savings will be used to increase the capital of their businesses, to buy more supplies for their workshop and for the education of their children.

The dreams of the associates are to grow their business, to have a factory for the production of clothes, to own a house, to buy land, to have a shoe store and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Amistad es un Banco que recién inicia, actualmente tiene 23 socias, algunas D. ellas fueron invitadas por socias D. otro Banco Comunal y por la promotora.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, ropa, locería, zapatos, tamales, fruta, verduras, bebidas, quesos, tienda D. abarrotes, botica, taller D. confección y carpintería.

Cada socia tiene una historia diferente que contar como es el caso D. Juana Rosa que elabora tamales norteños y luego lo venD. en el penal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, actividad que realiza 2 veces por semana. Juana Rosa con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado vender caldo D. Gallina en la puerta D. su casa.

Por otro lado Mariana venD. ropa en el campo ferial Mariscal Cáceres y con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado incrementar mas productos.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 11,700 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, ollas, platos, tetera, zapatos para damas, alcohol, algodón, queso, aceite, fideo, telas, mango, uva, zanahoria, tomate, zapallo, polos y chompas.

Los ahorros los utilizarán para incrementar mas el capital D. sus negocios, comprar más maquinas para su taller y para la educación D. sus hijos.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus negocios crezcan, tener una fabrica D. producción D. ropa, casa propia, comprar terreno, tener una zapatería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, pots, dishes, teapots, ladies shoes, alcohol, cotton, cheese, oil, noodles, fabrics, mangos, grapes, carrots, tomatos, gourds, polos and sweaters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various merchandise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy works everyday with the sole purpose to forge a future for herself and her young 7 year old son. For 6 years, she has sold a line of junior women's clothing. For the perseverance she has demonstrated these years, she has established herself in a store where she presents her products in very presentable manner, as to secure sales. Nancy's dream is to become a clothing manufacturer. To reach her goal, she will prepare herself and knows that behind a dream lies great amount of effort and perseverance. For this, she seeks a loan to increase the amount of merchandise she offers for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Nancy trabaja día a día con el único propósito de forjarse un futuro para ella y en especial para su pequeño hijo de 7 años. Hace 6 años oferta prendas de vestir para dama de la línea juvenil por la constancia que ha demostrado durante todo este tiempo se ha establecido en un local comercial donde ofrece sus prendas con mejor presentación que aseguran sus ventas, el sueño de Nancy es convertirse en fabricante de prendas de vestir, para alcanzar este propósito se capacitará y sabe que tras un sueño está una gran cuota de esfuerzo y constancia por lo que hoy acude a solicitar un préstamo a fin de incrementar la mercadería que oferta.

loans.use: to increase capital to offer greater amounts of clothing

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal B. is a 36-year-old farmer who has sold milk and yogurt to local people since 1992. He is married and has three sons. He lives in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. As he and his wife are unemployed, selling milk is the only one financial source in their family. Jamal would like to expand his business and purchase one milk cow for an estimated cost of $800 USD.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow.

loans.name: Lenith

texts.es:
Lenith belongs to the communal bank “Las Divinas”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 36 years old and has two children. Her husband is a teacher, but his income is not enough to support the family financially. It’s for this reason that Lenith, with the first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small business.

Currently, she runs a business of photocopies, for which she rises at 6 am. She takes care of her household and business until 6 pm. The majority of her customers are children.

With this loan of S/. 1,000, to be repaid in six months, she bought bond paper at wholesale, supplies for her photocopy machine, materials to improve her location, etc.

Lenith only thinks about continuing to get ahead and growing her business so she can meet the goals she has set for her life and, in this way, support her children in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lenith pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Colegio Sor Anneta de Jesús, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es profesor, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no son suficientes para el sustento familiar, es así que Lenith con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un pequeño negocio. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de fotocopiadoras, para lo cual se levanta a las 6am. Para atender las labores de la casa para luego dedicarse a su negocio hasta las 6pm. La mayoría de sus clientes son niños. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compró papel bond al por mayor, insumos para su maquina fotocopiadora, materiales para la implementación de su local, etc. Lenith solo piensa en seguir progresando y engrandeciendo su negocio para que así pueda cumplir los objetivos que se trazo en la vida, pues así podrá apoyar a sus hijos en el futuro.

loans.use: Purchase paper at wholesale, supplies and other materials.

loans.name: Luz Angélica

texts.es:
Luz Angelica is 33 years old and is mother to 2 children that love her very much and are in school. She lives together with her husband, Henry, a traD. instructor for construction. He supports the family without bounds.

She is a very active woman with dreams of bettering herself. She has for a long time sold beauty products such as: perfumes, shampoo, talcum powders, lipsticks, manicure sets etc. Thanks to her great charisma and pleasant disposition she has earned herself a good client base. She takes her products to the farthest regions of Yarinacocha, her village, and she sells them on credit and she also takes cash. She works all day long and she loves her job, especially because she gets to know so many people.

She wants to purchase a display case for her products, the reason for requesting this loan. Further down the road she would also like to sell fashion jewelery.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz Angélica D. 33 años D. edad es madre D. 02 hijos que la quieren mucho y están estudiando, vive junto a su esposo Henry, quien es maestro D. construcción y le apoya desmedidamente. Es una mujer muy activa, con deseos D. superación, se dedica desD. hace mucho tiempo a la venta D. productos D. belleza como: perfumes, shampoo, talcos, lápiz labiales, correctores para uñas, etc. Gracias a su carisma y jovialidad se ganó una gran gama D. clientes, estos productos los lleva a vender por las zonas más alejadas D. Yarinacocha, su pueblo y los venD. a crédito o al contado. Trabaja todo el día y se siente bien con su trabajo ya que conoce a mucha gente. Ella quiere comprar un mostrador para exhibir sus productos, por lo que solicita este préstamo, más adelante también le gustaría dedicarse al arte D. la bijoutería.

loans.use: To purchase a display case for her beauty products.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y su último hijo de 15 años.  Es agricultora y su actividad la obliga a trabajar en lugares alejados de su hogar, porque sus terrenos están en zonas muy difíciles de llegar, pero el dedicarse a esto por más de 20 años le ha dado la experiencia necesaria y la agilidad suficiente para desenvolverse en esta actividad.De la misma forma, a pesar de tener copado gran parte del día en esta labor trata de disfrutarlo, ya que desde siempre le agradó cultivar flores, hacerlo no le parece difícil, lo que sí la preocupa es el costo de los productos que ayudan que su producción se mantenga adecuadamente.
Olinda tiene un gran amor por su esposo y su hijo de 15 años, quien es su principal motor en su vida. Ella está dispuesta a seguir creciendo, para ello requiere de dinero para adquirir semillas y  abonos para sus terrenos, con el fin de poder incrementar sus ingresos, su producción y sus pedidos en los mercados de flores.
texts.en:
Olinda is 38 years old and lives with her husband and her youngest son of 15 years of age. She is a farmer and her work obligates her to work in places away from her home because her fields are located in areas that are very difficult to reach. Having dedicated more than 20 years to this activity has given her the necessary experience and adaptability to develop in this trade. In the same way, in spite of having the major part of her day taken up by this work, she tries to enjoy it, especially since she has always liked to grow flowers. The work does not appear hard for her, what does worry her, however, is the cost of the products that help her keep an adequate production level.

Olinda has a great love for her husband and her 15 year old son, which is the main driver in her life. She is ready to continue growing, for which she needs money to buy seeds and fertilizers for her fields, with the purpose of increasing her income, her production and her orders in the flower markets.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of gladiola seeds and fertilizers for her fields.

loans.name: Muqabil

texts.en:
Muqabil K. is 36 years old, married with three sons. Muqabil's wife is a homemaker. He is working hard because he is the only breadwinner in the family. For eight years, he has been selling men clothes. He buys the goods in the capital of the country every week and then supplies his customers with the goods in the local market. He tries to choose various goods of fine quality and attractive prices, which allows him to keep his clientèle. The business provides a stable income and allows Muqabil to improve his family's living conditions.

Today, he applied for $1200 to purchase winter season clothes. He would like to thank everybody for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time. The progress of Muqabils's business is in your hands; your support will really help him.

loans.use: To purchase winter season clothing.

loans.name: Mtumwa

texts.en:
Mtumwa has owned a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for seven months.  She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $70 each month.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more inventory and expand her business.  

Mtumwa is 42 years old, married, and has 5 children: ages 12, 13, 17, 18, and 20.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to expand her business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi D. is 39 years old. She lives in Quang Trach Commune, Quang Xuong District, Thanh Hoa Province, with her husband and her children. She joined the TYM Fund in 2008.  Now her primary income is raising pigs and her husband is trading mats. Nguyen Thi would like a loan of 5 millionVND ($300USD) and will use part of the loan to buy more pigs and part of it to invest in more mats.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and invest in mat trading.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Холматова Фотима женщина в возросте 47 лет имеет высшее медицинское образование, работает врачом лаборантом в областной больнице.Фотима имеет 4 детей , муж водитель городского маршрутного такси.
Фотима обратилась в Микроинвест чтоб получить кредит для покупки легкового автотранспорта, для старшего сына.Её сын хочет в свободное время работать таксистом, т.к. в зимнее время очень большой спрос у населения на автотранспорт.Она считает что в кредит очень удобно делать покупку на большую сумму.
texts.en:
Fotima H. is a 47 year old woman who has completed medical school and now works as a laboratory doctor in the regional hospital. Fotima has 4 children and a husband who works as a minibus taxi driver. Fotima came to Microinvest to obtain a loan to purchase a car for her oldest son. Her son wants to work as a taxi driver in his free time, since during winter there is very high demand for transportation among residents. She thinks that spending a large sum on a purchase is made much easier by access to loans.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: consumer credit

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder
Graciela tiene 34 años es conviviente, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 3 años, ellos  estudian en colegio particular San Juan Bautista. 

Desde que termino el colegio  Graciela empezó a vender Productos de belleza por catálogos de diferentes empresas por muchos años, después empezó con la venta de salchi-papas por mas de un año, le iba bien  pero tuvo que dejarlo por que salió embarazada y era mucho trajín para ella, paso el tiempo su hija creció y empezó a trabajar de nuevo, esta vez en la venta de ropa por pedidos, paso la voz a sus amigas y familiares, así se fue haciendo de pedidos, sus amigas la recomendaban a otras personas, fue ganando mas clientas; ella compra la ropa en Gamarra La Victoria; En tiempo de colegio vende útiles escolares y zapatos ella deja el  pedido y cada quincena pasa cobrando.

Desde que comenzó en Finca tiene mucha ayuda, le dan charlas de cómo mejorar su negocio, saber a quien vender sus productos, y como formar su empresa, ha recibido un premio de $ 20 por buena pagadora y por ser puntual a las reuniones del Bancomunal, también ha logrado comprar  un Custer que su esposo lo maneja; lo compraron a plazos  les falta cinco letras para terminar de pagarlo. 
Necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para la  comprar mercadería de ropa que le han pedido sus clientas y poder repartir  a tiempo.

Uno de los sueños de  Graciela es tener su propio negocio en su casa, quiere poner una librería – Bazar, pero le falta techar su casa, ella sabe que poco  apoco lo va a lograr.
texts.en:
Graciela, 34, is a member of the Fuerza y Poder ("Strength & Power") community bank. She is 34 years old, partnered and the mother of two children, 15 and 3 years old, respectively. The children are students at the private San Juan Bautista school.

After finishing high school, Graciela sold beauty products for many years. She then sold salchipapas (a traditional Peruvian dish) for more than a year, a business that was going very well but that she had to leave when she became pregnant and her days became too hectic. When her daughter became older, she went back to work, this time selling clothes to friends and family. Her friends recommended her to others and her business has consequently grown. She buys clothes in the Gamarra La Victoria. During the school year, she sells school uniforms and shoes.

Since starting with Finca, she's had a lot of help. They give her advice about improving her business, information about who sells her products and how to form a business. She received a premium of $20 for a good payment record and for being on time to the meetings of the community bank. She also managed to buy a Custer (moto-taxi) that her husband operates. They only have five more payments to make to pay it off.

Graciela needs an 800-soles loan to buy clothes already ordered by her customers but not yet paid for. One of her dreams is to have her own home-based business. She wants to set up a bookstore but she needs a roof on her house. She knows that little by little, she'll succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for clothing business.

loans.name: Akhila

texts.en: Akhila A. is 41 years old. She is still working diligently to help her husband, who works as a farmer. Ever since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. She uses the profit to cover the family expenses and her children’s educational fees. Akhila has 4 children. Her first child has already graduated form the university. The other ones are studying in school. The loan of $1200 that Akhila  applied for will be used to purchase 2 calves for expanding her business. She hopes that the business goes well and her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 31-year-old married man with one young child, living in Ain Al Helweh in southern Lebanon. He started his telephone and mobile shop back in 2006. Today, Mohammad wants to renew his shop's decoration; therefore he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200.

loans.use: Renew the shop's decoration

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Mme Antoinette N. est née à Sotouboua au centre du Togo en 1955. Elle est veuve avec cinq (05) enfants à charge. Son activité principale est la préparation et la vente de boisson locale appelée "Tchoukoutou". Cette boisson très appréciée par les consommateurs est fabriquée à base de maïs et du mil. Actuellement sa clientèle augmente et pour mieux répondre à leurs exigences, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker du maïs et du mil. Les bénéfices tirés de ce commerce seront utilisés pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
