Ms. Antoinette N. was born in 1955 in Sotouboua in central Togo. She is a widow and has five children to support. Her main work involves making and selling a drink locally called "Tchoukoutou". This drink is highly appreciated by consumers and is made from corn and millet. Right now, her customer base is growing, and to respond better to their demands, she's requesting financing to stock up on corn and millet. The profits derived from this business will be used to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell a non-alcoholic beverage

loans.name: Andrews

texts.en:
Andrews A. is sixty-three years old. He is married and has five children. Two of the children are currently in school. The rest are out of school and living independently. He lives with some of his children and his wife in a family house in Aquase, a fishing community near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Andrew is a trader. He sells all kinds of footwear for men. He sells full shoes, half shoes, slippers, etc. He buys the goods from wholesalers in the regional capital. Andrews sells his products on a table top in the market square. He says he also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Andrews has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to buy footwear in bulk so that he can increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To buy footwear to resell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorna P. has been a member in good standing of Golden Star Center since April 2004. She is on her ninth loan cycle for additional capital of her rice-production business, which she operates with her husband. She is a very active member. In fact, she has never committed any default of her weekly obligation. She requested the loan amount of Php 5,000.00 for fertilizer, medicines and labor for farm cultivation. She believes she can have a good harvest, especially now that the rainy days are suited for farming.

Now she is very happy living together with her family and very thankful to our own cooperative that allowed them to borrow a little amount of money which is a very big help to them for their daily living. She aspires that they will be able to send their children to school and have a better life in a near future.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna A. is a trader in all kinds of ladies' footwear (slippers, etc.) She hawks her wares in her community and also treks to other towns to sell. She is 27 years old, married and has three children--all daughters. She says all are currently in primary school. Her husband trades in maize. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase. It is a farming and trading community near Dorma, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Anna has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure a variety of footwear in bulk. Anna is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: 036-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hà N. Thị is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hà is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 036-Quảng Hưng (18-01-036).

Hà is married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Hà makes and sells rice products in the local community. Hà has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 1.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.442.600 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional products. This will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. N. Thị Vân is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her general store.

2. N. Thị Lan is a 23-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hà N. Thị (73) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 036-Quảng Hưng (18-01-036).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 1.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Hà đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.442.600 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  N. Thị Vân (71) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

2.  N. Thị Lan (69) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Modinot

texts.en: Modinot sells tailoring materials and weaves cloth for tailors. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase a weaving machine and tailoring materials. Modinot is 34 years old and married with two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials

loans.name: Ana Fe

texts.en:
Ana Fe R. is from the village of Mailag, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Ana Fe is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ana Fe owns & operates a business buying and selling fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish in the local community. Ana Fe has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (about $313 US) a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Ana Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana Fe is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ana Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia M. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 64 years old. Anastacia is married and has three adult children. Anastacia owns and operates a serviced-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor-cab transport services. Anastacia has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos (about $21) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anastacia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anastacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Anastacia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala is a member of the Pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 24 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 5 years.

Sala started her own clothing business selling clothes 5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sala`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Sala hopes to save more money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is a very diligent woman. She has managed a village store for more than five years and she is also engaged in a hog-raising business. She lives in the rural village of Parog-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Monolito, a company driver in Saudi.

Through her small businesses, Carolyn has been able to help her husband in providing for the immediate needs of their family. With her desire to make her business grow, she is now asking for financial assistance of PHP 20,000 from the lenders. This will enable her to purchase more stock for her store and will also be used for the maintenance of her hog-raising business. She believes that she has the ability to improve her store and make it more productive.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store and maintain her hog-raising business

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil separada tiene 5 hijos, vive en Cuturapi  y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde los cuales los vende en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos.

loans.name: Ayde Marisol

texts.es:
La socia  Marisol; pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestra socia  tiene 30 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, la socia  alterna sus  actividades del hogar con  la docencia, ella es profesora y su pareja es obrero, nuestra socia enseña en una escuela, ella ama su trabajo y lo realiza muy bien es una profesora muy querida por todos lo alumnos, padres de familia y colegas; nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar algunas cosas para su hogar, una vez que le paguen ella cumplirá con sus pagos del préstamo.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marisol belongs to the communal bank "Kantu San Jeronimo." She is a native of the city of Cusco. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner and has one child. She alternates her activities of the home with teaching; she is a teacher and her partner is a worker. She teaches in a school, loves her work and does it very well. She is a teacher who is much loved by the students, parents and colleagues. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy some things for her house. Once she receives the loan, she will comply with the payments. She appreciates and values the loan that is provided through these means, and is committed to paying the installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy some things for the home

loans.name: Edith Bettcide

texts.es:
Edith es una mujer activa y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 39 años, es madre de tres hijos y uno de ellos es menor de edad, Edith tiene productos de pasamanería y algunas prendas de vestir, que los vende en su casa; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a construcción civil. Edith forma parte del Banco Comunal  “María  Montessori” desde hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles  que le permitió invertir en juguetes y venderlos en campaña navideña.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles, comprará prendas de vestir para su tienda. El sueño de Edith es tener un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Edith is an active and enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 39 years old and a mother of three children, one of whom is not yet an adult. Edith sells upholstery products and some items of clothing from her home. She is supported by her husband who works in civil construction. Edith has formed part of the community bank “María Montessori” for six years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which allowed her to buy toys and sell them at the Christmas fair. With this loan of 1500 soles she will buy items of clothing for her store. Edith's dream is to have her own market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items of clothing for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and insecticides for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en: For six years, Senora Luz Marina has sold clothing, cosmetics, jewelry and perfumes. She says that she has many dreams, but most of all, she wants to have a store all her own. Luz Marina began her business when her partner left her and she had to find a way to support herself. The services of Fundación León 2000 have helped Luz Marina support her daughter’s education. Luz Marina also says that without these loans she would not be able to maintain her business. The only problem that she reports is that she has clients who are unable to pay what they owe her.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira M. is a hardworking woman. She is devoted to raising animals, especially cattle, which she buys and, after fattening, sells in the local market. In this manner, she obtains the income that she needs. Over many years, this has allowed her to earn enough income to help her husband with the family expenses. In order to increase her income and revitalize her business, Elmira is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to purchase calves. This will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of her four children.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is thirty-five years old. He is a married man and the father of four children who are all in school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Raphael is a hard-working young man. He is a carpenter by profession and he is training two apprentices.

Raphael works in a shop by the roadside in his community. He has been in business for eight years and wants to buy wood and other working materials in bulk to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Estela Toliao's Group

texts.en:
Estela T. is from the village of Lobogon. She is 33 years old. Estela is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Estela is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Estela owns and operates a fish vending business, selling fish in the local community. Estela has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Estela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estela has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Estela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Estela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham owns a transportation van he uses to deliver passengers from one town to another. He has been involved in this occupation for the past six years but, in 2007, he bought a van and started his own business to earn income. He is the one that supports his wife and two unemployed children with his work.

Today, Hicham is requesting $1,000 to perform maintenance on his vehicle in addition to renovating the van and painting it to offer a good quality of service to his passengers.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his van and to renovate and paint it

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en: Teresiah is a 28-year-old married lady with two children. One child attends school.  She has been practicing poultry farming for three years but she was previously selling cereals. She has been a member of Faulu Kenya and has previously taken a loan of KES 20,000. She appreciates Faulu for helping her increase a stock to over 100 layers. Her dream is to rear over 1000 layers in the future. As a result, she has requested for KES 30,000 to add more hens and to buy chickmash for feeding the chickens. She hopes to own a home within Dagoretti in Nairobi city.

loans.use: To add more chicken & feeds.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una señora que tiene 30 años de edad, vive en alquiler en la casa de sus padres y  tiene dos hijos, mismos que son de total dependencia de ella. Isabel se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos, ropa y calzados  y sus principales clientes están principalmente en las  ferias de la ciudad.
La competencia es alta en el rubro al cual se dedica, pero cuenta con clientela  que demanda sus productos, principalmente por los precios a los cuales oferta sus productos.
Con el crédito incrementara su capital de operaciones, principalmente para la compra de ropa, ya que tiene buena demanda en la actualidad.
Este es el cuarto crédito  al que accede Isabel y es recomendada por los padres, quienes garantizan personalmente todos los créditos que obtuvo en Agrocapital,  habiéndose observado buen cumplimiento de pago.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 30-year old woman who rents a room in her parents’ house. She has two children who are totally dependent on her. Her job is selling cosmetics, clothing, and shoes, and most of her customers come to the city’s markets where she has a stall. Competition is high in this line of work, but Isabel has regular customers who seek her products, mostly because of the good prices she offers. With this loan she will increase her working capital allowing her to buy more clothing for which there is a high demand at the moment. This is Isabel’s fourth loan. She was recommended by her parents who personally guarantee all the loans that she has had from Kiva partner, Agrocapital. They have seen that she has always made her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mary Glo's Group

texts.en:
Mary Glo M. is from the village of Antagan 1st. She is 32 years old. Mary Glo is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mary Glo M..

Mary Glo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Glo owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and for sale. Mary Glo has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Glo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Glo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Glo from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M., 36, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Mauro M., an overseas Filipino worker who works as a welder, she is blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Erlinda M. has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 10,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy groceries needed to replenish stock in her variety store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries needed to replenish stock in her variety store

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita W. is from the village of Dampil, Lag. Misamis Oriental. She is 62 years old. Rosita is married and has five grown children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, to the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 32 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosita has decided to lower her loan request to 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mano Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Mano” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Dura S. (pictured left). Dura is age 50 and he was born in Makeni. He is married with 3 children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending both primary and secondary schools.  For many years now, Dura has been selling market food – beans and ground-nuts/peanuts. With this loan, he will expand his business by buying bags of beans and groundnuts to add to his current stock.

loans.use: Buy bags of beans and groundnuts to add to his current stock

loans.name: Patzolojche Group

texts.es: Doña Francisca Pelicó C.  con  5 hijos, es una persona  trabajadora, y a pesar de su extrema pobreza esta señora ha salido adelante en  forma un grupo de señoras, del Paraje Patzolojche de la aldea San Antonio Pasajoc, del municipio de Momostenango del departamento de Totonicapán, que es la representante de este grupo denominado “PATZOLOJCHE”. Ella y sus tres integrantes se dedican se dedican a la  crianza de animales tales  como ganado porcino, vacuno y también aves domesticas como pollos ponedoras y de engorde, y pavos para engorde. Doña Francisca es también una persona entusiasta a pesar de su poca escoralidad, es  alguien que le ha sacado provecho a la crianza de animales,  su punto de venta  de estos animales, es en el paraje Pologuá, de la aldea  San Antonio Pasajoc, Momostenango. Ella necesita ampliar su capital de trabajo, en la crianza de animales, es el segundo crédito  que solicita en las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de pologuá, para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de la familia de cada una de la integrantes de este grupo.
texts.en:
Francisca Pelicó C. has five children, and she is a hard-working person. In spite of her extreme poverty, this woman has gotten ahead. She is part of a group of women, Paraje Patzolojche, in the San Antonio neighborhood. This is in the Momostenango municipality in the Totonicapán department. She is the representative of this group called “Patzolojche”. She and the other three members raise animals like pigs and cows. They also raise poultry like laying hens and chickens and turkeys to fatten. Francisca is also an enthusiastic person in spite of her small amount of schooling. She is someone who has profited from raising animals. She sells these animals in the Paraje Pologuá in the San Antonio Pasajoc neighborhood in Momostenango. She needs to increase her working capital in her business of raising animals. This is the second loan that she has asked for from the ASDIR Asociación of Pologuá. She wants the loan for her economic activity in order to be able to improve her living conditions and those of the families of each of the members of this group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en: Merlie P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 54 years old, is widowed, and has two school-aged children. Merlie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She hopes to be successful someday. In 2007, Merlie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Merlie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her ninth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sokkunthea

texts.en:
Mr. Sokkunthea C. (was in the photo), age 28 and his wife, Mrs. Sokhorn Yin, age 30, have been married since 2002 and have no children yet. He also has his elderly mother is living with him.  

Sokkunthea is a fisherman. His wife is a garment factory worker. Besides of the business, the couple also grows rice on their farmland in the village. Sokkunthea is requesting his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy motorized hand tiller to use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorized hand tiller

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
A. Ilhomjon is 32 years old and married. His wife is the one who works in their grocery. The plans that he has for his family are to improve their living conditions and to prepare his two children for a profession. Ilhomjon has had the grocery store for 12 years; he started it with his own resources through his work. He wants to increase the sales of new products preferred by his clients. Thanks to loans from IMON International, Ilhomjon will meet his economic plans by purchasing products such as bread, tinned goods, sweets, and juices to grow his revenue.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Flor De Aleli Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Flor de Alelí. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Hueyapan, Tétela del Volcán, en el estado de Morelos, México. El grupo esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinos. Este es su primer préstamo con Fundacion Realidad.
La integrante del grupo la señora Aurelia Pérez A. tiene 56 años de edad, estudio la primaria ya de grande obteniendo su certificado de primaria. Tiene 2 hijos 1 hombre y 1 mujer, Orlando Rivera tiene 30 años de edad y Maria Isabel tiene 22 años de edad. La Señora Aurelia tiene su tienda de abarrotes y vende frutas, aguacates y nuez por mayoreo y solicito su préstamo para comprar mercancía aceite, jabón, papel higiénico, sal, azúcar, huevo, refrescos, chile pasilla, chile huajillo y dulces para surtir su tienda de abarrotes inicio su negocio hace 15 años por necesidad y para sobrevivir, ya que se quedo viuda y su esposo le heredo terrenos con árboles de aguacates, su hijo le ayuda en las labores del campo, abona los árboles de aguacate, la milpa, ella acude al mercado de Yecaplixtla los martes y los viernes a vender sus aguacates y nueces por mayoreo por tonelada, también en Ozumba vende sus productos.  Su hija le ayuda en las labores de la casa y atender la tienda de abarrotes cuando ella no esta por que sale a vender sus frutas, su negocio esta en Hueyapan en Barrio san Bartolo en su casa la tienda de abarrotes llamada Lucero de la mañana y en el campo sus terrenos de árboles de aguacate. Ella tiene una camioneta en la que utiliza para trasportar su fruta y verdura pero esta descompuesta le faltan las llantas y le quiere comprar las llantas para utilizarla en el negocio ya que tiene que rentar una camioneta para ir a vender sus aguacates y nueces. A ella le gusta ir a vender sus frutas el aguacate y las nueces a Ozumba  porque obtiene más ganancias y en la tienda de abarrotes no se ven las ganancias. Su negocio le a ayudado mucho a sacar adelante a sus hijos pues es sola se quedo viuda y pudo sacarlos adelante sola. Las ganancias de la tienda las utiliza en la alimentación y gastos de la casa y las ganancias de venta de las nueces y aguacates las utiliza en seguir invirtiendo, compra árboles de nuez las corta y las empaca, compra abono para la milpa y par los arboles de aguacate, utiliza tractor para barbechar. Sus sueños y esperanza son llegar a la vejez, tener vida y salud para seguir trabajando y que sus hijos estén bien y no se enfermen. Ella esta muy contenta con el préstamo por que va a comprar más cosas para aumentar su negocio.
En barrio san Bartolo en Hueyapan hay muchos árboles, pinos, F., arboles frutales peras, duraznos, tejocotes, manzana, membrillo. Chile manzano, pimiento. El clima es frió. 
Los integrantes del grupo son Marcela Ramírez F. y va a utilizar su préstamo para comprar jitomates, tomates, lechuga, cilantro, cebolla, etc. para comenzar su negocio de ventas de frutas y legumbres, la señora Dominga Sandoval F. va a comprar materia prima platos desechables, verduras, carnes tortillas, condimentos, arroz para elaborar su comida de antojitos Mexicanos, la señora Maria Isabel B. B. va a comprar ropa para dama blusas, pantalones, ropa interior para niño y niñas, calcetas, la señora Francisca B. C. va a comprar fertilizante químico y orgánico para abonar su producción de  durazno, la señora Aurelia Pérez A. va a comprar mercancía para surtir su tienda (reinicio) y surtirse de fruta por mayoreo para vender. 
Las integrantes del grupo quiere decir a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad “Les agradecemos mucho porque confían en nosotros y vamos a cumplir para que nos sigan prestando, gracias por que no nos conocen y nos apoyan con su préstamo”
texts.en:
This group is called Flor de Aleli. It's located in Hueyapan in the Mexican state of Morelos. The group has 5 members, all neighbors who have long known one another. This is the group's first Fundacion Realidad loan. Sra. Aurelia P. A., a member of the group, is 56 years old. She has 2 children: a son, Orlando, 30, and a daughter, Maria Isabel, 22. Sra. Aurelia owns a grocery store and sells wholesale supplies of fruits, avocados and nuts. She is applying for a loan to buy cooking oil, soap, toilet paper, salt, sugar, eggs, cold drinks, different kinds of chiles and sweets that she will resell in her store. She started the business 15 years ago because she needed the income from it to live after her husband died. He left her a small farm planted with avocado trees. Her son helped her with the farm work, fertilizing the fields. She goes to the Yecaplixtla market on Tuesdays and Fridays to sell bulk supplies of avocadoes and nuts. She sells in Ozumba, as well. Sra. Aurelia's daughter helps her with the housework and tends the store when she is away. The business is in her house in the San Bartolo neighborhood of Hueyapan. The store is called Lucero. Sra. Aurelia has a truck in which she carries her goods to market, but it's in poor condition and needs new tires. She has had to rent a truck recently which has been a drain on her income. She would like to sell her goods in Ozumba because she can make more money there at a time when the store is barely getting by. The earnings from the store go to paying the family's everyday expenses. Earnings from the wholesale business are reinvested: buying nut trees; harvesting the nuts; packing them; buying fertilizer for the fields and the avocado trees; and using a tractor to prepare the land for new plantings. Sra. Aurelia's hopes for the future are to reach a ripe old age, in good health and still able to work, and that her children be well and happy. She is pleased to get the loan and she will use it to buy more things for her business. There are many kinds of trees in San Bartolo--pines, flowered trees, pear, peach, tejocotes, apple, etc. The climate is cold. The members of the group are Sra. Marcela R. F., who will buy fruits and vegetables to resell; Sra. Dominga Sandoval F. who will supplies to make Mexican antojitos for her prepared food business; Sra. Maria Isabel B. B. who will buy women's clothing to resell; Sra. Francisca B. Cortes who will buy chemical and organic fertilizers for her farming business; and Sra. Aurelia P. A. who will buy stock for her grocery business and supplies for her wholesale fruit and nut business. To Kiva and Fundacion Realidad, the members say "We are very grateful that you have trusted us and we will fulfill the terms of the loan so that you will continue to loan to us. We thank you because you don't know us and you support us anyway".

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for multiple businesses.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en: Nazia lives in a small city in Pakistan called Vehari. She is 26-year-old lady who married M. A. when she was a teenager. She lives in a three-room brick house with her family.  She is the mother of one son and a daughter. Both of them have not yet started going to school. She makes a decorative ornament called Paranda (an ornament to tie back hairs), which is used by woman and is famous among them as well. Her husband is a private entrepreneur who deals with scrap. He started this business two years ago and it is going well. He buys old & rotted items such as wooden & iron cupboards, bookracks etc and sells on good profit.  Nazia has applied for a loan from Asasah to financially assist her husband who wants to buy scrap for his scrap shop. Nazia is confident that her husband will be able to make positive changes to his business with this investment. This is her second loan and she a very responsible borrower. She used the prior loan ito start her husband’s scrap business.

loans.use: To purchase scrap

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 30 years old married man, father of four kids, from Tripoli. Ahmad is a whole sale business man dealing with Iron, metals and hard wares since 2005.  Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy more products to his work for storage; to the suitable time to sell depending on the market; such as old iron, copper, aluminum and plastic. He seeks increasing his capital. Ahmad hopes to improve and expand his work as he believes it’s a very important business, but it needs increasing capital continuously.

loans.use: To buy more products to his work for storage

loans.name: Blanza Flor

texts.es:
Blanca Flor es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Guaraguaos del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola caracterizada principalmente por producir frutas que son exportadas a diversos países del exterior. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la region del mismo nombre, y se encuentra ubicada a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, en especial ovejas, ella cría a sus animales en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, las suele alimentar de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de estas actividades ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos familiares.

Blanca desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentacion de sus animales de modo que se puedan desarrollar de mejor manera y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive, las personas que le conocen  le consideran una mujer tranquila y entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Flor is a 52-year-old mother who lives with her husband and son in the Guaraguaos hamlet in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area that is known for its product of fruit that is exported to several different countries. This area is a part of the Piura province, in the region by the same name, and it is located over 3.5 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises and sells animals, especially sheep, for a living. She raises her livestock in a corral in her backyard. She usually feeds them natural grains and grass. When the sheep have adequately grown, she sells them to buyers in the area. With the profits earned from the business, she helps her husband, who is a farmer, with the family expenses.

Blanca would like to obtain balanced feed in order to improve her livestock's nutrition so that they can grow better and be sold at a higher price. In order to be able to do this, she feels that it is fitting to request a 1,000 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time.

She is a rather well-known and esteemed woman in the area, and people who know her consider her to be a calm woman who is devoted to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for livestock

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Herlinda;  La socia tiene 54 años de edad;  ella es casada;  La socia se dedica a la agricultura ella tiene sus terrenos en los cuales cosecha cacao, café y también se dedica  a la crianza de pollos, La socia es natural de l valle de la Convención, la socia trabaja sus tierras dos veces al año, ahora ella requiere invertir en la siembra de café y cacao, para lo cual solicita el préstamo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para cacao y cafe.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the MACHUPICCHU community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Herlinda, 54, is married.  She makes a living from farming land that she owns.  She grows cacao and coffee and raises chickens, as well.  Sra. Herlinda is a native of the Convencion valley.  She works the land twice a year and she is applying for this loan because she now needs to invest in seeds for her coffee and cacao crops.  She will use the loan to buy cacao and coffee seeds.

Sra. Herlinda is grateful that this important means of borrowing is available to her and others and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Buy seeds for farming business.

loans.name: Umugisha Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel H. est un commerçant âgé de 53 ans qui habite au Quartier Cibitoke en Mairie de Bujumbura. Il achète des tissus et les fait confectionner lui-même en divers types d’habits et les vend au Marché Central  de Bujumbura, un métier qu’il exerce depuis 25ans. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 2e année de l’école primaire. Il arrive au 7e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 
Il est père de 7 enfants.

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de  tissus pour habits à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Il a préféré demander le crédit à Turame car les bénéfices générés de ce crédit lui aide à assurer les besoins familiaux y compris les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. 

Il  est un des membres du groupe  communautaire« Umugisha».
texts.en:
Emmanuel H. is a 53-year old entrepreneur who lives in the Cibitoke   neighborhood of Mairie de Bujumbura. He purchases fabrics to make different types of outfits from and sells the outfits the Centeral Market of Bujumbura. He has been in this business for 25 years. He has finished middle school. He is now on his seventh group loan with Turam.

 He is the father of seven children. He is seeking a loan from Kiva to boost his capital in order to purchase more cloth for outfits to be sold and thus to grow his savings. He prefers to take out a loan from Turame since the income made possible through this income allows him to provide for his family, including the payment of his children’s school fees. He belongs to the “Umugisha” community group.

loans.use: Increasing his capital by purchasing a large volume for fabrics to make clothing for sale

loans.name: Juan Amilcar

texts.es: El señor Juan Amílcar tiene 62 años, es casado y tiene 6 hijos, ya son mayores de edad. El señor se dedica a la apicultura. El señor dio inicio a este negocio hace 10 años, primeramente el trabaja con una empresa que realizaba este negocio y después, con el tiempo y con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro pudo hacerse de su propia actividad que es el que actualmente posee. El señor está solicitando este crédito ya que piensa comprar pinza, combustible, trajes entre otras cosas que son útiles para la producción de miel. El mayor desafió que siempre ha tenido él como empresario ha sido que algunas veces no ha tenido muchas ventas. De allí nace que su mayor sueño siempre ha sido establecer una empresa familiar y que sus hijos puedan trabajar con él.
texts.en: Juan Amílcar is 62 years old, he is married and has 6 adult children. He engages in beekeeping. He started this activity 10 years ago; at first he was working for a company working in this field, then, in time, with great effort and by saving, he has been able to start his own activity, which is what he now possesses. He is requesting this loan in order to buy tongs, fuel, overalls and other things that are useful to produce honey. The biggest challenge he has always had to face as an employer is the occasional lack of sales. For this reason his biggest dream has always been to establish a family-owned company and that his children can work with him.

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Abra Fidèle

texts.fr: Fidèle a 48 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est née à agou et habite adidogomé.  Pour participer au ménage, elle exerce comme activité la restauration et cumule 5 ans déjà.  Elle s’approvisionne au  grand marché de Lomé et revend à Franciskain  en face de Leader Price adidogomé. Le crédit sollicité  permettra d’acheter 6 tas d’ignames et 5 sacs de maïs pour la restauration et satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Fidele is 48 years old, married and the mother of one child. She is born in Agou and lives in Adidogomé. In order to help provide for the family’s needs, she prepares food for sale. She has been doing this for five years already. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells in Franciscan district in front on the Leader Price supermarket of Adidogomé. The credit she is seeking will allow her to purchase six piles of yams and five bags of corn for her cooking, allowing her to serve more customers.

loans.use: Purchasing yams and corn to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Chhet Phally, 44, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temple. Phally rents a place for tourists at a tourist place in the province, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Phally has to spend USD 11 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  Phally is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome J. is from the village of Central Barangay,Dipolog City. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Salome operates a family member's business in the food sector, making & selling delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Salome joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed for her 'carenderia'. Salome is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for her cooked food vending business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Salome from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her 'carenderia' (cafe)

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr.  julio se dedica a trabajar de pintor de viviendas tanto interior como exterior,  se dedica a esta actividad desde hace cinco años tiene muchos clientes que solicitan sus servicios para el pintado de sus casas, solicita el crédito para comprar una caseta para la venta de sándwich dicha caseta será atendida por su esposa y de este modo colaborar con los ingresos en la familia,  vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus suegros quienes apoyan a julio en sentido material y moral, su familia esta compuesta por su esposa su hija y el, son una familia muy unida se apoyan entre ellos, están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Mr.  Julio works as a house painter, interior and exterior. He has been doing this for five years and has many customers who request his services for the painting of their houses. He is requesting this loan to purchase a hut to sell sandwiches. This hut will be attended by his wife, and this way they will both contribute to the household income. He lives in a home owned by his parents-in-law, who support him materially and morally. His family is made up of his wife, his daughter and himself. They are a very united family who support each other. They are very grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of a hut to sell sandwiches

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr: Samuel M. est client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il a 38 ans, il est marié, et il est né a Rwanda.  Il a 5 enfants entre 1 an et 14 ans, et 4 de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Samuel est soudeur avec a une éducation d’école primaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des portes, fenêtres, ciments, et sables pour la construction d’une maison à louer.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de construire une autre maison pour avoir la maison à louer.  Samuel voudrait assurer la bonne vie pour sa famille.
texts.en: Samuel M. has been a client of ACB since 2007. He is 38, married, and was born in Rwanda. He has 5 children, between the ages of 1 and 14, 4 of whom go to school. He is a welder and attended primary school. He will use this loan to buy doors, windows, cement, and sand to build a house he will rent. To expand his business, his strategy is to build another house to rent. Samuel would like to ensure a good life for his family.

loans.use: Buying doors, windows, sand, cement

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita Ceriaco is one of the oldest members of ASHI-Antique South Branch. She is 64 years old and is from Maybato North, San Jose, Antique, Philippines. She is married to Manuel C., a farmer. 

She has been an active member of ASHI for almost 14 years. Being a member, she joins in the various activities of the institution, which have a big part in improving not only her living conditions but also the social aspects of her life.

Though some of her children have not attended school, she never stop dreaming for their future. She has already fully paid her previous loan and now she is proposing PHP 40,000 for her next loan. This amount will be used to purchase a fishing boat.

This fishing boat will be very useful, not only for her, but also for her son. He will operate the boat and it could provide him an income. She is hopeful that  this project will help her son to send her grandchildren to school.

If they are blessed with a big income, they will repair their house and she also wants to have savings for their future needs.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 34 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de socia Catalina es la crianza y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas, chanchos  y cuyes, ella vende sus animales en la feria sabatina del mercado de San Jerónimo más conocido como “Vino Canchon”, ella en esta oportunidad  desea aumentar el capital del negocio y desea el micro crédito para comprar animales críos como por ejemplo chanchos, gallinas y cuyes. 

Catalina pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Catalina is 34 years old, has four children, and lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is raising and selling small animals such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She sells the animals at the Saturday fair held at the San Jerónimo Market, which is better known as “Vino Canchon”. Catalina is taking this opportunity to increase her business capital, so she is requesting a microloan to buy animals to raise such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs.

Catalina belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Remalita

texts.en:
43-year-old Remalita lives in the town of San Francisco with her family. She is married and has 2 children, aged 15 and 9.

Remalita and her husband are both farmers. They plant and harvest rice crops. They have been doing this for the past 15 years. To fund their farm, Remalita applied for a loan of 6000 PHP. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. Remalita hopes to have an increased harvest and better earnings. She also wishes for her children to go to a university.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en:
Kanan M. is 35 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells candies, rice, cookies, beverages, and many other foodstuffs in his store. Kanan is not alone in this business. His wife actively helps him with sales. 

Today, Kanan is requesting a loan of 1,300 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN) to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Kanan’s main goal is to provide his beloved child with a fairly well to-do life. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase turnover.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie N. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has six children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Winnie has a poultry firm, which she has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more chicken and poultry feed.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Winnie hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Winnie hopes to open up another poultry farm.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert S. is from the village of Panaguitas in the municipality of Kibawe in Bukidnon Province. Robert is 22 years old, and he is single. To make a living, Robert owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, and detergents in the local community. Robert has been engaged in his business for over two years, and he earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Robert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robert has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Robert is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, beverages, and biscuits. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Robert from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages, and biscuits.

loans.name: Elda Alejandra

texts.es:
Elda, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos, ellos se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando maíz y ajonjolí.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para las plagas, estos insumos son muy necesarios para iniciar la siembra, aunque también son necesarios en todo el proceso.
Su objetivo es ayudara a sus padres, generar ingresos que cubran sus necesidades y también la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elda lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department, with her parents and two siblings.  They are corn and sesame farmers.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.  These supplies are very necessary in order to begin planting although they are also needed throughout the process.

Her objective is to help her parents generate income that will cover their needs as well as the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
A. tiene 59 años de edad, tiene 05 hijos que están en su poder. Vive en casa propia,  la cual está ubicada en la parte rural del distrito de tambogrande y no cuentan con los servicios básicos.

Marcelino se dedica a realizar labores de agricultura, teniendo terreno propio de 7.97 Hectáreas para su cultivo. Sus terrenos están en temporada de abonamiento y limpieza.  Marcelino cuenta con  experiencia de 15 años en el manejo de este cultivo el cual ha venido dando muy buenos resultados, la plantación está bien manejada y con buen vigor. 

Marcelino está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000  nuevos soles para que el pueda pagar la mano de obra y comprar fertilizantes para que sus cultivo pueda estar en las mejores condiciones, para el próximo cultivo.

Marcelino es una persona trabajadora, responsable y cuenta con buenas referencias.
texts.en:
A. tiene 59 años de edad, tiene 05 hijos que están en su poder. Vive en casa propia,  la cual está ubicada en la parte rural del distrito de tambogrande y no cuentan con los servicios básicos.

Marcelino se dedica a realizar labores de agricultura, teniendo terreno propio de 7.97 Hectáreas para su cultivo. Sus terrenos están en temporada de abonamiento y limpieza.  Marcelino cuenta con  experiencia de 15 años en el manejo de este cultivo el cual ha venido dando muy buenos resultados, la plantación está bien manejada y con buen vigor. 

Marcelino está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000  nuevos soles para que el pueda pagar la mano de obra y comprar fertilizantes para que sus cultivo pueda estar en las mejores condiciones, para el próximo cultivo.

Marcelino es una persona trabajadora, responsable y cuenta con buenas referencias.

loans.use: Pagar la mano de obra y comprar fertilizantes para que su cultivo.

loans.name: Mayra Monserrate

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mayra, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un  hijo de 4 años de edad el mismo que este año empezó a estudiar en un jardín de infantes. Su esposo es agente de ventas.

Es una gran ama de casa que como realiza el crédito para hacer mejoras en su casa, la misma que está semiconstruida,  quiere realizar el acabado de las paredes de su casa ya que son muy rusticas y a veces le dañan la piel de su hijo cuando este juega dentro de la casa, también quiere una casa más confortable para toda su familia.
 
Para esto ella espera utilizar el crédito para comprar material de construcción, arena, cemento, ripio, etc. Lleva cinco ciclos en el banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido poco a poco cumplir su sueño que es tener su casa completamente terminada.
texts.en:
The members of the Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche Communal Bank meet every fifteen days in the town of Pachinche in the parish of Colon, city of Portoviejo.  The town is known for its hard-working people who are dedicated to agriculture and livestock farming.   

In this town, we meet Mayra.  She is 23 years old and married.  She has a 4 year old son, who began kindergarten this year.  Her husband is a salesman. 

She is a great housewife and will use this loan to make home improvements.  Her home is semi-constructed.  She wants to finish the walls on her home as they are vey rusty.  Sometimes her child hurts his skin when he is playing inside the house.  She also wants a more comfortable home for her entire family.

She hopes to use the loan for construction materials such as sand, cement, gravel, etc. The communal bank is in its fifth cycle. She is pleased because the loans have enabled her to gradually fulfill her dream of having her house completely finished.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, cement, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband. She has been involved in a profession she really likes for the past 16 years. She owns a small shop and her work consists of selling all types of flowers and plants in addition to making original flower designs for special events and occasions. Over the years her work has progressed, and she has been able to build a good business reputation. Today, she is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase flowers and design products. During the summer season, her business operation expands and she has to be prepared to always be ready for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase flowers and design products.

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn is a dealer of herbal products that are highly nutritious and health-giving supplements. She is 39 years of age and married with two children. She lives in Carangan, Ozamis City. For additional income for the family, Cherilyn has been selling food supplements for five years, with a monthly income of PHP 10,000. Cherilyn decided to continue this business because it is in economic demand. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 from GDMPC to purchase natural food supplements to sell.

Cherilyn is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Cherilyn hopes to have a food supplement shop in the city and continue her business worldwide.

loans.use: to purchase  natural food supplement medecine to sell

loans.name: Chibo

texts.en:
Chibo is a married man with seven children, five of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and medical bills.

He has operated a clothes-selling business and a vegetable-selling business, selling from door to door to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is competition from other clothes sellers in the area. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 60,000, he wants to purchase bundles of clothes, sacks of beans, maize flour and sugar. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes, sacks of beans, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 46 years old and married with 5 children. Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. 

Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Eshtiyaq

texts.en:
Eshtyaq from Madaba, Jordan is a 48-year-old married woman.

Eshtyaq is working with her husband in the cultivation of simple plants.

Eshtyaq is requesting a loan of 500 JD to expand her project by buying more plants. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase raw mterials and plants for her project

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is  53 years old and married to Emily. They have five children. He has been farming for a period of four years. He earns a monthly income of KES.20,000. This is his second loan. Jackson will use the loan to purchase more cows and sheep to rear and sell.

Jackson will use the anticipated profits to maintain his business. His hopes and dreams for his farming and family is to uplift and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy more cows and sheep to rear and sell.

loans.name: Colinas Y Asociados Group

texts.es:
Ermelinda es una microempresaria de 36 años de edad, casada y tiene tres hijos y una hija, reside en la colonia Colinas del Poteca en el municipio de Trojes. 

Ermelinda tiene una pequeña pulperia que le permite mantenerse economicamente activa y ayudar con el sostenimiento de su familia. Inició hace tres años vendiendo helados y luego gradualmente fue incorporando productos de la canasta basica hasta tener una pulperia surtida. Aprendió el manejo de su pulperia de manera empirica. Su horario de atencion inicia a las 6:00 am y culmina a las 7:00 pm, y su hija le ayuda a atender a a la clientela. 

Ermelinda a parte de tener una pulperia tambien posee una pequeña cantidad de ganado, y su esposo e hijos le ayudan con el manejo y cuidado. Ella está solicitando este prestamo para comprar un amplia variedad de productos de abarroteria como ser manteca, jabon, azucar, arroz, frijoles, carnes, embutidos, pastas, refrescos, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podra mantener bien surtido su negocio y sus clientes preferiran su pulperia para hacer las compras.

Su meta es mejor la calidad de vida de sus hijos y aumentar su inventario ganadero para que su entrada de dinero sea mas fuerte. Ermelinda tiene seis ciclos en FAMA y ha cancelado sus pagos puntualmente. Su compañera de grupo se dedica a la venta de golosinas.
texts.en:
Ermelinda, 36, is a micro entrepreneur.  She is married, has three sons and a daughter, and lives in the Colinas del Poteca neighborhood in Trojes.

Ermelinda has a small general store that keeps her active financially and helps her support her family.  She started three years ago by selling ice cream, and then gradually began adding basic items so that she would have products for a general store.  She learned how to run the store empirically.  Her day begins at 6 am and finishes at 7 pm with her daughter helping her to take care of the customers.

Besides the store, Ermelinda has some cattle, and her husband and sons help her take care of them.  She is requesting a loan to buy a large variety of products such as lard, ham, sugar, rice, beans, meats, cold cuts, pasta, soft drinks, etc.  This loan will help her supply her business very well and her customers will prefer shopping there.

Her goal is to improve the quality of life for her children and to increase her number of cattle so that she can earn more money.  Ermelinda has had six loan cycles with FAMA and has made all the payments punctually.  Her companion in the group sells sweets.

loans.use: To buy general supplies for her store

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is married with four children.  She is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Bernadeth is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 22 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase fertilizer for the corn.

Bernadeth has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Bernadeth hopes to purchase fertilizer for her corn.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn.

loans.name: Mary Wangeci

texts.en:
Mary is a 43-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 14 years to 18 years. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a cereals sales business where she sells beans, groundnuts (peanuts), greengrams (mung beans), onions etc. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. 

Her business is located in the town of Kakamega. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the temporary business premises that do not withstand bad weather conditions. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to add to her stock of cereals. Her business goal is to grow it to wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fish and electric gadgets for sale

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years. Besides farming, she also has a bookshop in the area.  She is 50 years old, married, and has two school-going children with her husband, David.  

Emily was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client; this will be her first loan. She plans to use the money to buy farm inputs and pay for labor on her farm.  In the future, she hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and pay for labor.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 56 years old, a mother of three adult children. She is helping her husband operate their corn field business. This is their source of income, so they need to keep production improving in order to get much in the next cropping season. Norma needs to acquire additional capital to finance their field's farm inputs. 

Norma is asking for a loan of PHP20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Through this, their farming will be maintained.  With determination and perseverance, she hopes to reap enough crops to pay the loan as well as to continue to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva works hard to support her family. Primitiva is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Primitiva has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Primitiva has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Primitiva would like to save money for the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Don Alfonso, sigue trabajando en su estudio fotografico, pues ha logrado la captacion de sus cliente, devido  a la nitides de su trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien trabaja como secretaria, sus hijos estudiando en la universidad,  con estos prestamos se ha ayudado bastantante, ya que ha logrado mantener sus equipos activos, compra de materia prima, con su credito anterior no logro el objetivo, devido a que tuvo que comprar tarjeta de procesador por que le comenzo a dar problemas.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento comprara dos baterias grip, para seguir, haciendo sus tomas perfecta, para este mes de Diciembre es bueno devido a las promociones de colegio, universidades, aumenta la produccion de sus videos, fotos, y se presenta a muchos eventos, que le dejan buena ganancias.
texts.en:
Don Alfonso continues to work in his photography studio. He has been able to attract customers because of the sharpness of his work. With the help of his wife, who works as a secretary, his children have been able to attend the university. The loans have been of adequate help in allowing him to maintain his equipment and buy supplies. However, he did not accomplish this goal with his previous loan. He had to use the money to buy a processing card because he began experiencing problems with his computer.
