Today this new loan will enable him to buy two battery grips so that he can continue taking perfect photos. The month of December is a busy time with high school and university graduations. By increasing his production of videos and photos for these multiple events, he should generate good earnings.

loans.use: to purchase two battery grips.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses wants a loan to buy a bull to rear. He has a very big farm and rears animals. He generates a lot of milk which he sells at the dairy. He desires to educate his children and also venture into mechanized farming. 

Moses is 44 years old, married, and with eight children. He lives in Masindi, Uganda.

loans.use: to buy a bull to rear.

loans.name: Eric .m

texts.en: This is 34 year-old Eric.  He is married, and has 4 children, aged 14, 7, 4 and 2 years. He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him because he assists his wife doing domestic work.  In 2009, Eric established his provision and drinks business. He started this business to get income that he uses to provide a livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Eric has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy luncheon meat, butter, Peak milk, sardines, mayonnaise and Bond Street. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Eric plans to become a wholesaler, to embark on external and international trade and to send his children to a quality private school.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy luncheon meat, butter, Peak milk, sardines, mayonnaise and Bond Street

loans.name: Jean  Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 41 years old and the father of two children who both go to school. 

He has been running a boutique for the past eight years. With the loan he will buy more items to sell in the boutique like rice, soaps and sugar. With the profits from the business, he will pay school fees for his children and make savings.

He would love to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man, age 31, and a resident of Fort Portal, Uganda, living in a semi-permanent house. He runs a garage, which he started four years back. He started working for someone where he gained a lot of experience and started his own garage. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business dream is to own a very big garage in town. Stephen wants the loan to buy modernized machines for vehicle repair.

loans.use: to buy modernized machines for vehicle repair.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1990 à FARABANA, Fatoumata vit avec son  enfant et son époux dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite Fatoumata s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des habits en provenance de BAMAKO et des pagnes wax de Lomé (au Togo).    
Fatoumata est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  50 pièces de pagnes wax  auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes (Sido, Sélingué, Keleya et Tièlé)  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat d’habits

loans.name: Kéba

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by twelve entrepreneurs from the Sarré Sama association of the village of Kolufifa in the southern Casamance region of Senegal. Represented by their leader Kéba D., the group describes their business:

“Context of the project: Casamance is an enclosed region of Senegal. It has the potential to be rich, but is very poor. Its population is young with a majority of women, who are preponderant in the local economy and constitute the region’s engine of development.

Purpose of the loan: To give a boost to economic activities in the area and to allow the young women of the local area to stay on their land by creating income-generating activities.

Activities: A good area of land will be put to use cultivating sesame seeds, which will be turned into oil after harvest, and the women will make use of the seeds to make cookies which they will sell, and the seeds will also be consumed by the member’s families.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: La Casamance est une région enclavée du Sénégal. Elle est potentiellement riche mais très pauvre. Sa population est jeune avec une majorité des femmes qui sont prépondérantes dans l’économie locale et constituent le moteur du développement.

Objectifs du Prêt : Relance des activités économiques dans la localité, Fixer les jeunes femmes de la localité dans leurs territoires par la création d’activités génératrices de revenus.

Activités : Un bon périmètre de terre sera exploité en culture de sésame qui après récolte sera transformé en huile, et le céréale servira aux femmes de faire des gâteaux qu’elles vendrons et aussi au familles. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Sesame cultivation

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Mina is a young woman of 22 with no children. She has taken over the running of her mother's local food joint. She prepares "banku," a local food made from maize, for residents in her community during the mornings and evenings. She intends to use the KIVA loan to erect a shed to serve as an eating place so that those who wish can have their meal there. This she hopes will help her retain a lot of patrons to sustain her business.

loans.use: Shed Construction

loans.name: Francisca Fidencia

texts.en:
Mrs Francisca is 57, is married and has six children, one of whom is still dependant on her. Along with her husband, she works as a vender, selling chiles, eggs, chickens, coffee, clothing and shoes. Her town is two hours from the city San Cristobal, and many people of the surrounding communities purchase their necessities from her instead of going all the way to town. She wishes, as does her husband, to expand their business by purchasing more merchandise. She belongs to the group Pantelho 9.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

DOÑA FRANCISCA TIENE 57 AÑOS, CASADA, CON SEIS HIJOS Y UNO DE ELLOS DEPENDE DE ELLA, JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO EN LA VENTA DE: CHILES, HUEVOS, GALLINAS, CAFE, ROPA Y CALZADO. SU PUEBLO SE LOCALIZA A DOS HORAS DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL POR LO TANTO LA GENTE DE LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS A SU CASA LE COMPRAN A ELLA LO QUE NECESITAN PARA NO VIAJAR A LA CIUDAD, ESPERA JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO INCREMENTAR EL NEGOCIO Y COMPRAR MAS MERCANCIA. PERTENECE AL GRUPO DE PANTELHO 9.

loans.use:
"Vender"

COMERCIANTE

loans.name: Katiuska

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Katiuska runs a store where she sells hardware and novelty items for the home. She started her business 4 years ago with capital she earned selling typical dishes such as fish soup. Her business has grown a great deal since then.

Loan Use

She wants to purchase more merchandise since her clientele has grown and is currently has construction under way to expand the store next to her home.

Personal Information

She is 30 years old and has 5 kids and her home is of mixed construction. Her goal is to grow the business so that her family's income will be stabalized.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La señora Katiuska tiene una tienda donde vende artículos de ferretería y de novedad para el hogar. Ella empezó hace 4 años con un capital que obtuvo vendiendo platos típicos como sopa de pescado, su negocio ha crecido mucho desde ese tiempo.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella quiere comprar mas mercadería ya que sus clientes han aumentado y tiene una construcción junto a su casa que quiere adecuarlo para ampliar su local.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 30 años y 5 hijos su vivienda es de construcción mixta y su meta es crecer en su local para que un día sus ingresos familiares estén nivelados.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise and upgrade her store.

loans.name: Lina Presentación

texts.es:
Lina is a selfless mother who, through her efforts and work, has brought up her children. She now feels very proud because she sees that all of her children practice the values that she has instilled in them at home. Currently she lives only with her husband and keeps busy 24 hours a day managing the snack bar she built quite a long time ago. The customers who visit her daily always recommend her to their friends and relatives. She sees her clientele increase daily but space get increasingly smaller. Due to this, she has decided to expand the snack bar. At the same time, she wants to offer other services to make her customers' visits more pleasurable. To fulfill this desire, she requests a 325 dollar loan that she promises to repay in 6 months. With this loan she will be able to realize her dreams and improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Lina es una madre abnegada que a base D. esfuerzo y trabajo ha educado a su hijos y ahora se siente muy orgullosa porque observa que cada uno D. ellos pone en práctica los valores que les inculcó en el seno D. su hogar. Actualmente vive sólo con su esposo y se mantiene ocupada las 24 horas del día con la administración D. una fuente D. soda que construyó hace mucho tiempo. Los clientes que la visitan a diario la recomiendan siempre con sus amigos y familiares y ella ha observado que cada día el número D. clientes se incrementa y el espacio se aminora cada vez más. Debido a este hecho es que ha decidido ampliar el espacio en el que se encuentra la fuente D. soda y a su vez desea brindar otros servicios para complacer la estadía D. sus clientes. Para llevar a cabo este anhelo solicita un préstamo D. 325 dólares y se compromete a retornarlos en un período D. 6 meses; con él podrá concretar sus deseos y mejorará la calidad D. vida dentro D. su hogar.

loans.use: This snack bar seeks to expand its facilities to offer more and improved service to its regular customers

loans.name: Hien Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Hien is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She has been running her business for only one year and intends to use her loan to buy more goods to expand her growing business. In addition, her husband can help generate income for the family through his job as a worker in factory.

loans.use: To purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesus and his wife work together in the cultivation of yuca, something he has done since he was very young. Thanks to his work, he's been able to provide an adequate education for his six beloved children. However, they suffered a tragedy when one of their sons was killed by a car at only 16 years old. This led to a very difficult and depressing time which his wife helped him through. Now, six months on, Jesus is ready to move forward, showing the same dedication as always. For the well being of his remaining 5 children who need him, he is requesting a loan to help increase the production of citrus and other fruits which are in great demand. With your help he can grow his business and provide for the well being of his family.

Jesús, es un noble caballero que en compañía de su pareja, se dedica a la producción de yuca, labor a la que se dedica desde muy chico y gracias a el pudo ofrecer hasta hoy una adecuada educación a sus seis queridos hijos; sin embargo tuvo que atravesar por una dura tragedia, una tarde cuando su hijo salía como de costumbre a estudiar el auto que abordo sufrió un aparatoso accidente y por desgracia su segundo hijo de 16 años perdió la vida. Este fatídico accidente lo llevó a pasar por un duro cuadro depresivo del cual su pareja lo ayudó a salir.Hoy Jesús después de seis meses pudo reponerse y desea seguir adelante mostrando las mismas ganas de siempre, por el bienestar de sus cinco hijos que aún lo necesitan, pero Jesús también necesita de usted para progresar y apela a su buen corazón para obtener un préstamo, con los cuales incrementará su producción de cítricos y frutas que le demandan los grandes comerciantes.No se olvide en apoyarlo él lo necesita.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SEEDS AND FERTILIZERS TO GROW HIS BUSINESS AND TAKE CARE OF HIS WIFE AND FIVE CHILDREN.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Thuận is 55 years old. She is a TYM member since 1996, when TYM first opened a branch in Tân Minh district. Before joining TYM, her family of 5 was living in difficult condition, they did not have any capital. They lived in a tiny house. She contracted her first loan, 30 USD, which was used to buy chickens & pigs for raising. Her husband cultivated vegetables, he and his children also worked as laborers to make ends meet. Their lives gradually changed for the better: the meals are more consistent and most importantly, she was able to save money. After 4 years with TYM, in 2000 she borrowed some money plus all her savings, they have built a 4 room house. In April 2007, they have built a 3 room extension to the house to serve as storage. This time she is requesting a loan 0f 650 USD to buy pigs for breeding and 300 chicks to raise, in time for the Tet holidays (new year, in Feb). They have a piece of land (2/10 acre) for vegetable cultivation. Their production is enough to satisfy the demand of the whole Sóc Sơn district. Her husband and 3 children still work in construction to contribute to the family revenue. The family income is 300 USD a month

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuận, 55 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 1996 lúc chi nhánh bắt đầu triển khai hoạt động về xã Tân Minh. Khi chưa vào Quỹ gia đình chị rất vất vả, không có vốn làm ăn, cả nhà 5 người sống trong ngôi nhà 3 gian chật hẹp dột nát. Năm đầu tiên được vay 30USD, chị đã mua lợn, gà về chăn nuôi. Bên cạnh đó, chị Thuận trồng rau để bán, chồng chị cùng các con đi làm thuê để có tiền hoàn trả hàng tuần và tăng thu nhập. Cuộc sống của gia đình chị đã dần thay đổi, bữa ăn đã có nhiều chất dinh dưỡng hơn nhưng quan trọng hơn là chị đã có tiền tích luỹ. Sau 4 năm tham gia Quỹ đến năm 2000 từ số tiền tích luỹ được và vay mượn thêm, gia đình chị đã xây dựng được ngôi nhà mái ngói 4 gian đẹp đẽ và tháng 4 năm 2007 chị lại tiếp tục xây 3 gian nhà phụ để chứa đồ dùng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 650 USD để mua lợn giống và 300 con gà thịt chuẩn bị phục vụ Tết Nguyên Đán. Hiện chị còn có 2 sào rau sạch cung cấp cho người tiêu dùng tại chợ huyện Sóc Sơn, chồng chị cùng con trai hàng ngày đi xây dựng kiếm tiền hỗ trợ cho chị. Mức thu nhập hiện tại hàng tháng của gia đình chị Thuận là 300USD

loans.use: Buy pigs and chicken

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas has been a member of the community bank “Orquideas” for four years.  She joined the bank after two of her daughters encouraged her to do so.  In that time she has learned how to run her business more efficiently.
Felicitas is 46 years old and has nine children.  She sells clothing in the mall of Vilcashuaman, which was a center in the Inca Empire.  She travels four or five hours once a month to attend her bank meetings.
Felicitas needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more clothing to sell.
One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has.  Felicitas plans to use her savings to maintain her business.  Her dream is to own a home.

loans.use: Felicitas needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Loti

texts.en:
Mrs. Loti is 48 years old and is dedicated to the sale of detergents. She sells hers products to the small bordering villages of her city at a very comfortable price. Her dedication to this daily activity is fueled by her motivation to develop personally and improve the education of her beloved children. Her motive is to increase the quantity of products that she offers given that the cleaning products always are needed in the house. With your help this mother with demonstrate to you that with effort and dedication it is possible to get ahead and follow through with anything.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

La señora Loti de 48 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de detergentes, los mismos que distribuye por los caseríos aledaños a su ciudad ofertándolos a un precio muy cómodo, su dedicación a esta actividad diaria, tiene como motivo el desarrollo personal y educativo de su querido hijo.Ella tiene el propósito de acrecentar la cantidad de productos que ofrece debido a que los artículos de limpieza siempre son necesarios en casa y señala que con el su capital no tiene pierde. Con tu ayuda esta madre te demostrará que con esfuerzo y dedicación se puede salir adelante y cumplir con cualquier propósito.

loans.use: Implement her business

loans.name: Prem

texts.en:
Mrs. Prem C., age 27, is a housewife who stays at home looking after her four children and cooking for her family . 
Her husband, Mr. Nai Leak, is a 24-year-old construction worker who is busy building a house. He has been in construction for more than ten years and makes around $5 a day. To raise an extra income to support her family, Mrs. Prem has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy a generator, speaker and musical equipment. Her husband plans to rent them out to people who live in their area when they have a party or celebration. (Mr. Nai is pictured here because his wife was not available to be photographed.)

loans.use: To buy a generator, speaker and musical equipment.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a born farmer. For many years, she has been tied to farm work and since 10 years of age, she has done so independently. She now has her own cows and bulls, which she fattens and sells in her local cattle market and from which she earns the necessary income to support her two children who are in school. She also owns fields in which she sows potatoes and maize, among other vegetables. Her desire to improve her cattle activities has driven her to request a loan so that she may acquire a greater quantity of balanced feed for her bulls and cows.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, es agricultora de nacimiento, desde hace muchos años ha estado ligada a las tareas agrícolas y desde hace 10 años lo hace de manera independiente y tiene ahora sus propias vacas y toros a los que engorda y vende en la feria local ganadera y de los cuales obtiene las ganancias necesarias para poder sostener a sus 2 hijos que están estudiando. También tiene sus terrenos de cultivo en los que siembra papa y maíz entre otros vegetales. Su deseo de mejorar su actividad ganadera la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de alimento balanceado apara sus toros y vacas.

loans.use: Purchase balanced food.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience A. sells refrigerators. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Patience and her three children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en: Sefulu F., 42, is married with 5 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Sefulu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to repair the house. Her husband does all the farming.

loans.use: Purchase equipment such as weedkiller, knives, sharpeners and also chemicals

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with two children aged eight and five. She began selling clothing in 1993. Every day she works from 7am to midnight at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

Rose now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business to increase sales.

loans.name: Esmelda Maria

texts.es:
Esmelda, 44, lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has two children, 8 and 13, both in school. Her husband works for a taxi cooperative. Esmelda gets up very early each morning to dive into selling her products--fish and various kinds of delicious shellfish. They're expensive products but products that sell well because they are an important part of a healthy diet. She's been operating the business for four years. Sales are slow sometimes but very good at other times, Semana Santa (the week before Easter), for example, which was the time she began her business with money she had saved. She didn't have a place to sell her products before, but with good advice and hard work, she managed to establish herself. The requested loan is to buy a range of seafood so that Esmelda can continue to grow her small business and develop her business skills. In the future, she hopes to improve her little shop so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Esmelda tiene 44 años de edad, habita en Villa Reconciliación, es casada y con dos hijos de 8 y 13 años de edad que están estudiando, su esposo es cadete de una unidad de taxi. Doña Esmelda se levanta muy temprano por las mañanas para hincar las ventas de pecados, chacalines y mucho mas variedad en ricos mariscos, son productos caros pero se venden por su alimentación que es comida saludables. En las ventas lleva ya cuatro años, en ocasiones las ventas son bajas, aunque hay otras en que la temporada es muy buena como la Semana Santa, cuando comenzó lo hizo con dinero ahorrado y una señora le daba donde vender sus mariscos, por que no tenia un lugar especifico. Pero con mucho esfuerzo logró poner su tramo. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de variedad de mariscos y así seguir creciendo en su pequeño negocio, y desarrollarse como una microempresaria futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su tramo, para seguir brindando dando buen servicio a sus clientes

loans.use: Buy seafood for resale.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia T., 43, is married with 7 children. She has 5 years of experience in the fish business. She sells to the village and general public 4 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Rosalia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be use to improve business and help out with the family Her husband is a fisherman and does fishing duties.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, fishing spears, fishing boots, fishing torch, timber, cement, sand

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long O. is a villager in Sen Bon village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Pok Soka, is a construction worker. They do not earn much money live on. Therefore, Mrs. Long O. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to feed and to expand her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow and expand her business

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar M.ameen Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar baji is a wife of M. and lives in a city named Borewala in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 33 years. She is the mother of five sons. Her elder son is a painter of doors and windows of houses, the next son makes jewelry boxes, the next works in an army, and her younger sons are in 8th Standard. Parveen baji’s husband has a wood selling business. He has been selling wood for the past 10 years. Parveen baji herself has a thread selling business. She gets thread from old warm clothes. First she pulls the thread out from sweaters and then washes and dries it. At the end she makes a roll of that thread and sells it in shops for profit. She doesn’t care about the pain she takes in the process of thread selling because she focuses only on the profit that she wants to earn. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more warm clothes and sweaters in order to sell more thread. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Sheeman baji wants a loan to buy scrap (plastic bottles and waste papers) for her scrap business. Shakeela naz baji wants a loan to buy iron for her scrap business. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy warm clothes for thread selling.

loans.name: Namasuba A – Gloria Group

texts.en:
Gloria N. is a 42-year-old business lady. She sells imported new clothes in the busy Kikuubo market. Once every week, Gloria travels to Eastleigh in Nairobi Kenya by bus to purchase her stock. On a good day, she can make sales ranging between Ush 300,000 and Ush 500,000, from which she earns an average profit of Ush 30,000 per day. Gloria is using the loan to purchase more trendy clothes like suits, dresses and skirts so as to meet the tastes and preferences of her customers. Amidst stiff and aggressive competition, she retains and attracts new customers through customer courtesy and fair prices.

She is a single mother 4 children between the ages of 23 and 16, and a caring guardian to 2 of her nephews. Besides, a friendly and ambitious Gloria looks forward to transact her business across geographical frontiers. She dreams of independently importing her own cargos of clothes from Dubai and supplying them to other retailers. She desires to see her children excel academically.

loans.use: Purchase more trendy clothes like suits, dresses, and skirts.

loans.name: Roxmeri

texts.es: ROXMERI TIENE 3 HIJOS A LOS CUALES MANTIENE, TIENE CASA PROPIA DONDE VIVE CON SUS HIJOS. ELLA SE DEDICA  A LA VENTA DE ROPA USADA, EL CLIENTE YA LLEVA 6 AÑOS EN ESTA MISMA ACTIVIDAD, ROXMERI VENDE ROPA LOS DOMINGOS EN YAPACANI Y LOS OTROS DIAS EN LAS DISTINTAS FERIAS DE OTROS PUEBLOS. TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA YA QUE LA VENTA DE ESTA ROPA GENERA MUY BUENOS INGRESOS, PERO TAMBIEN HAY QUE TENER MUCHO CONOCIMIENTO DE ESTA ACTIVIDAD. EL CREDITO LO DESTINARA COMO CAPITAL DE OPERACION PARA EL COMERCIO DE ROPA. LOS PRECIOS DE LOS PRODUCTOS SON VARIADOS YA QUE COMPRA DIFERENTES TIPOS DE CALIDAD DE ESTE PRODUCTO. ES SU CUARTA OPERACION Y TIENE MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO ES SUS ANTERIORES CREDITOS, APARTE DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION TIENE CREDITOS EN UNA COOPERATIVA.
texts.en:
Roxmeri has three children whom she supports. She has her own home, where she lives with her children. She works selling used clothing and has done this activity for 6 years. Roxmeri sells clothing on Sundays in Yapacani and the other days in the various markets in other towns. She is very competent and her clothing sales already generate very good income, but also she has a lot of knowledge of this activity. This loan would be destined as operating capital in clothing sales. The prices of the products are various as she buys different types of quality in this product. It is her fourth operation, and she has very good behaviour in her previous loans. Other than this institution, she has loans from a cooperative.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Salimata T.   a 44 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six (6) enfants (2 garçons et 4 filles) à Lafiabougou-Koko, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Salimata T. entreprend l'activité d’achat et vente de  kola qu'elle a apprise avec ses parents depuis l'âge de 6 ans. Elle mène son activité au grand marché de Médine Sikasso. La Kola(fruit d’un arbre des régions forestières) est un produit associé à tous les évenements sociaux en Afrique (sacrifice, cadeau pour signe de respect  et de considération etc)
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ six (6) ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt,  8 paniers de kola. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Sikasso avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des vieilles personnes, des gens organisant les mariages et baptèmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Salimata T., age 44, lives in a large family with her husband and six children (two boys and four girls) in Lafiabougou-Koko, one of the densely populated districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work unsuccessfully, she got started in this work buying and selling kola, which she had learnt with her parents at the age of 6. She operates her business at the grand marketplace Médine Sikasso. Kola (a fruit from a tree in forested areas) is a product associated with all social events in Africa (sacrifices, gifts as a sign of respect and consideration, etc.) Concerned about doing better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso six years ago. After several solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her area, she is on her fourth individual loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. She plans to use this loan to buy eight baskets of kola. These goods are gotten from wholesalers of Sikasso and then sold retail to customers composed generally of the elderly and people organizing marriages and baptisms. She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some Kola

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru: Хайдаров Сироджиддин житель города Яван.Возраст 35 лет ,енат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет мойку в которой работает уже 2 года. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить новое оборудование. Оно необходимо для того,чтобы улучшить качество обслуживания. Таким образом он сможет привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кердит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sirojiddin H. lives in Yavan. He is 35 years old and is married with four children. He has a car wash where he has been working for the past two years. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of new equipment that would allow him to improve the quality of his services and attract new clients. He would pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. is a twenty six year old single mother of one daughter who is currently in primary school. Comfort lives independently with her daughter in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Mampong is mainly a business town.  Comfort sells ready-made textiles such as ladies’ dresses, fabrics, etc. She buys from Kumasi and treks to markets in nearby areas to sell. She also sells soap to the people in her community. Comfort has been in this business for two years. She wants a loan to procure more cartons of soap in bulk so can expand her business and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure ready-made textiles

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar K. is 37 and married with four children who are still in school. Some are in junior high and others in the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Hagar says it is necessary for her to work to make some income to help her husband to support the family. Though a hairdresser by profession, Hagar trades in provisions as well.

She buys provisions such as milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. from wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and sells on a table top in front of her salon. Hagar also sells fresh fish and chicken.

She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure more goods to stock her shop.

loans.use: To buy provisions for sale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana manages a tricycle-transport business in her village in Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan. She is married to Rizal who works as a security guard in Manila. They have three children: Rosalia, 10 years old, grade five; Remegio, 8 years old, grade three and Rina, 7 years old, grade one. Ana and her husband are working hard to send their children to school.

Aside from operating their tricycle, Ana is also engaged in the hog-raising business. This is another source of income that also supports the needs of their family, especially in sending her three children to school.

Ana is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. She plans to use the loan to buy piglets and also to repair their tricycle to ensure its continuous operation. She is hoping that somehow they may be able to surpass life’s difficulties and provide a better way of living for all of them.

loans.use: To buy piglets and to repair their tricycle

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
N. Vũ Thị (1219030732) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. N. has just started operating this business and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from this activity.


In 2003, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to expand her business.  N. is now requesting a new loan of 8000000 VND which will be used to raise additional  ducks.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To raise ducks

loans.name: Komilhon

texts.ru: Солихочаев Комилхон- мужчина торгующий на рынке Худжанда, продуктами питания .Он кредитуется четвёртый год , без проблем и нарушений. На каждый займ он пополняет свой бизнес сезонными товарами. Зимой- шоколадом, летом- напитками, мороженым, соками. Поэтому он решил подать очередную заявку на кредит. На снимке Комилхон на месте бизнеса.
texts.en:
Komilhon S. is a man who sells food products at the Khujand market. This is his fourth year as a borrower without problems or violations. He uses every loan to add seasonal products to his business; in the winter – chocolate, in the summer – drinks, ice cream, juices. This is why he has decided to apply again for a loan. Komilhon is in the photo at his place of business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita A. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 53 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Nenita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 50 years old and married with four children. She hopes for a $350 loan to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She started this business eight years ago. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
"When my parents gave me the 3-hectare (7.5-acre) rice farm after my marriage, I made a promise to them to value it and make it productive," says Edgardo T., 47-year-old father of four children. He is doing his best to become a good father and a provider for his family.

Edgardo would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 and will use the loan to purchase two bags of complete fertilizer and chemicals. The loan will really help him ensure a quality and abundant harvest on his farm.

Now, Edgardo still joins in the CEVI cluster meetings. He obtains from CEVI various services like loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To pay the farm laborer and to buy fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a member of the Semtema A borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 14,14,6 and 3 years.she also cares for other 2 dependents.
 Prisca started her own business selling charcoal 10 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Prisca first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Prisca hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal
